a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Gather the ingredients.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Slice the tops off the bell peppers. Remove the seeds and carefully scrape out the white veins. Chop some of the tops for the filling.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 In a large bowl, combine the ground beef with the cooked rice, chopped pepper tops, onion, minced garlic, diced tomato, Parmesan cheese, tomato paste, 1/3 cup of the tomato sauce, the beaten egg, breadcrumbs, salt, basil, oregano, Worcestershire sauce, and 2 tablespoons of chopped parsley. Mix the ingredients until well blended. Stuff the pepper shells with the mixture.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Add 2/3 cup of water to the Instant Pot and place a trivet (with handles) or baking sling in the pot. Arrange the stuffed peppers on the trivet and pour the remaining tomato sauce over them.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Lock the lid in place and turn the steam release valve to the sealing position. Select the pressure cook or manual function (high pressure) and set the time to 8 minutes.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 When the time is up, wait for 5 minutes and then turn the steam release valve to the venting position to release any remaining pressure.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Top each of the peppers with a generous amount of mozzarella cheese and place the lid back on for a minute or two, or just long enough to melt the cheese.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Remove the peppers and trivet and set aside. Choose the sauté function and simmer the liquids for about 5 minutes to reduce slightly. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Serve the peppers with the reduced sauce and garnish with thinly sliced basil leaves or chopped fresh parsley.
a51e79e6-91eb-49f1-8504-5b92ce5fe076 Enjoy!
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Gather the ingredients.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Add the ground beef to the pan and continue heating on medium-high heat, breaking up the meat as it cooks until it is browned. Drain off some of the fat if needed.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Add chopped onion to the ground beef and continue cooking until the onions are slightly softened.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Add the cream cheese and half of the cheddar cheese and half of the Mexican blend cheese to the ground beef mixture. Mix until well blended.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Pour the dip into a small casserole dish or, if the pan you're using is oven-safe, leave the mixture in the pan. Then top with the rest of the cheese.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the cheese has melted and is slightly browned, about 20 minutes. If you don’t want a crispy cheese on top, then add the cheese at the end and allow it to melt.
41a79479-628e-4118-b6b4-187097d7e369 Top with scallions and serve with thick potato chips. If you are feeling adventurous, drizzle on a little more ketchup or some chopped pickles.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Gather the ingredients.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Lightly butter the cut side of the buns and toast on a griddle, skillet, or grill, or under the broiler. Set the buns aside.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Place a large skillet over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of butter. When the butter stops sizzling, add the onions. Cook, stirring frequently until the onions are soft and just lightly browned, or about 15 minutes. Remove them to a bowl and set aside.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Meanwhile, shape ground beef into four burgers. Make an indentation in the center of each patty.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Place the same skillet back on medium heat. Arrange the burger patties in the skillet. Season the burgers with kosher salt and black pepper and cook them for about 6 to 8 minutes on each side, or until they reach at least 160 F, the minimum safe temperature (USDA) for ground meat.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Place a square of cheese on each burger and continue to cook until the cheese is melted. Meanwhile, reheat the chopped onions on the stovetop or microwave so they will be hot when you assemble the burgers.
206e67d9-4924-42eb-8672-992552cff741 Assemble the burgers. Slather each top bun with about 2 tablespoons of butter. If desired, place lettuce leaves on the bottom bun. Top the bottom bun with a cheeseburger. Top with a heaping tablespoon of the cooked chopped onion. Place the buttered top bun on the onion layer and serve immediately. Enjoy!
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Gather the ingredients.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Remove the ground beef from its packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Chop the onion, celery, and carrot in a food processor, or mince them finely.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, celery, carrot, breadcrumbs, ketchup, milk, eggs, kosher salt, pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce. Using your hands, mix the ingredients until thoroughly blended.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Shape the meat mixture into a round or oblong loaf and place it in a 7-inch baking pan or on a sheet of heavy-duty foil.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Add 1 1/4 cups of water to the Instant Pot. Place the meatloaf in a sling or on the Instant Pot steamer rack or trivet, and lower it into the pot.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Lock the lid in place and ensure the steam release valve is in the sealing position. Choose the pressure cook or manual button, high pressure, and set the time to 40 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally for 15 minutes. Carefully turn the steam release valve to the venting position to release the remaining pressure. To protect your hand from any remaining steam, use the handle of a wooden spoon or another utensil to turn the valve.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine the 2/3 cup of ketchup, the brown sugar, mustard, and a dash of Worcestershire sauce. Bring the sauce mixture to a simmer just before the meatloaf is ready.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Remove the meatloaf from the Instant Pot. Carefully drain excess liquids from the pan or foil. Move the loaf to a plate or platter and drizzle it with the sauce.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Serve meatloaf with boiled or mashed potatoes, or serve it with hot cooked rice.
cd78b41f-e8e9-46c9-b1de-dcd0e52f9f16 Enjoy your meatloaf meal!
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Gather the ingredients.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Select the Instant Pot's sauté setting and add the oil. When the oil is hot and shimmering, add the ground beef. Cook for 4 minutes, stirring constantly.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Add the onion, bell pepper, and garlic to the beef and cook for 2 to 3 minutes longer, stirring frequently.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Add the water to the pot and stir, scraping the bottom of the pot to loosen any stuck-on browned bits.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 In a bowl, combine the ketchup, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard. Add the mixture to the Instant Pot; do not stir.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Lock the lid in place and turn the steam release knob to the sealing position. Choose the pressure cook or manual setting (high pressure) and set the timer for 10 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure come down naturally for 10 minutes and then carefully do a quick release following the manufacturer's instructions.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Cancel the pressure cook function and choose the sauté button. Continue cooking the sloppy joe mixture for 2 to 3 minutes, or until reduced and thickened.
e1695eeb-09c6-4e41-b4cf-4f99fcab7440 Spoon the sloppy joe sauce over toasted buns and serve with chips, fries, or tater tots.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Gather the ingredients.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Open the avocado. Remove the pit and peel and cut the flesh into cubes. Remove the seeds and stems from the sweet peppers and dice them into approximately 1/8 inch pieces. Set aside.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Set a medium skillet over high heat and add the vegetable oil. When oil is hot, add the ground beef. Break up the beef as it browns. When beef has mostly browned, lower the heat to medium-low. Add the packet of simmer sauce and stir into the ground beef. Simmer gently for 10 minutes.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Meanwhile, fill a pot with six cups (1 1/2 quarts) of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Add two teaspoons of salt and the macaroni. Cook for seven or eight minutes, stirring occasionally until pasta is tender. Remove from heat and pour into a colander to drain.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Add the butter and milk to the pot you used to cook the pasta and set it over medium heat. When the butter has melted, whisk the packet the packet of cheese powder into the milk and butter. Add the ground cumin and the cooked pasta. Stir to thoroughly coat the macaroni, then remove from heat.
1544ec72-78a8-4c52-bb7d-950e95eab860 Put about 1/2 cup of the broken corn tortilla chips into a serving bowl. Spoon a third of the mac and cheese over the top, followed by one-third of the seasoned beef, avocado and sweet peppers. Repeat with two more bowls. Sweet a little bit of lime over the top and serve.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Gather the ingredients.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Preheat the oven to 400 F. Line a 9 x 13-inch pan with aluminum foil and spray with non-stick spray.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Make the glaze. In a medium bowl combine ketchup, brown sugar, and garlic powder until fully incorporated.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Make the meatloaf. In a large mixing bowl whisk the ketchup, eggs and Worcestershire sauce until fully incorporated.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Add the meat, onion, bread crumbs, salt, chili powder, thyme, parsley, garlic powder, and brown sugar and mix until well combined.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Add just a little more than half the meat to the pan and form it into a flat loaf. Make a well down the center using your fingers or a fork about an inch deep and an inch wide.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Mix the Gruyere and mozzarella together then add the cheese to the well. Cover with remaining meat mixture, leaving about 1/2 inch of room around the edges to form a dome.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Spread 1/4 cup of the glaze over the top of the meatloaf. Bake for 50 minutes, basting with the remaining sauce every 20 minutes.
8e5ec8c3-c562-49b6-8dfa-868b9582c619 Once the meatloaf is cooked, remove it from the pan, slice it and serve.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Gather the ingredients. Heat the oven to 350 F.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Put the thawed riced cauliflower on a few doubled sheets of paper towel or a kitchen towel and squeeze out any excess moisture. Set aside.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the ground beef and bell pepper and continue to cook until the meat is browned.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Add the taco seasoning and stir until well blended.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Layer about half of the beef mixture in a 2-quart baking dish or casserole; top with about 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Top the ground beef and cheese with the riced cauliflower and another 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Top with the remaining beef and another 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Spoon the salsa evenly over the second ground beef and cheese layers.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Heat the cream in a saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 cup of shredded cheese and cook, stirring, until the cheese is melted, about two minutes.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Pour the cream and cheese sauce mixture over the salsa layer. Top with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Bake the casserole for 30 to 40 minutes, or until hot and bubbly. Garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired.
a6fb2884-8e43-4d88-bdf7-939b9a679484 Serve the casserole with toppings, such as extra salsa, chopped green onions, avocado slices, guacamole, diced tomatoes, sliced olives, jalapeño pepper rings, or sour cream.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Gather the ingredients.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Peel about 12 to 15 large leaves off of the cabbage head.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Drop the cabbage leaves into a large pot of well salted boiling water; cover and cook for 3 minutes. Drain well.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 For the filling, combine the ground beef, rice, onion, egg, milk, salt, and pepper in a medium bowl. Mix well and divide into 12 portions.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Place a portion of the beef mixture (about 2-1/4 oz.) onto the center of each cabbage leaf.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Roll the leaf around the filling, burrito-style, folding in the edges to seal it in.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Fasten the rolls with toothpicks. Place the rolls in a single layer in a large baking dish or an oven-safe Dutch oven.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 For the sauce, combine the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, sugar, vinegar, and 1/2 cup of water.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Pour over the cabbage rolls. Cover with a lid or aluminum foil (carefully avoiding the toothpicks) and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour until the cabbage is tender and the sauce is bubbling.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Remove the rolls with a slotted spoon and discard the toothpicks.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Carefully pour the juices into a medium saucepan and place over medium heat. Stir the cornstarch with 1/4 cup cold water until dissolved. Add to the sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook, whisking constantly until thickened.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Serve the cabbage rolls topped with the sauce.
92147d0e-7c0b-459d-b170-89ed4a4a7a95 Enjoy!
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Remove large outer leaves from cabbage and set aside. Remove core from cabbage. Place head in a large pot filled with boiling salted water. Cover and cook three minutes or until softened enough to pull off individual leaves. You will need 18 leaves.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c When leaves are cool enough to handle, use a paring knife to cut away the thick center stem from each leaf, without cutting all the way through.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Chop the remaining cabbage, still reserving large outer leaves, and place it in the bottom of a large greased casserole dish or Dutch oven.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Rinse rice and cook it in 1/2 cup water until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let cool. Meanwhile, sauté chopped onion in butter in a medium skillet until tender and let cool.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c In a large bowl, mix cooked and cooled rice, cooled onions, beef, pork, salt and pepper to taste, egg, garlic, paprika, reserved sauerkraut juices, and 1/3 cup of the tomato sauce; blend ingredients thoroughly. Don't overmix or the meat will become tough.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Place about 1/2 cup of meat on each cabbage leaf. Roll away from you to encase the meat. Flip the right side of the leaf to the middle, then flip the left side. You will have something that looks like an envelope. Roll the leaf into a small tube.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Add some tomato sauce in between the layers in the casserole dish or Dutch oven. Place the cabbage rolls on top of the chopped cabbage with sauerkraut and top with all the crushed tomatoes, remaining sauerkraut, tomato sauce, and a few of the reserved whole cabbage leaves.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Add enough water to cover completely. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to very low, cover and simmer three to four hours. Watch carefully so stuffed cabbages don't burn.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Serve with pan juices and a drizzle of sour cream if desired, mashed potatoes, and crusty bread.
2900dc11-3274-4b42-99dd-86b0506ad78c Cabbage rolls freeze well before or after cooking and can be made in a slow cooker (see your manufacturer's instructions).
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Gather the ingredients.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Preheat the oven to 400 F/204 C. Oil an 8 x 8-inch baking pan, or similarly-sized casserole dish, or coat with non-stick cooking spray. Set aside.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Place the potatoes in a stockpot and add enough water to cover by 1 to 2 inches and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer just until the potatoes are easily pierced with a knife, and soft enough to mash with a fork.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Transfer the potatoes to a colander to drain, then return them to the pot. Mash them with a wire whisk or fork, and the margarine or oil and salt, and mix well. Set aside.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d In a chef's pan or large, deep skillet, heat the 3 tablespoons of oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions, celery, and carrot, and saute until the onions are soft and translucent—about 5 to 7 minutes. Add the garlic and saute one minute more.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Add the ground beef or vegetarian meat substitute, and cook until browned. Sprinkle evenly with the flour, stir, and cook until well combined. Stir in the tomato paste, marinara or ketchup, salt, and pepper. Pour in the broth, and add the peas and corn (if using). When well combined and thickened, taste and adjust seasonings as desired.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Transfer the meat to the baking dish. Cover with the mashed potatoes, spreading them with a spatula into an even layer. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the potatoes begin to brown. Serve hot.
e73f4b44-a686-418e-9441-e30a1abec82d Enjoy!
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 Gather the ingredients.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 In a bowl, combine the ground beef, finely chopped onion, cooked rice, and seasonings until well blended.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 Cut the tops off of the peppers and remove the seeds and fibers.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 Stuff the peppers with equal portions of the ground beef and rice mixture.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 Place the stuffed peppers in a crock pot; cover with the spaghetti sauce.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours. Or until the ground beef is thoroughly cooked and the peppers are tender.
c7076828-f671-4b07-bf00-fe9cdc647ca2 To check for doneness, insert an instant-read food thermometer into the center of the filling. It should read at least 160 F / 71 C or 165 F / 74 C for ground turkey.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Peel the onion and chop it coarsely.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion to the skillet and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Crumble the ground beef into the skillet and cook until it is no longer pink, stirring frequently; drain well.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Add the garlic, tomato sauce, tomato paste, salt and oregano and basil to the skillet. Continue cooking until the mixture begins to simmer.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Spoon a layer of meat sauce onto the bottom of the slow cooker. Add a double layer of broken lasagna noodles and top with a layer of the cheeses. Repeat the layers with more sauce, noodles, and cheeses, ending with cheese.
a74f43d8-f958-4bf1-8e47-0cbd34e348b4 Cover the crock pot and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Gather the ingredients.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Cut tops off peppers; remove seeds and membranes. Chop edible part of tops and set aside. Rinse peppers under cold water. Place peppers in a large pot; cover with salted water. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain peppers and set aside.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Heat olive oil in a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat until hot. Sauté chopped green pepper (from tops), chopped onion, and chopped celery for about 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, crushed garlic, basil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Preheat oven to 350 F.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 In a large mixing bowl, combine the beaten egg with remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Gently stir to blend; add ground beef, cooked rice, and 1 cup of the tomato mixture. Mix well.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Stuff peppers with meat mixture and place in a 3-quart baking dish. Pour remaining tomato mixture over the stuffed peppers.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Bake in preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the meat mixture is fully cooked. The temperature of the meat mixture should be cooked to a minimum of 160 F.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Top stuffed peppers with a little shredded cheddar cheese just before they are done; bake until cheese is melted.
b623739c-10f3-4ef1-8eeb-3ce4040a7792 Serve and enjoy!
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 In a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add the carrot, celery, and onion. Cook, stirring, until onion is softened and beginning to brown. Add the ground beef and sausage and cook, stirring and breaking up, until no longer pink. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, and water. Add the bay leaf and simmer over low heat for about 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley. Remove the bay leaf and set aside.
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 Heat the oven to 375 F
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 Lightly grease a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan. .
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 In a medium bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon of parsley, and the large egg. Stir until smooth and well blended.
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 Cover the bottom of the prepared pan with a thin layer of the sauce. Cover the sauce layer with lasagna noodles. Top with about one-third of the remaining sauce and half of the ricotta mixture. Sprinkle with a generous layer of mozzarella cheese. Repeat with another layer of the noodles and another one-third of the sauce. Top with the remaining ricotta mixture and more mozzarella. Cover with another layer of lasagna noodles, then top with the remaining sauce and a layer of mozzarella cheese.
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 Cover the pan loosely with foil, tenting somewhat so the foil won't stick to the cheese as it melts.
23824d4e-8021-45ec-9a25-e0bb67b2cbd8 Bake for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer, or until hot and bubbly and the cheese has melted.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Begin by peeling your eggplants. Using a vegetable peeler, begin at one end and remove a strip of peel from end to end. Leave a strip of peel about the same width, then peel another strip from end to end.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Repeat this until your eggplant is peeled in a striped pattern. Peel all eggplant this way.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Slice the eggplants about 1/4 inch thick. Put all the eggplant slices in a large bowl of salty water and let them soak for about 30 minutes. This removes the bitterness.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Slice the green pepper into thin rings. Grate the tomato. Peel and chop the onion finely and fry it in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until tender.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Add the green pepper slices and continue frying until soft. Add the ground beef and fry until browned. Add the grated tomato, tomato paste, and spices.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Cover the pan and let the meat simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Grate the other three tomatoes and put them in a small saucepan.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Add the tomato paste, salt, pepper, oregano, and sugar and let the sauce simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Remove the eggplant slices from the water and blot them dry with paper towels.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Fry them on both sides in vegetable oil until tender and golden brown on both sides. Drain them well on paper towels.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Line the bottom of a large baking tray with the fried eggplant slices to make a single layer. Make sure there are no gaps between the pieces.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Spread the tomato sauce over the eggplant. Next, cover the tomato sauce layer with the meat mixture.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f In a large pan, melt the butter over high heat. Add the flour and turn it around a few times with a wooden spoon.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Add the milk and seasonings and use a wire whisk to make the mixture smooth as it thickens. Your bechamel sauce is ready when it’s the consistency of pudding.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Pour the hot bechamel sauce over the meat layer, covering it completely. Sprinkle the grated cheese evenly over the top of the casserole.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Bake the casserole in a 360 F/180 C oven until the top turns golden brown.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for at least 10 minutes before cutting it into squares.
48cb77cb-2173-4ebe-93e5-9e6726875a6f Serve your ‘musakka’ with Turkish-style rice pilaf.
0647e99b-4725-44a3-9c90-935ce6026ef9 Mix all ingredients together. Don't add all of the water at one time. The mixture should be moist but not so that the meatballs fall apart.
0647e99b-4725-44a3-9c90-935ce6026ef9 Shape meatballs to desired size and place on the oiled rack of a broiler pan. Moisten your hands with water as you work to keep the meatballs from sticking. Alternatively, line a large baking pan or rimmed baking sheet with foil and place a wire cooling rack in the pan.
0647e99b-4725-44a3-9c90-935ce6026ef9 Broil about 4 inches from the heat source for about 5 to 7 minutes, or until the tops are nicely browned. Turn the meatballs over and broil the other side.
0647e99b-4725-44a3-9c90-935ce6026ef9 When the meatballs are browned on all sides, add them to a medium saucepan with spaghetti sauce and simmer for at least 20 minutes.
0647e99b-4725-44a3-9c90-935ce6026ef9 Serve the meatballs and sauce over hot cooked spaghetti, linguini or another kind of pasta.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 F.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Grease a 9-x-5-inch loaf pan or rectangular baking pan or spray it with nonstick cooking spray.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Combine the beef and turkey in a large bowl with the eggs and breadcrumbs. Set aside.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 In a food processor, combine the carrot, onion, garlic, and green pepper. Process until finely chopped.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 In a large skillet, over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the finely chopped vegetables and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Meanwhile, process the mushrooms until finely chopped.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Add them to the vegetables and continue cooking for 1 minute. Set aside to cool slightly.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 In a bowl, combine the ketchup with the mustard, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, red pepper, salt, and black pepper.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Add about three-quarters of the ketchup mixture to the meat and breadcrumb mixture.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Add the sauteed vegetables and mushrooms to the meat; mix until well blended.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Pack the mixture into a loaf pan or shape into a free-form loaf in the rectangular baking pan.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Bake the meatloaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Carefully pour off any excess grease. Spread remaining ketchup mixture over the loaf and continue cooking for 15 minutes.
17c76f57-dea2-4490-9746-6a1e6d2ef862 Serve and enjoy!
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Cut the tops off peppers, dice tops only, and set aside. Remove seeds and membranes from peppers. Try not to pierce pepper flesh as this will prevent juices from leaking out during baking.
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Blanche peppers and fill a large pot half full with water. Add 1 teaspoon of salt and bring to a boil. Add peppers, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain peppers and set aside.
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Cook one cup of basmati rice according to package directions.
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Add olive oil to a large skillet, then heat to medium-high and brown the ground beef. Add diced vegetables and cook the mixture until the vegetables are tender but not overcooked. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, crushed garlic, oregano, basil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Add rice and cooked ground beef mixture in a large bowl, then stir to combine. Add half of the shredded cheddar cheese and stir to blend. Stuff peppers with meat mixture and place in a 3-quart baking dish. Top each pepper with remaining cheese.
2d28fa42-a174-43f4-8719-a5b62987532c Bake at 350 F for about 30 minutes or until cheese just begins to bubble and brown.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Gather the ingredients.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee First, pre-heat the oven to 375 F and lightly grease a loaf pan.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Sauté the garlic, onion, and bell peppers in olive oil for a few minutes, until onions are very soft.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee In a large bowl, combine the onions and peppers with the ground beef substitute, oatmeal, bread crumbs, 3 tablespoons of ketchup, garlic salt, and pepper. Mix well, using your hands if needed.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Press into a lightly greased loaf pan.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven when done.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Combine ketchup, brown sugar, dry mustard, and optional nutmeg, whisking together until smooth.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Spread or drizzle this topping over the top of the loaf.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Cook, uncovered, for another 15 minutes, or until done.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee Let your vegetarian meatloaf cool a fair amount before slicing into it to serve. Keep your loaf uncovered as it cools in order to allow a bit of extra moisture to release. This will help with allowing the loaf to firm up a bit as it cools.
c03975ca-f3da-4c49-9c38-f3b3acc195ee After it has cooled, slice it up and enjoy!
6e9a5286-7604-4817-8e0b-dcc99f285f2c Add olive oil to a large saucepan over medium heat. Once hot, add the ground beef and brown.
6e9a5286-7604-4817-8e0b-dcc99f285f2c Once the beef is no longer pink, add the sauce and soup; stir well and simmer for about 1 hour. The time is not too critical. It just needs to be bubbling for a bit to blend flavors. Season with salt and pepper.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Gather the ingredients.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Heat the oven to 350 F / 180 C / Gas 4. Lightly grease or spray a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef, sausage, and onion. Cook, stirring until the meat is no longer pink and the onion is translucent.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Add the garlic to the meat mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, and crushed red pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 to 12 minutes. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese, the egg, and 1 cup of Mozzarella cheese. Stir until well blended.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 While the sauce is simmering, cook the ziti in boiling salted water following directions on the package. Drain well.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Add the hot drained pasta to the bowl with the ricotta cheese mixture. Toss lightly to blend.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Add 2 cups of the meat sauce to the ziti mixture.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Transfer half of the pasta mixture into the prepared baking dish.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Spread about half of the meat sauce over the pasta, and then top with the remaining Parmesan cheese and half of the remaining Mozzarella.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Top with the remaining pasta mixture.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Then finish with the remaining meat sauce and remaining Mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with the chopped parsley.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Bake for 25 minutes, or until hot and bubbly around the edges.
f95deba8-75bb-44da-895e-ab1a4ab5ca06 Serve with garlic bread and a tossed green salad or Caesar salad.
6a0aec32-2ab2-4237-bc55-c2d5c5a4f054 Heat the oven to 350 F /180 C.
6a0aec32-2ab2-4237-bc55-c2d5c5a4f054 In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic until meat is browned and no longer pink, stirring often to break up meat. Drain well.
6a0aec32-2ab2-4237-bc55-c2d5c5a4f054 Return to heat and add chili powder, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper; simmer for 10 minutes. Add refried beans and 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce. Heat thoroughly.
6a0aec32-2ab2-4237-bc55-c2d5c5a4f054 Wrap the flour tortillas in foil and place them in the preheated oven; heat for 10 minutes. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the ground beef mixture onto each tortilla. Roll tightly and place seam-side down on serving platter lined with shredded lettuce.
6a0aec32-2ab2-4237-bc55-c2d5c5a4f054 Spoon the remaining enchilada sauce over tortillas. Garnish and serve with toppings.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Gather the ingredients.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Heat oven to 375 F.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Crumble the ground beef into the skillet and add the chopped onion.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Cook until the onion is translucent and the ground beef is no longer pink, stirring constantly. Drain off excess fat.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 To the beef and onion mixture, add the minced garlic along with the steak or burger seasoning, salt, pepper, and breadcrumbs. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs with the mustard, ketchup, and Worcestershire sauce.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Stir in chopped dill pickle, if using.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Stir the egg mixture into the cooled ground beef mixture.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Add about 1/2 cup of the cheese and stir to blend.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Pack the meat and cheese mixture into the pie shell and bake for 30 minutes.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Top with the sliced tomatoes and bacon, if using, and then top with remaining shredded cheese.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Bake the cheeseburger pie for 5 to 10 minutes longer, or until cheese topping has melted and the crust has browned.
fa8f89ef-fbc8-435f-a72d-92949a9181f3 Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
e4943513-a2d8-430d-b0f3-a78e56104aef Divide ground beef into three equal parts. Spread each part of the ground beef out on a piece of plastic wrap, spreading into a thin, large square. The meat should be about a third of an inch thick. Spread about one-third of the macaroni and cheese. This might be too much so adjust as necessary.
e4943513-a2d8-430d-b0f3-a78e56104aef Using the plastic wrap, roll the whole packed into a large, hot dog shape, making sure to keep the macaroni inside. Seal the edges of the meat to make a stuffed burger dog. Continue with remaining ingredients.
e4943513-a2d8-430d-b0f3-a78e56104aef Preheat grill to a medium-high heat. Gently place burger dogs over direct heat and grill for about 15 minutes, rolling to cook evenly. Remove from grill, place on hoagie buns and top with melted cheese sauce and jalapenos. Omit jalapenos if preferred.
fea0eb45-0383-4f92-bad8-d1f52aab0d73 In a large skillet, cook the ground beef, onion, bell pepper, and garlic until the meat is browned and the vegetables are tender, stirring to break up the meat. Drain well.
fea0eb45-0383-4f92-bad8-d1f52aab0d73 Add the pasta sauce, diced tomatoes with their liquid, vinegar, sugar, paprika, marjoram, salt, pepper, and water to the skillet with the ground beef and onions and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until the mixture starts to boil, stirring frequently.
fea0eb45-0383-4f92-bad8-d1f52aab0d73 Add the pasta to the skillet and bring the mixture back to a simmer. Simmer the food, uncovered, stirring frequently, until the pasta is tender, about 11 to 16 minutes. Sprinkle everything with fresh parsley, if using, and serve immediately.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Gather the ingredients.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Combine chili sauce, grape jelly, and mustard in the crockpot and stir well. Cook covered on HIGH while preparing the meatballs.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Grease or spray with cooking oil.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 In a large bowl, combine the ground beef with the beaten egg, bread crumbs, Worcestershire sauce, and salt. Mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon or your hands, if needed.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Shape into about 2 or 3 dozen (half-ounce) meatballs or 16 to 18 (one ounce) meatballs. Arrange the meatballs in the prepared baking pan and bake for 12 to 18 minutes, or until cooked through. Alternatively, place a cooling rack in the pan and bake the meatballs on the rack.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Once cooked, discard any liquid from the baking pan and transfer the meatballs to the crockpot. Stir to coat, cover, and cook on LOW for 3 to 4 hours.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Stir well before serving.
f0794c9c-fb71-478d-8253-330203ae2e88 Enjoy!
5d11f18e-46f5-44e7-b066-3e378cd5d79d Gather the ingredients.
5d11f18e-46f5-44e7-b066-3e378cd5d79d In a large skillet over medium-low heat, cook the bacon until just crisp. You can either cook the bacon whole or cut the bacon into chunks before cooking. Once crisp, remove the bacon to paper towels to drain. Leave about 2 teaspoons of bacon drippings in the skillet and discard the remaining drippings.
5d11f18e-46f5-44e7-b066-3e378cd5d79d Place the skillet back over medium heat and add the ground beef and chopped onions. Cook until the beef is no longer pink, stirring and breaking up larger chunks. With a slotted spoon or spatula, transfer the ground beef to the crockery insert of the slow cooker.
5d11f18e-46f5-44e7-b066-3e378cd5d79d Add the brown sugar, dry mustard, baked beans, two cans of drained beans, ketchup or barbecue sauce, and vinegar. Taste and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
5d11f18e-46f5-44e7-b066-3e378cd5d79d Cover and cook on low for 3 to 5 hours.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Gather the ingredients.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Cook one of the eggs in boiling water until hard-boiled and set aside. Reserve the other egg.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the unpeeled potatoes until they are tender when pierced with a fork.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc While the potatoes are cooking, cook the onions, garlic, and aji pepper in the vegetable oil until soft and fragrant.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Add the cumin and paprika to the onions and cook 2 minutes more, stirring.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Add the beef broth and the raisins and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until most of the liquid is gone.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Stir in the green olives, if using.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Season mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and let cool.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc When the potatoes are cooked, drain them in a colander.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc When they are cool enough to handle, peel them, and then mash the potatoes thoroughly (or pass them through a potato ricer).
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste. Chill the potatoes uncovered for several hours, or overnight.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Once the potatoes are very cold, stir the reserved egg into the mashed potatoes until well mixed.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Peel the hard-boiled egg and chop into about six pieces.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc With floured hands, place about 1/4 cup of mashed potatoes in one hand, and make a well in the center.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Fill the well with 1 to 2 tablespoons of the beef mixture and a piece of hard-boiled egg.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Mold the potatoes around the beef, adding more potatoes if necessary to fully enclose the filling, and shape the whole thing into an oblong potato shape, with slightly pointy ends, about the size of a medium potato.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Repeat with the rest of the mashed potatoes. Coat each stuffed "potato" generously with flour.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc In a deep skillet or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches of oil to 360 F.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Fry the potatoes in batches until they are golden brown.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Drain them on a plate lined with paper towels.
74f374c6-8407-4835-ba56-606ba59fb3dc Keep the potatoes warm in a 200 F oven until ready to serve.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Gather ingredients.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Freeze the whole head of cabbage for several hours or overnight. Let thaw for a few hours, then cut around the core and gently peel leaves off (starting at core end) under warm running water. They should be flexible enough to stuff. If not, steam gently to soften.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd If you are starting with a fresh unfrozen head of cabbage: Peel and drop the cabbage leaves into boiling salted water. Cover and cook for 3 minutes or just until pliable. Drain well.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas Mark 4.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd For filling, combine ground beef, rice, onion, egg, paprika, and salt, pepper, and milk. Mix well and divide into 12 portions.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Place a portion of the ground beef mixture into the center of a cabbage leaf.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Roll leaf around filling; fasten with a toothpick.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Place in a baking dish or Dutch oven. Repeat with the remaining ground beef and cabbage leaves.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd In a bowl, combine the tomato sauce, tomatoes, sugar, vinegar, and 1/2 cup of water.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Pour sauce over cabbage rolls.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Cover tightly with a lid or foil and bake for 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until cooked through and cabbage is tender.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Remove the cabbage rolls to a bowl with a slotted spoon. Take out the toothpicks and discard.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Place the pan with juices over medium heat or transfer the juices to a saucepan and place over the heat. Combine the cornstarch with 3 tablespoons of cold water and mix until smooth. Stir the cornstarch and cold water mixture into the sauce; bring the sauce to a boil and cook until thickened.
c78ea110-81a1-4431-b586-37edd44885cd Serve and enjoy!
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Gather the ingredients.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef with the chopped onion. Cook until the beef is no longer pink and the onion is translucent, stirring frequently.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute. Drain well.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Combine the ground beef mixture with the bell pepper, celery, tomatoes, tomato sauce, drained beans, and seasonings. Transfer to the crockery insert of a slow cooker.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Cover and cook for 5 to 7 hours on low, or until done.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Taste and adjust seasonings, adding salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper, as needed.
7730eff5-18bb-4eb3-b7d0-0541090b212d Serve and enjoy!
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Heat the oven to 375 F (190 C/Gas 5).
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Line a large rimmed baking pan with foil.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Wash the zucchini and cut each one in half lengthwise. With a spoon, scrape out the seed portion of the zucchini, taking care to leave at least 1/4 inch of outer shell.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Arrange the zucchini halves in the prepared baking pan, cut and hollowed side up. Set aside while you make the taco beef mixture.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or saute pan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes. Add the ground beef and continue cooking, stirring and breaking up until the beef is no longer pink and the onion is translucent. Drain off excess fat.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Add the garlic to the ground beef and cook for about 2 minutes longer. Stir in the taco seasoning, salsa, and water; blend well and cook, stirring, until hot and bubbly.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Spoon about 1/2 cup of the ground beef mixture into each zucchini shell, mounding it a bit.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Bake for about 35 to 45 minutes, until the zucchini is fork-tender. Top the zucchini with the shredded cheese and continue baking for a few minutes longer, or just until the cheese has melted.
05a0c23a-a6dc-4a39-b88e-2e0b8f61c5af Serve with taco sauce and garnish with lettuce and sour cream or guacamole, or use your favorite toppings. Sliced ripe olives, diced tomatoes, jalapeno rings, or more cheese are all excellent choices.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa In a small bowl or cup, combine the chili powder with the dried minced onion, cumin, oregano, sugar, garlic powder, and the black and cayenne peppers. Blend well and set aside.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa In a Dutch oven or large sauté pan over medium heat, brown the ground beef, turning and breaking up with a spatula as it cooks.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa Drain the ground beef well. Return the beef to the pan over medium heat. Add the chili seasoning mix and stir to blend.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa Add the 2 cans of tomatoes, tomato sauce, and undrained black beans. Stir to blend ingredients.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa Bring the chili to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa Taste and add salt, as needed.
d396eafa-8e21-45ed-acaf-4cf0e7e8eefa Serve with a Tex-Mex cornbread or classic Southern cornbread, biscuits, crackers, or tortilla chips, along with shredded cheese and your favorite toppings.
aa1a52b9-2cdc-4750-bb85-23b452716cd5 Lightly grease a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish. Heat oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
aa1a52b9-2cdc-4750-bb85-23b452716cd5 Slice the tortillas into strips about 1 1/2 to 2 inches wide. Arrange half of the strips in the bottom of the baking dish. Set the remaining strips aside.
aa1a52b9-2cdc-4750-bb85-23b452716cd5 In a large skillet, brown the ground beef, chorizo, and onion, stirring, until beef and sausage are no longer pink. Add the jalapeño peppers and burrito seasoning and stir to blend. Stir in the refried beans and continue cooking, stirring, until hot and bubbly.
aa1a52b9-2cdc-4750-bb85-23b452716cd5 Spoon the hot filling mixture evenly over the tortilla layer. Sprinkle with the diced tomatoes, green onions, and cilantro. Top with the remaining tortilla strips then sprinkle with the cheese.
aa1a52b9-2cdc-4750-bb85-23b452716cd5 Bake for about 10 to 15 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the casserole is bubbly.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf Cut the bacon into small pieces; brown in a large skillet. Remove bacon from the rendered fat and set aside.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf In the bacon drippings, sauté the onion and bell pepper until tender.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf Add the ground beef and brown lightly. Put the meats into the bottom of a crockpot. Add the can of pork and beans.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf Drain most of the liquids from the remaining cans of beans and add them to the slow cooker with the remaining ingredients. Mix well to blend.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf Cook on high setting for 1 hour, and then set to low and continue cooking for 5 to 6 hours. Stir occasionally.
daff613c-dd80-49d2-8b33-6ee64f322acf Check for seasonings and correct if desired, with a little salt and pepper, or more brown sugar or syrup.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e Gather the ingredients.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e Heat the oven to 350 F.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e In a small bowl, soak the bread crumbs in milk.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e In a large bowl, mix the ground beef with the bread crumb mixture, along with the salt, pepper, onion, and the beaten egg.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e Pat the meat mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove the ground beef from the oven and carefully pour off the excess fat.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e Top the meat with the mashed potatoes; sprinkle with cheese. If desired, sprinkle lightly with paprika.
8ac1c9a8-6729-4949-b142-c77fcdf61f2e Return to oven for about 15 minutes longer, or until the cheese is melted and potatoes are thoroughly heated.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Gather the ingredients.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Place the ground beef in a bowl and add the marinade ingredients, adding the cornstarch last. Marinate the ground beef for 15 minutes.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Prepare the other vegetables while the meat is marinating.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Add the oil to a wok preheated on high heat. When the oil is hot, add the ginger slices, and stir-fry for about 30 seconds. (This is to flavor the oil). Remove the ginger slices.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Add the ground beef to the wok and cook, using a spatula to break up the pieces, for 1 to 2 minutes, until it changes color.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Add the chopped onion. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes until it starts to brown and soften.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Turn the heat down to medium, and add 1 tablespoon of curry powder and stir briefly until it becomes aromatic.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Add the rice, stirring and turning it over with a spatula to heat through and break up any clumps. Stir in more curry powder if desired (approximately another 1/2 tablespoon).
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Add the peas and the shredded carrot and combine thoroughly.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Make a small amount of room in a corner of the pan and add the beaten egg. Scramble the egg and then stir to mix in with the rice. Stir in the scallion.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Season with salt and pepper if desired.
386852e9-1f32-4241-bd09-64ebd9f11239 Serve hot and enjoy!
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Line a rimmed baking pan with foil; lightly oil the foil or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Cut the bacon strips in half crosswise and coat them with the 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, if using. Arrange the bacon on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until almost crisp. Remove the bacon from the oven and let it cool.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, pork, onion, bell pepper, breadcrumbs, cheese, milk, egg, Cajun seasonings, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Put the ground meat mixture on the prepared foil-lined baking pan and shape into a loaf.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Spread barbecue sauce over the loaf and arrange the bacon strips over the top.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Bake the meatloaf until the bacon is crispy and loaf is firm, about 1 hour to 1 hour and 10 minutes. If unsure, check the loaf with an instant-read food thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf. The minimum safe temperature for ground meat is 160 F/71 C.
ad918e67-d8df-43ed-b90a-5c42f5e6f647 Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing or moving to a serving platter.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c In a large bowl, combine ground beef with the beaten egg, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, the salt and pepper, 2 teaspoons of soy sauce, bread crumbs, and minced onion. Shape into 1 1/2 in meatballs.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c In a large skillet over medium heat, lightly brown meatballs in the vegetable oil. Drain well. If you prefer, you may also bake the meatballs in a foil-lined rimmed baking pan in a 350 F oven for about 15 to 20 minutes.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c Transfer the browned meatballs to slow cooker.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c In a small bowl, combine vinegar, cornstarch, sugar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and bell pepper; stir to blend. Pour over meatballs.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c Cover and cook on low for 5 to 7 hours.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c In the last 30 minutes of cooking, stir in pineapple with juice. If thicker juices are desired, combine more cornstarch with a little cold water and add, stirring, until thickened.
83d55caa-ab8b-45c2-a2ef-d22c3287603c Serve these sweet and sour meatballs with hot cooked rice or noodles.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Gather the ingredients.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Chop the tomato (or measure out and drain canned tomatoes) and set aside.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Heat the oven to 350 F.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Bring a large pot of water and the tablespoon salt to a boil and carefully drop the peppers into the boiling water. Bring back to a boil, and boil the peppers for 5 minutes. Remove and drain.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Prepare the peppers by cutting around the stem on the top and removing the stem. Remove as many of the seeds as possible without cutting into the bottoms or sides of the peppers.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 In a large skillet, cook the ground pork and beef over medium-high heat until the meat is browned, then add the hot water. Cook until the water evaporates, about 5 minutes, then add the tomato and onion and cook for 10 minutes, stirring often.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Stir the cooked rice, 1 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and white pepper into the meat mixture and stir to combine. Remove from the heat and stuff the peppers with the meat mixture.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Put the stuffed peppers into a baking dish that holds them snugly, and bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
6c85c22f-537b-47ee-85d6-91c75217fe28 Serve and enjoy!
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Gather the ingredients.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a In a 3-quart microwave-safe casserole, place beef, onions, and garlic, crumbling beef to break into small pieces.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Microwave on high for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring once to break up meat.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Microwave on high for 2 more minutes until the beef is browned and thoroughly cooked. Drain off any excess fat, if necessary.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Add spaghetti sauce, water, basil, and uncooked spaghetti in the casserole dish.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Mix gently to combine.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Cover with microwave-safe plastic wrap, venting one corner, and microwave on high for 5 minutes.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Stir well. Cover casserole again and microwave on high for 8 to 10 minutes longer. Stir well.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Sprinkle with cheese, cover again, and microwave on high for 7 to 8 minutes longer until spaghetti is tender.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Let stand 4 minutes before serving; don't skip this step! The food has to stand so the heat distributes evenly and there are no super hot spots you could burn yourself on.
b3b63be2-2057-4a27-b116-c26f7e11241a Serve and enjoy.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Heat the oven to 375 F/190 C/Gas 5.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Unroll the crescent roll dough and press into the bottom of an ungreased 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking pan to form the thin crust (see the photo).
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef, onions, and mushrooms to the skillet. Cook, stirring, until the ground beef is no longer pink and the mushrooms and onions are tender. Add the paprika and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Stir in sour cream until well blended.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Spoon the ground beef mixture into the baking pan and spread over the crust. Sprinkle evenly with the shredded cheese.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until crust is baked and browned around the edges.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Cut into squares to serve.
05d8ad14-6cc7-4efd-8a0b-27cb72a76464 Serve with a side vegetable or tossed salad. Steamed broccoli or roasted Brussels sprouts are excellent choices or serve with your family's favorite veggies.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Soak the bread in some water in a medium-sized bowl. Add 1/2 cup of sweet red wine and let the bread absorb the liquid for a few minutes.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Squeeze the liquid out from the bread, then tear it into small pieces and add it to the ground meat.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Add the garlic, cumin, salt, pepper and eggs. Mix well to incorporate all the ingredients.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Using portions of the meat mixture about the size of a large walnut, form sausage-like rolls about 4 inches long and 1½ inches thick.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Heat an inch of vegetable oil in a skillet and carefully add the soutzoukakia to the pan. Fry them until they're lightly browned on all sides. Drain on paper towels and set aside.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Prepare the sauce in a Dutch oven while the soutzoukakia are frying. Add 1/4 cup olive oil to the bottom of the pan, then add the tomato sauce, sugar, cinnamon and the remaining cup of wine.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Fill the empty tomato sauce can with water and add this to the Dutch oven as well.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Boil the sauce over medium-high heat until some of the water has evaporated and the sauce has thickened. Add the soutzoukakia to the sauce when they've finished frying.
65951a84-557b-4065-a670-129e92c4d9f1 Heat the sauce and the soutzoukakia to a boil and remove from the heat. Allow the sausages to sit and absorb the sauce for a few minutes before serving.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Gather the ingredients.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Preheat oven to 350 F.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Place the raisins in a small bowl and cover with boiling water. Let them plump in the water for 10 minutes.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Sauté the chopped onions, garlic, and peppers in the olive oil until soft and fragrant.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Add the cumin and paprika and cook 2 minutes more, stirring. Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Drain the raisins and add them to the ground beef. Add the beef broth and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until most of the liquid is gone.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Stir in the hard-boiled egg and the black olives. Season mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Remove beef mixture from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup crumbled queso fresco.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b While the beef is cooking, bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Slice the tops off of the peppers and reserve. Clean the inside of the peppers, removing the seeds and veins.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Cook the peppers in the boiling water until bright red and just tender, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain peppers and blot dry with paper towels.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Fill each pepper with some of the seasoned ground beef mixtures. Top with remaining queso fresco.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Place the peppers on a baking sheet, with the tops alongside them (but not covering the filling). Bake the peppers for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the filling is heated through.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Serve warm.
b0f896c1-97b0-422c-a6c2-433b23d1582b Enjoy!
11daf377-d751-485d-8ea8-2f71de820651 Gather the ingredients.
11daf377-d751-485d-8ea8-2f71de820651 Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Crumble the ground beef into the skillet and add the onion and bell pepper. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the beef is no longer pink. Drain off excess fat.
11daf377-d751-485d-8ea8-2f71de820651 Add chili powder, minced garlic, jalapeno pepper, tomatoes and tomato sauce, cumin, marjoram, and thyme. Stir to blend and bring to a boil. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to low; simmer for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
11daf377-d751-485d-8ea8-2f71de820651 Pour the canned beans into a colander; rinse and drain well. Add the beans to the chili and heat through.
11daf377-d751-485d-8ea8-2f71de820651 For serving, consider freshly baked cornbread or cornbread muffins.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Gather the ingredients.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Slice eggplants in 1/2-inch slices.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 In a large kettle, boil eggplant slices 5 to 10 minutes, until tender.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Drain in a colander or on paper towels.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Sprinkle eggplant with 2 teaspoons of salt and place a layer of paper towels on top of the salted slices.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Place a heavy casserole or bowl on top of the eggplant, pressing down to squeeze out excess water.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Pre-heat oven to 400 F. Arrange half of the drained eggplant slices in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 In a large skillet, brown ground beef; drain off excess fat.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Add drained tomatoes, breaking up with a spoon.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Add tomato sauce, garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, pepper, oregano, and cinnamon. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Spread the meat sauce mixture over the eggplant.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Top meat mixture with remaining eggplant slices.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 In a medium saucepan, melt butter.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Stir in flour; cook, stirring, for about 1 minute. Remove from heat.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Gradually stir in milk; return to heat and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Add shredded cheese and continue stirring until cheese is melted and sauce is smooth.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Add a small portion of the mixture to the slightly beaten eggs, beating quickly, then return egg mixture to sauce in the saucepan, whisking as you pour.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Spoon the cheese sauce over the eggplant casserole.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until topping is set.
85c7e084-5758-4661-8568-95cda9a2f7d6 Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 Partially freeze the beef to make it easier to cut.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 If making homemade ginger juce, grate the ginger and squeeze out the juice until you have 2 tablespoons. Cut the partially frozen beef along the grain into thin strips the approximately length and width of matchsticks. Add the marinade ingredients and marinate the beef for 25 minutes.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, rice wine or sherry, vinegar, sugar, water and hot chili oil. Set aside.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 While the beef is marinating, prepare the vegetables and sauce. Cut the celery, red bell pepper, and carrot into thin strips.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 To prepare the batter, combine the flour and cornstarch. Stir in the vegetable oil, and the hot chili oil if using. Add a much water as is needed to make a smooth batter. It should not be too dry or too runny, but should lightly drop off the back of a wooden spoon.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 Heat the oil for deep-frying to 360 degrees Fahrenheit. Dip the marinated beef pieces into the batter. When the oil is hot, add the beef and deep-fry until it is golden brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 Increase the heat to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Deep-fry the beef a second time, to make it extra cripsy. Remove and drain. Clean out the wok.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 Heat 2 tablespoons oil in the wok. When the oil is hot, add the chilies, minced garlic and ginger. Stir-fry until the chilies begin to blister. Add the carrot. Stir-fry briefly, then add the celery, and then the red pepper.
f18474f8-b4a5-4151-8fc3-52c574f724d1 Push the vegetables up to the sides of the wok. Add the sauce in the middle. Heat to boiling, then add the deep-fried beef back into the pan. Mix all the ingredients together. Remove from the heat. Stir in the sesame oil. Serve hot.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Wash the green beans, drain thoroughly, and trim the ends. Cut the green beans on the diagonal into slices approximately 2 inches long.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Cut the beef across the grain into very thin strips about 2 inches long.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Chop the garlic, ginger, and scallions. In a small bowl, combine the dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and sugar. Set aside.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Heat the wok over medium heat. When hot, add 2 tablespoons of oil, drizzling the oil down the sides of the wok.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 When the oil is hot, add the green beans. Stir-fry for 7 to 10 minutes, until their skins pucker and turn brown and the green beans are tender without being mushy. Remove the beans from the wok.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Heat 2 tablespoons oil in the wok on high heat, drizzling the oil down the sides of the wok. When the oil is hot, add the garlic, ginger, and scallions. Stir-fry for a few seconds, then add the dried chilies or chili paste and stir-fry for a few more seconds until aromatic.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Add the beef strips to the wok. Sear briefly without moving, and then stir-fry until the beef changes color. Splash the beef with the rice wine while cooking.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Add the green beans and the sauce. Stir in the scallions. Taste and adjust seasoning, adding black pepper to taste, and salt if desired.
17ef23c6-6104-4d31-9883-e4892ec0cba5 Remove from the heat and add sesame oil if using. Serve hot.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Cut the steak across the grain into thin strips 1 1/2 - 2 inches long.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Place the beef strips in a bowl and add the marinade ingredients (the rice wine or dry sherry, soy sauces, Asian sesame oil, black pepper, sugar, and cornstarch) one at a time, adding the cornstarch last.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Mix well with the beef and marinate for 15 minutes.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Heat a wok or heavy skillet on medium-high to high heat, and add 2 tablespoons oil.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 When the oil is hot, add the beef. Let sear (brown) for a minute, then stir-fry until the redness is gone and the beef is nearly cooked.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Remove the beef from the pan and drain. Wipe out the pan.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Heat 1 tablespoon oil in the wok or skillet.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 When the oil is hot, add the garlic and the snow peas.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Stir-fry the snow peas, stirring continually, until they turn dark green (up to 2 minutes). Sprinkle the salt over the snow peas while stir-frying.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Add the beef back into the pan. Add the chicken broth, water or rice wine.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Stir for another minute to mix everything together.
48fe922d-1fcd-464f-b6ec-5b6c7d644b07 Serve hot.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 Cut the beef across the grain into thin strips, approximately 2 inches long. Add the marinade ingredients, using your fingers to mix them in and adding the cornstarch last. Marinate the beef for thirty minutes.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 While the beef is marinating, prepare the vegetables and sauce: Wash all the vegetables and drain thoroughly, particularly the mung bean sprouts. String the snow peas. Cut the red pepper in half, remove the seeds, and cut into thin slices approximately 2 inches long. Cut the green onion on the diagonal into 1-inch slices. Chop the ginger and garlic.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 To prepare the sauce, combine the water, honey, and black rice vinegar. Mix together the cornstarch and water in a separate small bowl. Set both aside.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 Preheat a wok or frying pan and add 2 - 3 Tbsp oil. When the oil is hot, add the beef. Sear the meat briefly and then stir-fry until it changes color and is nearly cooked. (Stir-fry in two batches if necessary). Remove and drain on paper towels.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 Wipe the wok clean with a paper towel and add about 2 Tbsp more oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry until aromatic. Add the snow peas. Stir-fry briefly, and then add the red pepper, and finally the bean sprouts.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 Make a well in the middle of the wok by pushing the vegetables up to the side. Add the sauce in the middle. Turn up the heat, give the cornstarch/water mixture a quick re-stir and add it to the sauce, stirring quickly to thicken. Mix the sauce in with the vegetables.
86895325-05ed-40f3-b0ec-2a589b835296 Add the beef. Turn down the heat and simmer for a few minutes until everything is cooked through. Stir in the green onion. Serve hot over rice.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Lay flank steak flat on a cutting board and carefully slice it in half horizontally almost all the way, cutting in the same direction as the fibers. Open the steak up like a book, and lay flat.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Squeeze lime juice over the steak and sprinkle with black pepper, kosher salt, oregano, and minced garlic. Use a meat tenderizing hammer to pound meat until it's flattened and evenly thick and in the approximate shape of a rectangle. The grain of the meat should run parallel to the long side of the rectangle.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Lay the spinach leaves over the meat, leaving 1 to 2 inches of one long side uncovered. Sprinkle the cheese over the spinach.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Peel the carrots and slice them into quarters lengthwise. Lay the carrots over the spinach, in the direction of the meat fibers. Cut the peppers into strips and spread them over the spinach. Cut the eggs into wedges and distribute pieces over the spinach. Add the olives, if using.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Carefully roll up the flank steak with the vegetables inside, rolling from one long side to the other, and tie the roll up securely with kitchen twine. Season the outside with salt and pepper.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e To cook on the grill:
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Wrap the stuffed flank steak tightly with foil, and place it directly on the coals. Cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until meat is cooked to desired doneness. Unwrap and let cool, then slice crosswise into thin slices to serve.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e To cook stovetop:
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Brown the flank steak roll in a large stockpot over medium-high heat in a little bit of olive oil, until well browned on all sides.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Add 2 cups red wine and enough water (or beef broth) to cover the meat. Simmer gently until meat is tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool, then slice crosswise into thin slices to serve.
5a7237c2-ca91-4668-9534-e8eb9336341e Matambre slices easiest after it has cooled some, and can be served at room temperature with a salad as an appetizer or starter course. Serve with chimichurri sauce, or with a sauce made from the wine cooking liquid, if desired.​
d6f806ae-9095-4f71-9622-cc1a066838da Cut the beef across the grain into thin slices about 2 inches long.
d6f806ae-9095-4f71-9622-cc1a066838da Place the beef in a bowl and add the marinade ingredients one at time, mixing in well and adding the cornstarch last.
d6f806ae-9095-4f71-9622-cc1a066838da Marinate the beef for 25 minutes.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Cut the beef across the grain into thin strips, approximately 1 1/2 inches long and 3/4 inch wide. Peel and chop the onion.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 In a small bowl, combine the chicken broth, dark soy sauce, sugar, and salt. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine the cornstarch with water and set aside.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Preheat the wok on medium-high heat; the wok is ready when a couple of drops of water sizzle are added.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Pour 1 to 2 tablespoons oil to the wok, drizzling to coat the sides. When the oil is hot, turn the heat down to medium and add the onion. Add the curry powder, brown briefly, then add the water to make a paste.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Turn the heat back up to medium-high. Push the onion to the sides and add the beef in the middle. Sear for about 30 seconds, then stir-fry until the redness is gone, about 2 minutes. Splash the beef with the rice wine or dry sherry while stir-frying.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Add the sauce to the wok. Bring to a boil and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes.
3459c844-82f2-4e44-9aec-0bee4d7fb7e0 Remove the wok from the heat. Give the cornstarch and water mixture a quick re-stir. Stir the cornstarch and water mixture into the sauce. Return the wok to the burner and continue stirring until the sauce thickens. Serve hot over rice.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Place flank steak into a resealable plastic bag.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Combine the remaining ingredients in a blender or food processor.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Pour mixture over flank steak making sure it is well distributed, seal bag and place into the refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Preheat grill for medium heat.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Remove flank steak from the bag but do not throw away the marinade.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Place the flank steak onto the grill and cook for 8 to 10 minutes per side.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 While steak is cooking, place reserved marinade into a saucepan and bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Reduce heat and allow to simmer for 8 to 10 minutes. Reducing the heat can be done using the side burner of your grill.
455219fe-b5a4-419c-9b0e-176b7d9965c4 Once steak is cooked, remove from heat and allow it rest for 5 minutes before carving. Slice meat and top with sauce and diced tropical fruit.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Wash and drain the vegetables. Remove the stems and seeds from the bell peppers and cut them into thin strips. Rinse and thoroughly drain the mung bean sprouts. String the celery and cut on the diagonal into thin strips.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Cut the flank steak across the grain into thin strips. Combine with the marinade ingredients, adding the cornstarch last.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Marinate the steak for 15 minutes.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Combine the sauce ingredients and set aside.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Heat the wok over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons oil to the heated wok.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a When the oil is ready, add the beef. Brown briefly, then stir-fry until nearly cooked through. Remove from the wok.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Clean out the wok if necessary.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add 2 tablespoons oil.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry briefly until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add the green pepper and the celery. Stir-fry briefly, and add the red pepper.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Push the vegetables up to the sides of the wok.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add the sauce in the middle of the wok. Heat briefly, then add the cornstarch and water slurry, stirring to thicken.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add the steak back into the wok.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Add the mung bean sprouts.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Mix everything together.
a1db0aed-ec71-4d18-8ac6-96a011d5596a Sprinkle with the sesame seeds before serving.
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Heat oven to 350 F.
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Trim fat off edges of round steak and pound to 1/2" thick. (If you don't have a meat mallet, a heavy, skillet, rolling pin, or even wine bottle work.)
