6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Season with salt and pepper.
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Line with prosciutto, then sprinkle with 1/4 cup mixed herbs. Sprinkle with pecorino. Roll up and tie with twine.
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Heat oil over medium heat in a medium Dutch oven. (If you don't have a Dutch oven, see below.)
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Add roast and brown on all sides.
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Add wine and reduce, scraping up browned bits. Add tomatoes, garlic, and remaining herbs. Cover and place in oven. (Note: Ingredients should come about 1/2 way up the side of the meat.)
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Cook for 2 hours, checking once or twice to make sure there's plenty of liquid in the pot. (Add water if you need to replenish the liquid.)
6ec1b08d-f001-4790-81e2-09e011ad05ee Remove roast from broth and allow to rest for 15 minutes before removing twine and carving.
aa697ad7-7f94-4481-96c5-6c7fac14efd6 Gather the ingredients.
aa697ad7-7f94-4481-96c5-6c7fac14efd6 Heat the steak, if desired, by putting it in a pan over low heat for a minute or two, or microwave for about 20 to 30 seconds for 5 to 6 slices.
aa697ad7-7f94-4481-96c5-6c7fac14efd6 Assemble the sandwiches with the mayo, mustard, lettuce, sliced tomato, and the steak slices on the toasted rolls.
aa697ad7-7f94-4481-96c5-6c7fac14efd6 Serve immediately and enjoy!
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Gather the ingredients.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Place the steak or steaks into a resealable plastic bag and pour the Italian dressing over the steaks, making sure meat is well coated. Release the air from the bag and seal. Place the bag into the refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Remove the bag containing steaks at least 30 minutes before grilling. Let it stand at room temperature during this time.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Remove the steaks from the bag and discard the marinade.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Season the steaks with salt, lemon pepper, and black pepper.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Place the steaks onto the grill and cook for 6 to 7 minutes per side, depending on thickness and desired doneness.
59785f34-0613-464e-8758-52efa0c65f02 Once the steaks have reached the preferred doneness, remove them from the heat onto a warmed plate and let the meat rest for 5 to 7 minutes before serving. This allows the juices to be evenly distributed. They will run out if you cut the meat too soon. Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Gather the ingredients.
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Using the apricot jam as an adhesive, rim a tall glass with a mixture of equal parts Montreal steak spice and celery salt.
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Fill the glass halfway with ice. Add the hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and Italian dressing.
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Top with whiskey, Clamato, and tomato juice.
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Stir gently to mix and garnish with a creative skewer of your choice.
40e9db8d-bf90-4165-91cf-d1e554a7e512 Serve and enjoy!
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Pat the beef with paper towels to dry and then cut it into bite-size cubes.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Heat the vegetable oil in a Dutch oven or stockpot over medium-high heat.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Add the beef cubes to the pan and cook until browned, stirring and turning frequently.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Slice the carrots into 1-inch rounds. Cut the onions into chunks, and cut the potatoes into 1-inch cubes.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Add the prepared vegetables to the beef along with the beef broth, water, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Tie the cloves in a small cheesecloth bag and add to the stew. If you don't have cheesecloth, a tea infuser will work.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Cover the pan and simmer the stew for 1 1/2 hours. Drain off the liquid into a saucepan.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 In a small bowl, mix the flour with the cold water until smooth and then blend into the hot liquid in the saucepan.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Cook, stirring constantly until thickened.
2e2fe556-4051-4fff-834c-8ffaeee364a3 Add the thickened broth to the meat and vegetable mixture. Remove the cloves.
d71e2a84-73e5-499c-9473-8358ca3376e6 Remove 3 tablespoons of crushed pineapple from can and place into a bowl. Carefully dip out 3 tablespoons of pineapple juice from the can. If this proves difficult to do, place the remaining crushed pineapple in a strainer over a bowl. Press down with a spatula to release as much liquid as you can. This should give you the necessary amount for the recipe. Add remaining the marinade ingredients (soy sauce, minced shallots, olive oil, cider vinegar, honey, minced garlic, minced ginger, black pepper, salt) to the bowl and combine.
d71e2a84-73e5-499c-9473-8358ca3376e6 Place the flank steak into a glass baking dish or plastic container and coat it on both sides with the marinade mixture. Cover dish tightly with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 2 to 12 hours. Turn the steak a few times during the marinating process and replace the plastic wrap over the dish each time.
d71e2a84-73e5-499c-9473-8358ca3376e6 Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
d71e2a84-73e5-499c-9473-8358ca3376e6 Remove the steak from the glass dish. Place the steak on the heated grill. Cook about 5 to 7 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the cut, until done. Remove the steaks from grill once they've reached the desired doneness and let them rest for 5 to 7 minutes.
d71e2a84-73e5-499c-9473-8358ca3376e6 Slice the flank steaks into strips across the grain.
6ce48ebc-3a72-4c2c-a914-66b5d6034eb2 Preheat grill for high heat.
6ce48ebc-3a72-4c2c-a914-66b5d6034eb2 Season rib-eye steaks with salt, black pepper, and onion powder.
6ce48ebc-3a72-4c2c-a914-66b5d6034eb2 Place onto the grill and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, depending on thickness.
6ce48ebc-3a72-4c2c-a914-66b5d6034eb2 Once cooked to your preference (135 F for medium rare and 145 F for medium), remove from grill and let rest for about five minutes.
6ce48ebc-3a72-4c2c-a914-66b5d6034eb2 Serve on warmed deli buns with steak sauce, mayonnaise, onions, lettuce, and tomato.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 In a large bowl, combine the beef broth, oyster sauce, and soy sauce and mix well. Add the steak and stir. Let the steak marinate at room temperature while you cook the potatoes.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Open the package of potatoes or prepare the russet potatoes. Place the potato slices on a kitchen towel and blot to dry. Heat 1/4 cup oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until a drop of water sizzles as soon as it hits the oil.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Fry the potatoes, a handful at a time, until golden brown and crisp. You may need to add more oil as the batches cook. Drain potatoes on a paper towel as you work. When all of the potatoes are fried, drain any oil from the skillet and wipe it out.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Remove steak from the marinade; reserve marinade. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in the skillet and add the steak; stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes until brown. Remove steak from the skillet.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Add more oil to the skillet, if necessary, and stir-fry the onion, garlic, and mushrooms until the vegetables are tender.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Add the cornstarch to the reserved marinade and whisk to blend. Add to the vegetables in the skillet along with the reserved beef and stir-fry until the sauce thickens.
9a239127-7903-4a3e-89ff-fc438f9fd797 Gently stir in the fried potatoes and stir-fry for a few minutes to heat through. Serve immediately
5b01233b-b26d-4bed-8afd-b3366a1a1f50 Cut 1-inch diamonds about 1/8 inch deep in both sides of the flank steak.
5b01233b-b26d-4bed-8afd-b3366a1a1f50 Combine crushed garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar salt, and black pepper in a small non-metallic bowl.
5b01233b-b26d-4bed-8afd-b3366a1a1f50 Place steak in a resealable plastic bag.
5b01233b-b26d-4bed-8afd-b3366a1a1f50 Pour marinade over steak, making sure all surfaces are covered.
5b01233b-b26d-4bed-8afd-b3366a1a1f50 Seal bag, letting out any excess air and place into the refrigerator for 6 to 12 hours.
5a787e3f-4e16-48cd-b113-898a1caeb4a8 Whisk together the vegetable oil, 1/2 of the bottle of beer, orange juice, lime juice, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce.
5a787e3f-4e16-48cd-b113-898a1caeb4a8 Whisk in the garlic, cumin, SazonGoya and salt and pepper to taste.
5a787e3f-4e16-48cd-b113-898a1caeb4a8 Place the flank steak inside of a plastic bag, and more the marinade mixture into the bag with the steak. Seal bag tightly, then leave the steak to marinate overnight in the fridge.
5a787e3f-4e16-48cd-b113-898a1caeb4a8 Heat the grill to medium-high. Remove steak from marinade and grill for 5 to 8 minutes on each side, or until it reaches desired doneness.
5a787e3f-4e16-48cd-b113-898a1caeb4a8 Let steak rest for 5 minutes, then slice very thinly against the grain and serve.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Gather the ingredients.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Place steaks in a resealable plastic bag. Place remaining ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend mixture until smooth.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Pour half of mixture into bag with steaks. Make sure meat is well coated.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Release air from the bag, seal, and place steaks into a refrigerator for 6-24 hours. Store remaining half of marinade in an airtight plastic container in a refrigerator.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Preheat grill. Remove steaks from bag and discard marinade. Grill steaks on medium- heat until they reach the desired doneness. Once cooked, remove heat and let rest.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Meanwhile, place reserved marinade in a small saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 5-6 minutes, stirring often.
c6a75527-3057-418c-a7de-f84a2ad362e1 Remove from heat and serve sauce with steaks.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Gather the ingredients.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Cut the beef into 1-inch cubes.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Place the beef in a 4 to 5-quart crock pot along with the carrots, onions, and garlic.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Combine the beef stock, soy sauce, ginger root, pepper, and hoisin sauce in a small bowl and mix well. Pour over the beef and vegetables in the slow cooker.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Cover crock pot and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours or until the beef and vegetables are tender.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Turn the crock pot to high heat setting.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl using a wire whisk, and stir into the crockpot.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Cover and cook on high for 15 to 20 minutes until thickened. Stir in peas and cook another 10 to 15 minutes until hot.
52694a2f-3fa4-4a8d-bc29-aeca4630ae64 Serve over cooked rice. Enjoy!
6ef2eb30-114b-45aa-a0f7-dac967575e8d Gather the ingredients.
6ef2eb30-114b-45aa-a0f7-dac967575e8d Combine the oil, vinegar, soy sauce, Worcestershire, ketchup, mustard, garlic, pepper, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes in a large measuring cup or bowl.
6ef2eb30-114b-45aa-a0f7-dac967575e8d Put the steak in a large food storage bag or nonreactive container and pour the marinade over it. Seal the bag and turn it several times to coat the meat; refrigerate the steak for 4 to 8 hours. Turn the steak frequently during its time in the refrigerator so the marinade covers both sides.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 Cut the round steak into six pieces. Place the meat between sheets of plastic wrap and flatten with a rolling pin, beating firmly but not so hard that you tear the meat. Remove the plastic wrap and spread each piece of meat with some mustard and set aside.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp over medium heat. Remove the bacon and drain it on paper towels; crumble and set aside.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 In the drippings remaining in the skillet sauté the onion and garlic until tender over medium heat, about 5 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook for 2 minutes longer. Remove onions, garlic, and bell pepper from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Combine the vegetables with the bacon and pickles in a medium bowl.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 Divide this mixture between the beef pieces and roll-up. Tie the bundles with kitchen string. Sprinkle each bundle with salt and pepper to taste. Dredge each roll in 1/4 cup flour; shake off excess.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 Add the butter to the skillet; brown beef rolls, about 1 to 2 minutes on each side.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 Place the carrots in bottom of 4 to 6 quart slow cooker. Top with the beef rolls as they brown. Pour the beef broth overall.
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 Cover and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours until carrots are tender and beef is very tender. Remove the beef rolls from the crockpot; carefully remove kitchen string. Remove carrots from crockpot using a slotted spoon.​
35f60add-8d36-4cb2-b937-7717ff68b171 In a small bowl combine the sour cream and 1 tablespoon flour; mix well, then stir into liquid remaining in a crockpot. Stir to combine, turn heat to high, and return carrots, then beef rolls to crockpot. Cook for 10 to 20 minutes longer or until sauce thickens; season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the carrots and beef rolls with sour cream sauce.
c16f931d-e930-43b8-8caa-a8b882ca2726 Place flat-iron steaks into a resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients and pour over steaks, making sure every inch of meat is coated well. Gently, release air from bag, seal, and place into the refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
c16f931d-e930-43b8-8caa-a8b882ca2726 Preheat grill for high heat.
c16f931d-e930-43b8-8caa-a8b882ca2726 Remove steaks from bag and discard any leftover marinade. Place steaks onto the grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Reduce heat to medium and cook for another 12 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the meat and desired doneness.
c16f931d-e930-43b8-8caa-a8b882ca2726 Once cooked, remove steaks from heat and place onto a large cutting board. Let meat rest for a few minutes before carving. Slice meat into thin pieces and place onto a serving platter. Cover platter with foil to keep warm while you get the other ingredients ready.
c16f931d-e930-43b8-8caa-a8b882ca2726 To assemble: Simply place 3 to 4 strips of meat into warmed corn tortillas and top with guacamole, pico de gallo, and any other condiments of choice. Serve with seasoned rice, refried beans, and lime wedges.
fde39321-7d92-4737-b2ae-b54a656723d7 Combine vinegar, mustard, salt, black pepper, allspice, rosemary and oil in large, shallow glass dish.
fde39321-7d92-4737-b2ae-b54a656723d7 Add steak and onions; turn to coat. Let stand 15 minutes.
fde39321-7d92-4737-b2ae-b54a656723d7 Grill steak and onions 12 to 16 minutes (depending on thickness and desired doneness), turning a few time​ and brushing with marinade during the first half of cooking.
fde39321-7d92-4737-b2ae-b54a656723d7 Once cooked, remove from heat, let meat rest for 5 minutes and then slice steak across the grain.
fde39321-7d92-4737-b2ae-b54a656723d7 Serve with onions.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Cut four of the peppers in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and ribs. Set aside.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Remove the seeds and ribs from the fifth pepper, and chop it coarsely. Set aside.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff In a large skillet or saute pan, melt the butter with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the sliced onions and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until browned - about 15 minutes.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Add the chopped peppers and mushrooms, if using. Continue cooking until mushrooms are golden and the peppers are tender. Remove to a plate, and set aside.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff If necessary, add another tablespoon of oil to the pan, and cook the shaved steak, stirring, until evenly browned. Add the onion and pepper mixture back to the pan. Season the mixture with salt and pepper and the Worcestershire sauce.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Heat the oven to 400 F. Line a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan with foil, or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Fill a large saucepan, Dutch oven, or deep saute pan with enough salted water to cover the peppers (don't add them yet). Bring the water to a boil, and then add the pepper halves. Cover and simmer for about 4 minutes, or until just tender but not too soft.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Carefully drain the peppers and arrange them -- cut side up -- in the prepared baking dish.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Fill each pepper with the steak and onion mixture. Top each filled bell pepper with a generous amount of shredded cheese.
8a0c9472-a4b2-4422-bba4-e50e1931f7ff Bake for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the filling is hot. For a cheesier topping, add more cheese just before the peppers are done baking.
bc1ec3bd-1c0b-41d3-8ec8-db950063efaf Gather the ingredients.
bc1ec3bd-1c0b-41d3-8ec8-db950063efaf In a heavy duty ziplock bag, combine the olive oil, garlic, garlic powder, soy sauce, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper.
bc1ec3bd-1c0b-41d3-8ec8-db950063efaf Cut the steak into serving-sized pieces and add to the bag. Seal bag and massage marinade into steaks with your hands.
bc1ec3bd-1c0b-41d3-8ec8-db950063efaf Place the bag into a large casserole dish and refrigerate for 20 minutes up to 8 hours.
bc1ec3bd-1c0b-41d3-8ec8-db950063efaf When you're ready to cook, preheat either your grill or your broiler for cooking.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 In a large skillet, heat the 2 tablespoons of butter and the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and mushrooms and season with salt and pepper.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture is browned and the moisture evaporates, about 8 to 12 minutes.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Add the chicken livers, garlic, and marjoram. Cook and stir for 4 to 5 minutes longer.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Add the beef broth and cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes until the liquid evaporates. Remove from the heat.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 In ​a nonstick skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Working in batches, sear the filet mignons on all sides, leaving the centers medium-rare. Remove from the heat.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Roll out puff pastry on​ a lightly floured surface to 13-inch squares. Cut each sheet into four 4 1/2 inch squares.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Divide the mushroom mixture between the squares and spread to cover.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Top each square with a filet mignon. Brush the edges with the beaten egg and then bring the edges together and seal.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Place the Wellingtons seam side down on a rimmed baking sheet and brush with more beaten egg.
7b836849-5839-4655-8b77-aa9a589ddad7 Bake for 15 to 25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Let cool on wire racks for 10 minutes, then serve.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 Gather the ingredients.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 In a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil over moderate heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute or until fragrant.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 Add the tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, fresh oregano, crushed fennel seeds, red pepper flakes, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Reduce the heat and simmer, partially covered, until the sauce thickens, about 15 minutes.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 In a large frying pan or cast iron skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil over moderate heat. Season both sides of the steak with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 Cook the steak over medium high heat for 5 minutes on one side until nicely seared. Turn and cook the other side until the steak has achieved the desired doneness to your taste. This will take about 5 minutes longer for a medium rare steak. Remove the steak and allow it to rest in a warm place for about 5 minutes.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 Cut the steak diagonally across the grain into thin slices.
fdedb79a-251c-40d0-bde1-5243fe6d9232 Top with the warm tomato sauce and additional sprigs of fresh oregano, if desired. Serve with arugula tossed with additional olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Gather the ingredients.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Whisk the buttermilk, eggs, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and 1 teaspoon of the pepper in a large bowl. Add the cubed steaks to the bowl and cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour but up to overnight. Make sure to submerge the steaks in the buttermilk mixture.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Whisk together the flour, remaining salt, pepper, onion powder, and paprika in a shallow dish. Set aside 2 tablespoons of the seasoned flour for the gravy.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Remove 1 steak from the buttermilk mixture and dredge it in the flour mixture, coating both sides. Place the steak back into the buttermilk mixture, coating both sides. Then place the steak back into the flour mixture, coating once more. Repeat with the remaining steaks.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Place the steaks on top of a cooling rack over a sheet pan and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Add the oil to a large cast-iron skillet or other heavy-bottomed pan. Heat the oil to 350 F. Add the steaks, frying for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove the steaks and place them onto another clean cooling rack over a baking sheet. Keep warm in a 200 F oven.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Gather the ingredients for the gravy.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Add the butter to the remaining oil and then add the 2 tablespoons of reserved flour. Whisk until the flour is incorporated into the oil. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the flour is lightly browned.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Pour the beef broth and hot sauce into the pan while whisking. Bring the gravy to a boil and then turn the heat to low and simmer, whisking occasionally for another 3 minutes.
91f95d8b-5fd7-43a0-b5d1-fd8551f1a746 Remove the steaks form the warm oven, top them with the gravy, and serve alongside your favorite sides.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Gather the ingredients.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Place elk steaks in a resealable plastic bag. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meat, making sure that all surfaces are well coated. Release air from bag, seal, and let meat marinate for 12 to 24 hours in refrigerator.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Preheat grill on medium-high heat. Remove steaks from bag and discard marinade.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Place steaks on grill and cook for 6 to 7 minutes per side.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Once steaks have cooked to desired doneness, remove and let rest for 5 minutes.
b73adc4a-d8d1-42a7-9a05-3879d852deb5 Serve with sauteed onions and grilled vegetables.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Place the flank steak in a pot with the bouillon, and cover with water.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Bring to a boil and simmer on low for 1 1/2 hours, or until the meat is tender. Remove from heat and let the meat cool in the pot with the juices.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Saute 2 teaspoons minced garlic in 4 tablespoons vegetable oil for 1 to 2 minutes. Add 2 cups water and 1 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Add the rice to the boiling water, lower the heat, and simmer the rice, covered, for 10 to 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and leave the rice covered for 5 minutes more.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil to a skillet, and saute half the chopped onions with the rest of the minced garlic until soft.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Add the can of black beans (undrained), 1/2 cup water, chicken bouillon, cumin, garlic powder, vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt, and simmer on low heat for about 10 minutes, until the liquid is reduced.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Slice the cooled steak against the grain into thin slices. The meat should be very tender and falling apart. Shred the larger pieces into bite-size pieces with your fingers.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Add 2 tablespoons butter to a skillet and cook the rest of the chopped onions until soft. Add the tomatoes, 1 cup of the steak pan juices, and the sliced steak and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Arrange the meat and tomatoes on 1/3 of a serving platter. Place the rice next to the meat, and then place the beans on the other side of the rice, to resemble the stripes of a tri-color flag.
65359064-aebc-444d-a536-439b48cfbdef Serve with fried plantains on the side and enjoy!
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Gather the ingredients.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Combine the marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Place flank steak in resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over meat.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Using the outside of the bag, massage the marinade into the meat, making sure every part of the steak is coated.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Seal bag and place in the refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Remove steak from bag and place onto grill.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Cook steak for 18 to 20 minutes turning occasionally.
e6b04a24-5df4-4247-8000-d1b9f605abba Once the meat has reached the desired doneness, remove from grill and allow to rest for 3 to 5 minutes before slicing.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Gather the ingredients.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Make the chimichurri sauce first. Whisk together the fresh parsley, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, garlic, a teaspoon of the salt, and the crushed red pepper flakes in a small bowl. You can also process this sauce in the food processor for a finer minced sauce. You can do this step up to a day ahead of time. The longer it sits, the more flavorful it will get.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Generously salt and pepper both sides of the steak.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Heat a cast iron skillet or another heavy-bottomed pan on high heat. Once hot, add a tablespoon of butter to the pan and add the steak. Sear on high heat for 3 minutes. Do not move until the three minutes are up. This will guarantee good color and an even sear.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Flip the steak and add the other tablespoon of butter to the pan and crack the two eggs onto the other side of the pan. Generously season the eggs with salt and pepper too. You can fry them in a different pan if you wish.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Cook the steak and the eggs another 3 minutes for medium rare. You’ll know the eggs are done when the whites are set and the yolks are still jiggly. Heat for longer if you want a more well done steak. You can also flip the eggs if you like them over easy.
2f94eedf-db74-4624-9b6e-b2149d8881d3 Top the steak with the chimichurri sauce and serve with a little hot sauce if you like. Wait a few minutes to allow the steak to rest before slicing. Enjoy!
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Gather the ingredients.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Melt the butter in a heavy medium pan on a medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until soft and translucent but not brown, about 8 minutes, watch carefully to make sure this does not burn.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Combine ground pork and chopped bacon in large bowl. Using fork or fingertips, mix until well blended.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Add sautéed onion, garlic, salt, thyme, allspice, cognac, and pepper to bowl with pork mixture and stir until incorporated. Add eggs. Stir until well blended.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Line a 9 x 5 x 3-inch metal loaf pan with bacon slices, arranging 8 slices across the width of the pan and 3 slices on each short side of the pan and overlapping pan on all the sides.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Using hands, lightly and evenly press half of the meat mixture (about 3 1/4 cups) onto the bottom of pan atop bacon slices.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Arrange gammon ham strips over in a single layer.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Top with remaining meat mixture.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Fold bacon slices over, covering pâté.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Cover pan tightly with foil. Place the loaf pan into a baking pan. Pour boiling water into baking pan to come halfway up sides of the loaf pan.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Bake pâté at 350 F until a thermometer inserted through foil into the center registers 155 F, about 2 hours 15 minutes.
e99a8fa6-87f6-44df-9edb-d64f3fd17a5c Remove loaf pan from baking pan and transfer to a rimmed baking sheet. Place heavy skillet or 2 to 3 heavy cans atop pâté to weigh down. Chill overnight.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Place flank steak into a resealable plastic bag.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 In a small glass or plastic bowl, combine 1/4 cup olive oil, white vinegar, garlic, onion, powder, salt, and pepper.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Pour mixture over meat, making sure to coat all surfaces.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Release air from the resealable bag, seal, and place into the refrigerator for 4 to 8 hours.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Preheat grill for high heat. Prepare the topping for flank steak by combining roasted red peppers with parsley, basil, 1 tablespoon olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Remove steak from marinade and place onto the grill grate.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Cook for 8 to 10 minutes per side or until it reaches the desired doneness.
edf4b819-f474-4059-a12e-eda85f1b32a1 Once cooked, remove from heat and let the steak rest for 5 to 10 minutes before carving. Serve with roasted red pepper topping.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Cut the beef across the grain into thin strips approximately 1 1/2 inches long and 3/4 inch wide.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Add the marinade ingredients, adding the cornstarch last. Marinade the beef for 25 to 30 minutes. This recipe contains dry sherry because it is more widely available, but if you want a more authentic option, you can use traditional Chinese rice wine.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae While the beef is marinating, prepare the vegetables. Peel and chop the onion. Blanch the peas in boiling water for 1 minute then prepare the vegetables. Peel and chop the onion. Blanch the peas in boiling water for 1 minute. Rinse in cold water, and drain thoroughly. Combine the chicken broth with the dark soy sauce and set aside.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Preheat the wok on medium-high heat (the wok is ready when a couple of drops of water sizzle when added to the wok). Add 2 tablespoons oil (you can also substitute peanut oil for the canola oil) to the wok, drizzling to coat the sides. When the oil is sizzling, add the ginger. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until the ginger is browned. Discard the ginger.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Add the beef to the wok (to avoid overcrowding the wok, cook the beef in 2 batches if needed). Sear the beef for about 30 seconds, then stir-fry until it is about 80 percent cooked and changes color. Remove the beef from the wok. Turn the heat down to medium.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Add the onion to the wok. Let the onion cook for 2 minutes to brown, then add the curry powder. Add enough water to make a paste. Let the onion cook for a couple of minutes, then add peas.
1143838e-0a7e-48b8-9718-5067fc528cae Add the beef. Return the heat to medium-high, and add the chicken broth and dark soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Stir in the salt and sugar. Cook for about another 3 minutes, and serve hot. You can serve this beef curry with cooked white rice or naan bread as you wish.
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Cut the beef into paper thin rectangular slices. (Freeze the beef for 1 to 2 hours to make cutting easier, or ask the butcher to cut it for you).
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Prepare the side dishes (see suggested list below), washing and draining the vegetables. If using in the fondue, cut the mushrooms into bite-sized pieces. Shred the lettuce or chop as desired.
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Lay the beef and side dishes on separate platters on the table. Place the dipping sauces on the table in small individual bowls.
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Make sure each guest has a complete place setting, including a dipping fork (color-coded if possible) and a small bowl for placing the cooked food.
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Combine the water and beef bouillon and bring to a boil. Turn down to a simmer and add the white wine, soy sauce, green onion, and ginger. Transfer enough broth so that the fondue pot is approximately 2/3 to 3/4 full. (How much broth you need will depend on the size of the fondue pot).
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Place the fondue pot on the burner, and keep it simmering throughout the meal. Keep the remaining broth warming on the stovetop.
48de0e51-d998-4290-9b49-f46910526b15 Use dipping forks to cook the food in the hot broth, and then dip in the sauces as desired.
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb Gather the ingredients.
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb Cut the flank steak into strips about 1 1/3 inches wide.
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, Hawaiian salt, sugar, minced garlic, crushed ginger, and crushed red chile pepper, if using, to create the marinade.
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb Put the beef in a bowl and cover it with plastic wrap, or place the steak in a resealable plastic bag. Refrigerate and marinate overnight
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb Pre heat oven to 175 degrees F. Place meat on a rack, such as a cookie cooling rack. Place rack on a cookie sheet.
a6887aba-26b4-4944-bb09-7cb0872a9ecb Dry meat in the oven for 7 hours. Store the jerky in the refrigerator.
c32da7e1-bdf7-40f5-8a85-36e77dbe01fa Dredge the meat with flour seasoned with salt, pepper, and a little garlic powder.
c32da7e1-bdf7-40f5-8a85-36e77dbe01fa Dip into beaten egg.
c32da7e1-bdf7-40f5-8a85-36e77dbe01fa Press bread crumbs or soda cracker crumbs into the meat.
c32da7e1-bdf7-40f5-8a85-36e77dbe01fa Fry in about 1/2 inch of hot oil (approximately 350 F) until golden brown.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Use a sharp carving knife or a cleaver to cut the steak into thin slices that are about 1/8 inch thick and 1 1/2 to 2 inches long. If you like, go one step further and lay the strips on top of one another and cut again into thin strips.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Measure out the stir-fry sauce into a small bowl or a measuring cup. Chop the garlic and set aside.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Heat a wok or heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it is almost smoking. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil, tilting the wok and drizzling the oil so that it coats the sides of the pan.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 When the oil is hot, add half of the chopped garlic. You can test to see if the oil is hot by dropping in a small piece of garlic. If it sizzles, the oil is ready.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Stir fry the garlic for 10 seconds.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Add the beef by laying it flat in the pan. Let it brown briefly, then stir-fry the beef until it loses its redness and is nearly cooked through.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Remove the stir-fried beef and drain in a colander or on paper towels.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil of in the same wok or skillet. When the oil is hot, add the remainder of the garlic. Stir-fry for 10 seconds.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Add the frozen vegetables. Stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or according to package directions. Splash the vegetables with a bit of water if the vegetables begin to dry out while you are stir-frying.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Add the stir-fried beef back into the pan. Add the stir-fry sauce and bring to a boil. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 more minutes to mix everything together.
8fb888d9-2da8-4d26-a90e-1411236c2ad9 Serve hot over cooked rice.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Cut steak into 2" x 1/2" strips and set aside.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c In a medium bowl, combine broth, vinegar, ketchup, soy sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, ginger, and pepper; mix well.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Add meat and set aside for about 10 minutes.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Prepare all vegetables and place them, in the order they will be cooked, on plates next to the stove.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c In large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium-high heat.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Remove steak from marinade; reserve marinade.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Add steak to the hot oil and stir-fry until browned but still pink inside. Remove from wok.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Add onion to wok; stir-fry for 2 minutes.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Add garlic, bell pepper, and mushrooms; stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes longer until crisp-tender.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Return beef and any accumulated juices to pan.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Stir the reserved marinade and add to wok; stir-fry until sauce thickens.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Add grape tomatoes and stir-fry for one minute.
cf2464e7-2a31-4d46-8dbc-ec68d418643c Serve over hot cooked rice, if desired.
3fe7ae4b-c432-44c9-9bfc-8f052b30c4ad Mix all the ingredients except the flank steak together and mix well. Place the flank steak in a shallow baking dish or resealable bag with the marinade for 4 to 6 hours in the refrigerator.
3fe7ae4b-c432-44c9-9bfc-8f052b30c4ad Remove steaks from marinade and reserve.
3fe7ae4b-c432-44c9-9bfc-8f052b30c4ad Grill steaks to desired doneness (about 5 minutes on each side).
3fe7ae4b-c432-44c9-9bfc-8f052b30c4ad Heat the marinade in a saucepan for 10 minutes.
3fe7ae4b-c432-44c9-9bfc-8f052b30c4ad Cut steaks diagonally into thin slices. Pour marinade over steaks and serve.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 In a large plastic zip-top bag or plastic container with a tight lid, combine the steak, Dijon mustard, garlic, Guinness, salt, and pepper. Close the bag or container and shake it well to evenly distribute the marinade.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 Put the marinating steak in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 Remove the steak from the fridge and let it come to room temperature while you prepare the grill.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 Set the grill to high heat, or about 450 F.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 Grill the steak for 4 to 5 minutes for each side, double-checking the internal temperature with an internal meat thermometer.
720b01d1-1216-4b2a-9a11-2d244197ead6 Remove the steak from the grill, and let it rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 Place fish steaks on a large rimmed baking tray. Drizzle lemon/lime juice over them and sprinkle salt to taste. Turn pieces to coat with marinade thoroughly. Set aside for 20 minutes.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 In a blender, add coconut, chilies, coriander, and mint leaves, ginger and garlic, cumin and turmeric powders, and salt. Blend to a smooth paste. Add as little water as possible, if necessary.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 Divide paste into 2 portions, and use each portion to coat the pieces of fish on each side thoroughly. Set aside.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 Pat dry the banana leaf pieces and smear lightly with oil on the smooth side. Place one piece of fish in the center of each piece of leaf and wrap into a neat parcel. Tie with twine or cotton string.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 Cook in a steamer for 15 to 20 minutes.
6b8ed950-1a61-497c-9384-d6464acd0196 Place each piece in the center of a plate and serve immediately.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Gather the ingredients.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, ranch dressing mix, and pepper in a medium bowl. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the dressing mixture until it is time to make the salad.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Put the diced bacon in a large skillet and place it over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until it is browned and beginning to crisp. Use a slotted spatula to remove the bacon to paper towels to drain. Let the bacon drippings cool slightly and then pour them into a container to use in future dishes.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; add the rotini and turn the heat down to maintain a gentle boil and cook according to the package directions, usually about 7 to 9 minutes. Drain the pasta and let it cool.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Put the cooled pasta in a large bowl and add the cooked drained bacon, the halved tomatoes, diced celery, and olives to the bowl. Toss gently to combine.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Add the dressing mixture and gently fold it in until the pasta and vegetables are well coated.
6709db00-2c69-42f6-8bb3-6778072df308 Transfer the pasta salad to a serving bowl; cover and refrigerate until serving time.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Gather the ingredients.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Rinse the pork belly under cold water.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Pat it dry with paper towels or a clean dishcloth.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Combine the maple syrup, salt, pepper, and curing salt (if using) in a small bowl.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Rub the seasoning mixture into all sides of the pork belly, using your scrupulously cleaned hands. Spend a couple of minutes massaging the seasoning/curing mixture into the meat.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Place the pork belly, along with any leftover curing mixture, into a plastic bag and seal it shut.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Store it lengthwise in the refrigerator for 10 to 14 days, turning the bag over occasionally. The bacon should be fully cured at this point, with a firm texture and no soft spots.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Preheat oven to 200 F. Rinse the bacon.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Again pat it thoroughly dry with paper towels or a clean, dry dishtowel.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Roast the cured bacon in a 200 F oven until the internal temperature reaches 150 F. This should take about two hours.
55934b71-5ec1-4e58-8506-10c6ea336086 Store the bacon in a tightly sealed container or bag in the refrigerator for up to a month or in the freezer for up to a year.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Gather the ingredients.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Preheat the oven to 445 F / 170 C / Gas 3.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Mince all the roughly chopped meats in a hand mincer.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Place the minced meat into a large bowl. Add the breadcrumbs, the onion, the herbs, spices, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Mix thoroughly.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Wet your hands under running cold water, then divide and roll the minced meat mixture into 8 evenly-sized balls.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Wrap each ball in caul or streaky bacon, making sure the caul or bacon overlaps and is secure.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Place the faggots onto a baking sheet.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Bake in the hot oven for 50 to 60 minutes.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Once cooked, remove from the oven and serve immediately. If you are not ready to eat the faggots then wrap in foil and keep warm.
aeb03adc-5d72-4989-9914-1145b8719eb7 Enjoy!
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Gather the ingredients.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Add the diced bacon to a small sauté pan. Sauté until crispy. Drain the bacon bits from the grease onto a paper towel-lined plate, but leave the grease behind in the pan. Set the pan aside.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Bring the water to boil in a small saucepan along with the whites of the scallion, the butter, and a teaspoon of the salt.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Stir in the quick-cooking oats and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until soft. Cover and set aside.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 While the oats are cooking, turn the heat to medium low on the saute pan filled with bacon grease. Crack the egg into the bacon grease in the small pan. Season the top of the egg with the remaining salt and cracked black pepper. Cook on medium low heat for about 3 minutes or until the whites have set and the yolk is still runny. Baste the top of the eggs with the hot bacon grease to slightly set the top of the egg. Leave the egg in the pan and set aside.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Heat the heavy cream in the microwave for about 40 seconds or until hot. Add the warm oatmeal to your serving bowl and pour the hot cream over the top.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Top the oatmeal with the shredded cheddar cheese and then the egg, bacon bits, and scallion greens.
7fa2ebce-c1a1-4dbd-be07-f277a4de21d0 Serve immediately with more salt and pepper if desired. You can also add a drizzle of hot sauce or Sriracha.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 F.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Heat the tablespoon of butter in an omelet pan.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Pour the eggs into the omelet pan and scramble until completely cooked. Set aside.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Chop the bacon finely and set aside.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Unroll the crescent dough and separate the triangles.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Place a tablespoon of the egg mixture, and a sprinkle of bacon and cheese over the egg.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Roll up the triangle as you would a regular crescent roll.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Place the roll on an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough.
4c124b2d-daae-428f-a5f7-382836d6b47d Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve and enjoy!
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, milk, and cream.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Microwave on high for 1 minute, then remove from the microwave oven and stir with a wire whisk.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Microwave for 1 minute longer, remove, and stir again until the mixture is creamy and smooth.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Let cool for 5 minutes.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Beat the eggs and 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese into the cream cheese mixture with a wire whisk and set aside.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Cook the pasta when the water comes to a boil until just al dente according to package directions.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water in a small bowl, then drain the pasta into a colander placed in the sink.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Return the pasta to the hot pot and immediately stir in the cream cheese mixture, adding enough reserved pasta water as needed to make a smooth and creamy sauce.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Stir in the bacon.
ff61c5d3-56ae-4e87-a9f5-4a1640d68d6c Serve immediately, topped with more Parmesan cheese.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 Gather the ingredients.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 Preheat the air fryer to 350 F.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 Place about 6 strips of the bacon across the air fryer. For flatter bacon you can trim it to fit the basket exactly. If you don’t mind the bacon curling, you can just add the longer pieces and the edges will roll over.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 Cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until the bacon is crispy. If you want the bacon less crispy you can take it out a minute earlier. If you like it crispier then leave it in for an additional minute.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 If you are using a thicker cut of bacon then leave it in for a minute or two longer. You can pause the air fryer as much as you like in order to get the bacon to your ideal doneness.
ce397b06-b79c-4b28-876c-ed35841d9d39 After you are finished cooking the first batch, make sure to pour out some of the grease from the bottom of the air fryer. This will help prevent excessive smoking.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Gather the ingredients.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Place a large skillet over medium heat. When the skillet is hot, add the bacon.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Cook until the bacon is browned and crisp, turning frequently.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Remove the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Set aside.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Cook macaroni in boiling salted water following package directions.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Drain the macaroni in a colander, rinse with hot water, and set aside.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Heat oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Lightly grease a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the 3 tablespoons of butter. Add the green onions and garlic powder. Cook, stirring, for about 1 minute.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Add the flour, to create the roux, and stir until well blended and smooth. Continue cooking, stirring, for 2 minutes.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Gradually add the milk and cook, stirring, until thickened. Stir in salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Set 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese aside and stir the remaining 1 1/2 cups of cheese into the sauce. Continue cooking and stirring until the cheese has melted.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Combine the cheese sauce with the drained macaroni and then spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Crumble the bacon and sprinkle it evenly over the top of the casserole.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Sprinkle the reserved 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese over the bacon.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Put the breadcrumbs in a small bowl and drizzle the butter over them. Toss the breadcrumbs lightly to coat with the butter.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Sprinkle the crumbs over the cheese and bacon.
b0c36b02-81ce-48a4-8c6f-6e18a5247132 Bake the macaroni and cheese casserole for 25 to 30 minutes, until lightly browned and bubbly.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Gather the ingredients.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Bake or fry the bacon until somewhat crisp.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Drain on paper towels and then dice or crumble.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Separate the broccoli crowns into small florets and put in a large bowl.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Add the chopped red onion, raisins, and bacon to the broccoli and toss to mix.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Combine the mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar in a small bowl.
ddaf5d17-98df-4435-8d29-c0605ba5cc52 Add to the broccoli mixture. Toss to coat the broccoli with the dressing. For maximum flavor, refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Gather the ingredients.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Gather your tools.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Dice the bacon strips into 1-inch pieces.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Peel the onion and chop it coarsely; set aside.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 In a large Dutch oven or deep sauté pan that has a cover, cook the diced bacon until it is fully cooked but not crisp.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 With a slotted spoon, remove the bacon pieces to paper towels to drain; set aside. Leave about 2 tablespoons of the bacon drippings in the pot.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Add the chopped onion to the bacon drippings and cook over medium heat until tender and lightly browned, stirring frequently. This step will take about 4 to 5 minutes.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Coarsely chop the cabbage.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Add the chopped cabbage to the browned onions and add 1/2 cup of chicken broth.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Cover the pot tightly and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Add more broth or water, as needed, and cook for about 5 to 10 minutes longer, or until the cabbage is tender.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Add the bacon pieces and stir. Heat through and serve.
ecd91b8a-2e72-4db9-9948-121463c6be39 Enjoy!
b136ccc8-d879-4f8d-8ffe-577c73064b7d Add vinegar to a very large pot of water and bring to a boil. Klara says the vinegar prevents the cabbage from falling apart. Boil the cabbages for about 5 minutes until the leaves begin to release from the heads. Peel the leaves off and place in a colander to drain and cool. Reserve the cabbage hearts.
b136ccc8-d879-4f8d-8ffe-577c73064b7d Place onions, bacon, and garlic in a food processor and finely chop. In a very large Dutch oven or roaster, saute onion-bacon-garlic mixture. Meanwhile, finely chop the celery and parsley in the food processor and add to the onion-bacon-garlic mixture along with the beef, pork, and veal. Cook until meat is evenly browned. Remove from heat and, if desired, drain off excess fat. Allow it to cool.
b136ccc8-d879-4f8d-8ffe-577c73064b7d Heat oven to 500 degrees. If the inner leaves of the cabbage heads aren't pliable, return them to the boiling water for a few minutes. Trim the thick center vein of each leaf without piercing it. Add rice to meat mixture, and season with cinnamon, nutmeg, paprika, and salt. Mix in eggs thoroughly. Place a handful of meat filling on each leaf. Flip up the bottom, then fold the sides in, and roll up. Any leftover filling can be frozen for later use.
b136ccc8-d879-4f8d-8ffe-577c73064b7d Chop the reserved cabbage hearts and, in a large bowl, mix with sauerkraut and tomato puree. Season the dish with salt and pepper. Place some of this mixture on the bottom of a deep, large roasting pan. Cover with a layer of cabbage rolls, tightly packed. Press down and spoon on more sauerkraut mixture. Add another layer of cabbage rolls, running at a right angle to the first layer. Continue in this manner until all the cabbage rolls are in the pan—top with remaining sauerkraut mixture and pour some of the tomato juice over it. Gently shake the pan to distribute the juice and add the rest of the tomato juice.
b136ccc8-d879-4f8d-8ffe-577c73064b7d Sprinkle with sugar and cloves. Cover and place in a 500-degree oven. When the mixture comes to a boil, reduce the heat to 350 degrees and bake 2 1/2 hours. Remove cloves before serving. Present two or three cabbage rolls per person with boiled potatoes and some of the sauerkraut mixture, and sprinkle with chopped parsley and paprika. Cooked stuffed cabbage will keep a long time in the freezer if they are well sealed.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf Preheat your oven to 350 F. Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with aluminum foil, then place an oven-safe wire rack on top of the pan. Spray the rack liberally with nonstick cooking spray.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf In a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, the cinnamon, and the cayenne pepper (if using). Toss them together until the spices are well-distributed.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf Take a strip of bacon and press it into the sugar mixture, then turn it over and coat the other side with sugar. Place it on the wire rack, then repeat until all of the slices of bacon are covered with sugar on both sides.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf If you have any remaining sugar, sprinkle it over the top of the bacon. ​Bake the bacon in your preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes. When it is done, it will be firm and crispy and dark along the edges.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf Soon after you take it out of the oven, use a spatula to lift the bacon off the rack—sometimes the sugar and fat cause the bacon to stick, and if it's not removed when it is still warm, it's difficult to get off of the rack.
035e3797-5b95-445e-9618-9bee530875cf Let the bacon cool completely, and then enjoy! Candied bacon can be eaten on its own, crumbled to use as a salad topping, or enjoyed on top of other desserts like cakes or cupcakes.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Gather the ingredients and equipment.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Preheat the oven to 400 F. Position the cooking rack in the middle of the oven. There will be little to no splattering as the bacon cooks.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Line the jelly roll pan with the tinfoil to catch all of the grease, so you can just lift off the tinfoil and throw it in the trash when you're done.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Place a cookie cooling rack on top of the foil lined sheet.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Lay out the strips of bacon onto the cooling rack. The strips can touch as they will shrink when cooking. You may have to lay a few pieces of the bacon width-wise as well as length-wise.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Place the jelly roll pan in the oven on the middle rack.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Cook for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the bacon is cooked to your desired crispiness. It should lift off of the cooling rack easily.
dcf4591a-8822-4283-8fe5-fb56f2ebf0df Serve and enjoy!
e67c8d61-bb84-4db2-827b-e5b2a115da23 Preheat about two inches of oil in a frying pan or deep fryer to 350 F.
e67c8d61-bb84-4db2-827b-e5b2a115da23 While the oil is heating up, peel the yuca and cut it into half-inch rounds or pieces.
e67c8d61-bb84-4db2-827b-e5b2a115da23 Fry the prepared yuca until fork-tender. This will take approximately 6 to 8 minutes.
e67c8d61-bb84-4db2-827b-e5b2a115da23 Remove cooked yuca from the fryer and allow it to drain on paper towels.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Soak 2 cups sweet (sticky) rice in 3-4 cups water, or enough so water exceeds the rice by at least 1 inch. Soak for at least 40 minutes (if you lose track of time, it's no problem - sticky rice can soak up to 4 hours or longer). Note: Sweet rice has a hard outer shell that needs to soften before it can be cooked.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a While rice is soaking, prepare your steamer. Line a bamboo steamer or colander with 2 layers of banana/bamboo leaf, OR use cheesecloth, or a clean kitchen cloth. To clean and thaw the leaf (if frozen), rinse under hot water. Cut the leaf large enough that it extends over the top. Place steamer over a large pot, and have a tight-fitting lid ready.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Place bacon in a large frying pan/wok together with 1-2 Tbsp. water. Fry over medium-high heat until cooked (chewy, not crisp). Remove from heat, leaving all or half the fat in the frying pan.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Remove bacon from the pan and cut into small pieces (I use a clean pair of scissors for this, like they do in Asia - much faster and easier than a knife!). Place it back in the frying pan.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Also add to the frying pan the shallots or onion, mushrooms, garlic, and chili. Return to medium-high heat and stir-fry 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. If your pan becomes dry, add a little water (1-2 Tbsp.).
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Turn heat to low. Add the drained sticky rice, plus the fish sauce and soy sauces. Also add half the green onion. Stir until the color of the rice has consistently darkened . Remove from heat.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Transfer the rice from the frying pan into your prepared steamer. Make sure there is at least 1 inch of water in the pot. Cover with the lid and steam over high heat for 30-35 minutes. (You may have to add more water to your steamer partway through.)
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a After 30 minutes, remove from heat. Allow to sit (with lid on) for 5 minutes. The rice should be soft, sticky, and slightly translucent. If there are any hard grains, steam 5 minutes longer. (Dig down into the middle of the rice when testing for "done-ness".)
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a Taste-test the rice for salt. Sprinkle over a little more fish sauce if not salty or flavorful enough. If too salty, add a sqeeze of lime juice. Gently stir rice with a fork or chopsticks to mix in.
6a5e4773-d176-42d0-91c3-75545dcb336a To serve, slide the banana/bamboo leaf directly onto a serving plate. Or, if you want to pretty it up, line a serving bowl or plate with a fresh banana leaf. Mound the rice on top and sprinkle with remaining spring onion (add optional garnishes too if desired). ENJOY!
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Place 3 cups of the lettuce in bottom of a large bowl; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Layer the hard-boiled egg slices over the lettuce in the bowl and sprinkle with more salt and pepper.
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Continue to layer vegetables in this order: peas, remaining lettuce, crumbled bacon, and shredded cheese, along with light sprinklings of salt and pepper.
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Combine mayonnaise and sugar; spread over top, spreading to edge of the bowl to cover entire salad.
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Cover and chill the salad overnight, or up to 24 hours.
e08c07eb-d901-4e4a-870a-6cf8e35274c4 Just before serving, garnish the salad with green onions and a little paprika. Toss and serve.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Gather the ingredients.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Coat both sides of each slice of bacon with the brown sugar. The best strategy is to place the brown sugar on a plate and place the bacon over the top, packing the brown sugar on one side and then flipping.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Place the coated bacon onto a cooling rack that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Place the cooling rack over an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Bake for about 15 to 20 minutes, until they the strips of bacon look caramelized and firm. Keep a close watch on them and make sure they do not burn.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Let the bacon cool slightly so that it is no longer stick and remove it from the cooling rack. Place on a piece of parchment paper and allow them to continue to cool.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Whip the cream with a whisk, hand mixer, or KitchenAid with the whisk attachment, until it forms sturdy peaks. Be careful not to whip for too long, otherwise it will become butter.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Gently whisk the sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, and maple extract into the whipped cream until it is completely combined.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Pour the mixture into a large casserole or baking dish.
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Chop the candied bacon and sprinkle over the top of the ice cream. Freeze for about 6 hours (make sure it is nice and firm).
37216520-9b74-445f-ab27-7d0e3a81e977 Once frozen, drizzle with the maple syrup and serve!
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 In a large, heavy skillet or saute pan, cook the bacon until fat has rendered.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 With a slotted spoon, transfer the bacon to a large Dutch oven or stockpot; stir in 3 cans of black-eyed peas.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 To the bacon drippings in the skillet add the chopped onions, green and red pepper, and celery. Cook, stirring until the onion is translucent and the vegetables are tender.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 Transfer the cooked onion and pepper mixture to the Dutch oven and then add the diced tomatoes, chopped mild chile peppers and chopped jalapeño peppers, if using.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 Add salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste. Add 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of ground cayenne pepper, if desired, for spicier peas.
59665c98-fe4a-4723-b34b-7dc4fea43f84 Serve these delicious spicy peas hot with freshly baked cornbread.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef Heat the oven to 350 F.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef With a sharp knife, remove the silver skin from the pork, along with any excess fat.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef Peel the onion and chop it finely; set aside.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef Arrange bacon slices over pork tenderloin. Place tenderloin on rack in a shallow roasting pan. Tuck thin end of meat under. Roast, uncovered, for about 25 to 35 minutes, or until internal temperature is at least 145 F. To check for doneness, use a reliable instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the thickest part of the pork.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef While the pork cooks, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook the chopped onion in the butter until it is tender and translucent.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef To the cooked onion, add the tomato sauce, sweet pickle, vinegar, parsley flakes and sugar. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef Remove the pork tenderloin from the oven; cover it loosely with foil and let it rest for 5 minutes.
46d0fee8-f410-439e-93d5-b0f63d2223ef Serve the pork tenderloin sliced with the sauce.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Gather the ingredients.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb In a mixing bowl, mix together flour and salt.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Cut in cold butter with a pastry blender until coarse crumbs form.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Add water, a little at a time, until dough holds together and forms a ball.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Shape into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for about 30 minutes.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb On a lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin, roll out dough into a circle about 12 inches in diameter.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Fit dough into a 9-inch pie plate or quiche pan. Trim edges, leaving a little overhang, about 1/4-inch all around the edge. Prick dough with a fork.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Line with foil and fill with dried beans or pie weights.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Bake quiche crust for 10 minutes at 375 F.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, thyme, and pepper.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Pour into the baked crust and crumble bacon over the top with the shredded Cheddar cheese.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Bake at 375 F for about 30 minutes, or until quiche filling is set and the top is lightly browned.
cbd1baa3-34ff-401f-803c-f89f8ea63cdb Serve the quiche with fresh tomato wedges or a tossed salad.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Heat the oven (or warming drawer) to 200 F to 250 F. This is to keep the squash warm while you finish the sauce. Alternatively, you can just warm it quickly in the microwave when the sauce is ready.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Slice off the stem end and blossom end of the spaghetti squash. Cut the squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Scrape the inside of the squash with a spoon to remove any soft fibers. Place it in a microwave-safe baking dish, cut side down. Add about an inch of hot water to the baking dish.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Microwave the squash, uncovered, for 12 to 15 minutes. The time depends on the size of the squash and the power of the microwave oven. Test it by piercing with a fork. It should be easy to pierce, but not too soft.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Scrape the inside of the squash with a fork, transferring the "spaghetti" strands to an oven-safe bowl or container. Cover the bowl with foil and keep the squash warm in the oven or warming drawer.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 In a deep skillet or saute pan over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain. Crumble the bacon and set aside.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Drain the bacon drippings into a cup or bowl, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the pan. Refrigerate the excess bacon drippings for another use.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Add the onions to the pan and saute until just translucent. Add the garlic and continue cooking, stirring, for 2 minutes.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Add the cream to the pan and bring to a simmer. Continue cooking for about 4 minutes, until reduced and thickened. Add the Parmesan cheese and cook, stirring, until melted. Set aside a few teaspoons of crumbled bacon and add the rest to the sauce; heat through. If the sauce is too thick, add a little more cream or milk to thin.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Gently toss the sauce with the hot spaghetti squash.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Garnish the "spaghetti" with a little parsley and more Parmesan cheese and bacon crumbs, if desired.
27c13424-afba-46a7-bb20-542a2bd0bb45 Serve with a side green salad or sliced tomatoes.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Fill the sink with cold water. Wash the collard greens in 3 to 4 changes of water, until there is absolutely no grit on the bottom of the sink. Cut thick stems out of the greens and chop the leaves or cut them crosswise into strips.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 If using bacon, cook it until cooked but not crisp in a large skillet. Remove the bacon to paper towels to drain.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until soft.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Combine the beans, bacon, onions, garlic, chicken stock, tomato paste, vinegar, bay leaves, and red pepper flakes in the slow cooker. The liquid should cover the top of the beans.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Cover the crockpot and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours or on high for 3 hours.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Open the lid and add the greens. Return the lid and cook for one more hour.
9a9ccd47-f684-41e2-8ffd-a402cf688878 Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and freshly ground black pepper, as needed.
20860255-e337-47c1-b6ee-3de8e0e339bf Place the beans in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring the beans to a gentle simmer over medium heat. Cover and cook them until they begin to turn tender, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. Add one teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper to the beans and cook until the liquid has absorbed about 25 additional minutes. Remove the beans from the heat, drain and set the beans aside.
20860255-e337-47c1-b6ee-3de8e0e339bf In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the lardons for 5 minutes, until they brown. Crumble them coarsely and transfer to a plate. Add the onions and sauté for 10 minutes, until they turn tender. Lower the heat, and cook the onions on low, occasionally stirring, for 20 to 30 minutes until caramelized and golden brown. Transfer to the plate with the lardons.
20860255-e337-47c1-b6ee-3de8e0e339bf Preheat the oven to 350. Drain all but four tablespoons of the fat from the skillet. Add the chicken breast pieces to the fat and brown over medium-high heat. Transfer the chicken to a clean bowl. Lower the heat to medium-low, melt one tablespoon butter and sauté the chopped garlic for 90 seconds, stirring constantly. Add the cubed squash, increase the heat to medium-high, and sauté until lightly caramelized. Take care to not burn the garlic.
20860255-e337-47c1-b6ee-3de8e0e339bf Combine the lardons, onions, chicken pieces and stock, bouquet garni, thyme, squash, garlic, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper in a large casserole dish. Cover with a lid and bake for 25 minutes. Add the carrots to the casserole, cover, and bake for an additional 20 minutes.
20860255-e337-47c1-b6ee-3de8e0e339bf Add the white beans to the casserole and gently stir. In a small bowl, toss the bread crumbs, parsley, and thyme with the melted butter. Sprinkle the bread crumbs over the casserole and bake uncovered for 1 hour. Discard the bouquet garni and serve.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 375 F/190 C.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f Lightly grease a baking tray and cover with baking parchment. Set aside.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f On a chopping board, lay the slices of streaky bacon side by side. Using the back of a dinner knife, stretch the bacon as far as it will go without tearing it. Cut each slice into thirds.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f Take each cocktail sausage and wrap it tightly with the bacon.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f Lay the wrapped sausage on the prepared baking tray with the seam underneath. Continue until you have used up all the bacon and sausages.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f At this point, the tray can be covered and placed in the refrigerator to cook later.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f As soon as you need your pigs in a blanket, pop them into the oven and cook for about 20 minutes or until the bacon is crisp and golden and the sausage is cooked through.
3de5326a-355d-431c-9a9f-80aa95de469f Serve alongside your roast turkey or goose on the Christmas table or even cold the next day on your Boxing Day buffet.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Heat the oven to 350 F.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Generously butter a 2-quart baking dish.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 In a deep skillet or saute pan, cook the bacon until just crisp. Remove it to paper towels and set aside to drain.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Leave about 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings in the skillet and add 3 tablespoons of butter. Add the onion to the pan and saute until softened.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Add the flour and continue cooking, stirring, for about 1 minute. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce is thickened.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Stir in the salt, pepper, and nutmeg, if using. Stir in the cooked bacon.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Layer half of the potato slices in the prepared baking dish.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Spoon half of the sauce mixture over the potatoes. Top with the remaining potatoes. Spoon the remaining sauce over all.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Cover the casserole tightly with foil and bake for 1 hour.
952da3e1-f2f0-4f7e-b781-469ab2697b46 Remove the foil, return to the oven, and bake for about 20 to 30 minutes longer or until the potato slices are fork-tender.
77434b5f-9bf3-4fa7-a543-a93156bc0547 Pour the ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
77434b5f-9bf3-4fa7-a543-a93156bc0547 Stir well.
77434b5f-9bf3-4fa7-a543-a93156bc0547 Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
77434b5f-9bf3-4fa7-a543-a93156bc0547 Garnish with a brandied cherry and a small strip of bacon.
7b4da120-42ca-4487-a9c6-1713b06ef112 Gather the ingredients.
7b4da120-42ca-4487-a9c6-1713b06ef112 In a large skillet over medium-low heat, cook the bacon until just crisp. You can either cook the bacon whole or cut the bacon into chunks before cooking. Once crisp, remove the bacon to paper towels to drain. Leave about 2 teaspoons of bacon drippings in the skillet and discard the remaining drippings.
7b4da120-42ca-4487-a9c6-1713b06ef112 Place the skillet back over medium heat and add the ground beef and chopped onions. Cook until the beef is no longer pink, stirring and breaking up larger chunks. With a slotted spoon or spatula, transfer the ground beef to the crockery insert of the slow cooker.
7b4da120-42ca-4487-a9c6-1713b06ef112 Add the brown sugar, dry mustard, baked beans, two cans of drained beans, ketchup or barbecue sauce, and vinegar. Taste and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
7b4da120-42ca-4487-a9c6-1713b06ef112 Cover and cook on low for 3 to 5 hours.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Gather the ingredients.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Heat oven to 350 F. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish or spray with baking spray.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 In a large skillet or sauté pan cook the diced bacon until fat is rendered and the bacon is crisp. Remove to paper towels.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Pour off all but about 1 teaspoon of the bacon grease. Save the bacon grease to use in cornbread or for a flavorful fat for sauteing onions or other vegetables.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Add the onion to the pan and cook over medium heat, stirring, until just tender.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Add the spinach leaves and cook, stirring constantly, until spinach is wilted and any excess water clinging to the leaves has evaporated.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Transfer the spinach mixture to the baking dish. Top evenly with the bacon, then with the cheese.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 In a bowl, whisk together the milk and flour until smooth.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Whisk in the eggs and egg white, then whisk in the pepper, salt, onion powder, and oregano.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Pour over evenly over the spinach and cheese mixture. Sprinkle very lightly with the paprika, if desired.
a6bdf5b2-6903-4b95-ae82-9744d6d5d300 Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the quiche is firm.
ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 Cut the bacon into small pieces; brown in a large skillet. Remove bacon from the rendered fat and set aside.
ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 In the bacon drippings, sauté the onion and bell pepper until tender.
ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 Add the ground beef and brown lightly. Put the meats into the bottom of a crockpot. Add the can of pork and beans.
ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 Drain most of the liquids from the remaining cans of beans and add them to the slow cooker with the remaining ingredients. Mix well to blend.
