ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 Cook on high setting for 1 hour, and then set to low and continue cooking for 5 to 6 hours. Stir occasionally.
ac5eb129-3220-4c76-87e8-7eaafea5b850 Check for seasonings and correct if desired, with a little salt and pepper, or more brown sugar or syrup.
22272518-7f92-46d6-b516-916425d1828b Gather the ingredients.
22272518-7f92-46d6-b516-916425d1828b Spray the crockery insert of your slow cooker with non-stick cooking spray. Butter flavor is good if you have it. Or use an olive oil or vegetable oil spray.
22272518-7f92-46d6-b516-916425d1828b Mix the condensed cream of chicken soup with 1/2 cup milk.
22272518-7f92-46d6-b516-916425d1828b Layer the ingredients in your slow cooker or Crock Pot in this order: About one-quarter of the potato slices, one-quarter of the cheddar cheese, some bacon bits, salt and pepper, and about one-quarter of the soup mixture.
22272518-7f92-46d6-b516-916425d1828b Repeat the layers ending with soup mixture and then cover and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Gather the ingredients.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 In a large skillet, fry the bacon until crisp.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Remove the bacon from the skillet and drain on paper towels. (Don't clean out the skillet.)
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Crumble the bacon and set it aside, covered, in the refrigerator.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 In the skillet with the bacon drippings, cook the chicken breasts over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes per side, until the outside has formed a nice light brown coating.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Place the browned chicken in a 4- to 6-quart slow cooker. Top with the drained mushrooms.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Using the same skillet you used to brown the chicken, heat the soup, mixing well and scraping up the pan drippings.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Pour the soup sauce over the chicken.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours, or until the chicken registers 165 F at the thickest part of the meat using a meat thermometer.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 After 4 to 5 hours, top the chicken with the diced cheese and sprinkle with the reserved bacon.
154835f9-57f5-4c45-ade9-ad4c75907b89 Cover again and cook on high for 10 to 15 minutes or until the cheese has completely melted.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 300 F/150 C/Gas 2.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Wrap 1 strip of bacon around a chicken breast half; repeat with the remaining halves.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Line a large lightly buttered casserole or baking dish with the cut up chipped beef.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Place the 8 chicken breast halves on the chipped beef.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d In a bowl combine sour cream and soup until well blended; pour over the chicken.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Sprinkle lightly with freshly ground black pepper.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Bake slowly, at 300 F for 2 hours, or until chicken is cooked and bacon is crispy.
a207ca56-5010-4d87-9b63-2c35fd2d7e6d Serve and enjoy!
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 400 F.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Bake the bacon for 10 minutes. You can also brown in a pan.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Toast the bread so that it is still slightly soft, but also a nice light brown color. Place it on a cooling rack if you can, so that it doesn't get soggy while you prepare the sandwich.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Place one slice of toast on a cutting board. Add two slices of turkey, top with a small handful of fresh spinach, a slice of tomato, and 2 slices of bacon.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Layer another slice of toast on top. Place three more slices of turkey, 4 slices of fresh avocado, and two more pieces of bacon.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Spread some of the aioli onto the last slice of toast. Place the toast aioli side down on top of the sandwich.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Cut into four triangles, secure each piece with a toothpick.
52c5e986-690d-4878-839b-f9c8a63d85fc Serve and enjoy!
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Gather the ingredients.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Put the rice in a 2-quart baking dish.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Spoon the corn evenly over the rice layer and sprinkle lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Combine the 1 can of tomato sauce with 1/2 cup of water and pour over the corn layer.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Sprinkle with the chopped onion and bell pepper.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Top the onion and pepper layer with the ground beef and sprinkle lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Add the can of diced tomatoes.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Top with the strips of bacon.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350 F for 1 hour.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c Uncover and cook 30 minutes longer, until bacon is crisp.
f80fa8df-df60-4504-b468-9ee29e544b7c If desired, top with shredded cheese, return to the oven and continue baking just until the cheese has melted.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Prepare the empanada dough and let the dough rest in the refrigerator for at least one hour (overnight is best).
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Cook the bacon until crispy and drain on paper towels. Crumble the bacon roughly.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Whisk the eggs with the milk and season with salt and pepper.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Melt the butter over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Add the chopped scallions and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until soft.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Pour in the eggs and cook, stirring, until well scrambled and just cooked. Stir in the cream cheese just before removing eggs from heat. The cheese does not have to be mixed in well.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Preheat oven to 375 F.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Roll out the empanada dough and cut into 8 6-inch circles of dough. Let circles rest for 5 minutes.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Place spoonfuls of the egg mixture in the middle of each dough circle, dividing the mixture evenly between the empanadas. Sprinkle some crumbled bacon and grated pepper jack cheese on top of the egg mixture, dividing the cheese and bacon evenly between the 8 empanadas.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Fold and seal the empanadas (see how to make empanadas for step-by-step instructions on shaping empanadas).
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Place empanadas on a baking sheet. Whisk an egg with a tablespoon of water, and brush empanadas carefully with the egg wash.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Bake empanadas for 25 to 30 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
407b950e-e1f3-4c80-a92e-c87577dd7c92 Remove from oven and let cool. Empanadas can be wrapped well and frozen. Thaw empanadas and reheat in the oven or microwave.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Line a rimmed baking pan with foil; lightly oil the foil or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Cut the bacon strips in half crosswise and coat them with the 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, if using. Arrange the bacon on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until almost crisp. Remove the bacon from the oven and let it cool.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, pork, onion, bell pepper, breadcrumbs, cheese, milk, egg, Cajun seasonings, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Put the ground meat mixture on the prepared foil-lined baking pan and shape into a loaf.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Spread barbecue sauce over the loaf and arrange the bacon strips over the top.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Bake the meatloaf until the bacon is crispy and loaf is firm, about 1 hour to 1 hour and 10 minutes. If unsure, check the loaf with an instant-read food thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf. The minimum safe temperature for ground meat is 160 F/71 C.
f378f147-1930-4733-bb56-f025b9325e7f Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing or moving to a serving platter.
fd1533cb-82f2-4452-9c09-a76bbee7d782 In a large bowl, combine the broccoli florets, raisins, sunflower seeds, crumbled bacon, chopped onion, and thawed frozen peas; toss to combine.
fd1533cb-82f2-4452-9c09-a76bbee7d782 In a separate bowl or large cup, whisk together mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar.
fd1533cb-82f2-4452-9c09-a76bbee7d782 Add the dressing to the salad and toss to mix well; chill thoroughly before serving.
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 Place the beans in a large saucepan and cover with salted water by 2 to 3 inches. Soak the beans overnight.
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 The next day, drain and rinse the beans. Return the beans to the saucepan and cover with fresh water by about 4 inches. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until the beans are tender but not bursting open.
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 While the beans are cooking, mix the ketchup, molasses, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, chili powder, and Magic Dust together in a large bowl.
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (177 degrees C).
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon. Drain the bacon on paper towels, crumble it, and set aside. Add the onion and garlic to the bacon drippings and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. The onion should still be a little crunchy.
fddb3399-6b0d-4c6e-9eba-c115c0a27ec9 Drain the beans, reserving 2 cups/480 mL of the bean water. Pour the beans and bean water into the bowl with the sauce. Add the bacon and onion and stir to combine well. Pour into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish and bake for 1 hour or until bubbly. Will keep, refrigerated, for up to 1 week.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Gather the ingredients.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 In a large saucepan over high heat, cook the bacon until it turns crisp. Transfer the bacon to a paper-towel-lined plate to drain.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Pour all but 2 tablespoons of bacon grease from the pan. Saute the onions, carrots, and celery in the bacon grease for 5 minutes, until the vegetables turn soft. Transfer them to a bowl with a slotted spoon and set it aside for a moment.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Season the beef with the salt and pepper and brown it in the remaining bacon grease. Once all sides of the beef are browned, sprinkle the parsley, thyme, rosemary, allspice, and flour over the beef.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Stir in the tomato paste and cook the spiced beef for 1 minute.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Add the mushrooms, cooked vegetables, crisped bacon, red wine, and beef stock, into the pan with the beef, and then cook the mixture over low heat, covered, for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Though this is the quick version and ready to eat the day it is made, it will richen by being left overnight and rewarmed and eaten the next day.
23da5e2d-528b-4e43-afb7-efcb02f030f3 Serve and enjoy!
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 Rinse the beans and soak them overnight in water.
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 Drain the beans, and cover them with fresh water (or chicken stock or beef stock if desired). Add chopped bell pepper. Bring the beans to a simmer on the stove, and cook them over low heat until they are just tender.
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 If using bacon, cook it in a heavy skillet until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and reserve for another use. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the bacon fat remaining in the skillet and cook them over low heat until they are soft, translucent and fragrant. (If not using bacon, cook the onion and garlic in a couple of tablespoons of olive oil).
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 Add the cumin and the brown sugar to the onions and continue to cook until browned, soft and fragrant.
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 Once the beans are tender, remove two cups of the cooked beans and process them in a blender with onion mixture. Add the blended beans and onion back to the rest of the beans. According to taste, season with salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce (optional).
502bff0c-6a21-4234-850b-cc9931a31de8 Continue to cook beans until they are very tender, adding water if necessary or letting​ the excess water boil away until the desired texture is reached.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Gather the ingredients.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 In a small pan, cook pork shoulder with just enough water to cover, for 15 to 20 minutes.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 When cool enough to handle, cut meat and fat into large pieces. Reserve the cooking water and let it cool.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Meanwhile, in a small skillet, sauté bacon until golden.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Add onions and sauté 5 minutes more, remove from heat and set aside.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Using a medium grinding blade, push the cooled pork pieces (fat and all) and potatoes down the chute of your grinder using a wooden pestle. Don't ever put your fingers in a grinder, running or not running!
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Add cooked bacon and onions, salt, pepper, marjoram, and peppermint leaves to the water the meat was cooked in and mix well.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Then combine with meat-potato mixture until just moistened.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Fry a small patty of meat and taste to make sure the seasonings are just right.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Using the procedure for stuffing Polish sausage, stuff the meat-potato mixture into the casings. Store refrigerated and covered up to two days until ready to cook.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Before cooking, prick sausage along the length of the link to allow air bubbles to escape. Otherwise, they will explode in the cooking water.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Place sausage in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 45 minutes.
7058f163-b626-4ff9-a18f-f20ddb3ecbe5 Enjoy!
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Gather the ingredients.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Cook bacon gently until partially cooked but not crisp and still flexible.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Rinse scallops under running cold water, pat dry with paper towels. If you notice any tag-like pieces on the side of the scallops, this is a tough muscle and should be removed. Just pinch it with your fingers to remove.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Cut each bacon slice crosswise in half; wrap each half around a scallop and secure with a toothpick.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Sprinkle scallops lightly with seasoned pepper. Preheat broiler.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Place scallops on a rack in broiling pan.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat for 8 to 10 minutes, or until scallops turn opaque throughout, using tongs to turn scallops frequently so the bacon browns evenly on all sides.
ed764c50-fb93-4fca-b917-0aa7254c719f Serve as an appetizer or an entrée.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Gather the ingredients.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Wash and dry potatoes. Pierce each one multiple times with a fork. Place onto a baking sheet and bake for 40-45 minutes at 375 degrees. If using larger potatoes, extend the time to 50-55 minutes.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d To test for doneness, pierce with a fork. If it is tender and goes right through, the potatoes are done. Remove from oven and let potatoes cool for 15 minutes or so before handling.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Slit potatoes vertically, but only cut halfway through. Carefully scoop out 3/4 of the cooked flesh. You do not need to remove all of it and should leave some behind to help keep the potato shells sturdy.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Add the scooped out portion into a large bowl. Add the yogurt, cream cheese, butter and milk. Using a hand held mixer, blend ingredients together. Use more milk if needed.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Add remaining ingredients, except for the reserved portions of bacon and spring onion listed above. Use a spoon to combine the ingredients. Taste for salt.
218ccac1-1dcd-4b22-82d9-fe7d2933ab7d Scoop equal portions into the 6 potato shells. Garnish with reserved bacon and spring onion. Return potatoes to a 425-degree oven for 10-12 minutes. Once the potatoes begin to form a slightly golden crust, remove from oven and serve.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a In a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat, cook the diced bacon until almost crisp and fat has been rendered. With a slotted spoon, transfer the bacon to paper towels and leave 1 tablespoon of drippings in the skillet. Refrigerate the bacon; it will be added to the stew near the end of the cooking time.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a In a food storage bag, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. Add the beef pieces and toss to coat with the flour mixture.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a Cook the beef in the bacon drippings over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the beef is nicely browned on all sides.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a Transfer the beef to the crockery insert of a slow cooker. Top with the mushrooms, thinly sliced carrots, and thawed onions.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a Combine the wine, beef broth, tomato paste, and garlic. Pour over the beef and vegetables. Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 9 hours or on HIGH for 4 to 5 hours.
70c354e6-4bea-4d03-83c2-e9eda4d8de2a Stir in the thyme, rosemary, and the reserved bacon. Continue cooking on HIGH, uncovered, for 15 minutes longer.
65815186-2d43-432a-9f08-0c018d9f0b5f Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the pasta as directed on the package. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Drain the bacon on paper towels and crumble; set aside. Discard the bacon fat.
65815186-2d43-432a-9f08-0c018d9f0b5f In a small bowl beat together the egg yolks with the cream; season with the salt and pepper. Set aside.
65815186-2d43-432a-9f08-0c018d9f0b5f In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over low heat and add the salmon, peas, and cooked bacon; gently heat. Shake the pan from time to time, so the food doesn't stick.
65815186-2d43-432a-9f08-0c018d9f0b5f When the pasta is done, drain well and add immediately to the skillet with the salmon; do not stir.
65815186-2d43-432a-9f08-0c018d9f0b5f Immediately pour the egg mixture over the hot pasta. Turn the heat under the skillet to medium. Using tongs, gently lift and turn the pasta, egg mixture, salmon, peas, and bacon together until creamy sauce forms on the pasta. The egg will cook on contact with hot pasta. Sprinkle the food with the cheese and toss gently. Serve immediately.
270c4e33-0e17-45c6-b124-8083b4f90964 Prepare the dairy-free pie dough according to the instructions, plate in a lightly oiled 9" tart or pie pan, cover with plastic wrap, and place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before filling with the quiche filling and baking.
270c4e33-0e17-45c6-b124-8083b4f90964 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
270c4e33-0e17-45c6-b124-8083b4f90964 Meanwhile, make the filling. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, adding the onions once hot. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onions are lightly caramelized, about 6-8 minutes. Add the remaining olive oil, garlic, vegan bacon, 1/2 teaspoon salt and red pepper flakes and cook until the garlic smells fragrant, about 4-5 minutes more. Remove from heat and transfer the mixture to a bowl. Set aside.
270c4e33-0e17-45c6-b124-8083b4f90964 In a steam basket set over boiling water, steam the broccoli for 3-5 minutes, or until bright green and lightly crisp. Toss with the onion-vegan bacon mixture and set aside.
270c4e33-0e17-45c6-b124-8083b4f90964 In the bowl of a food processor, process the tofu, lemon juice, tahini, rice vinegar, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt until smooth. Fold in the broccoli-onion mixture, stirring until evenly mixed. Using your hands, crumble the vegan cheese evenly into the bottom of the pie crust. Pour the filling on top of the vegan cheese in the prepared pie crust and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until golden brown and set. Serve hot.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Put the black-eyed peas in a large bowl or pot and cover them completely with cool water. Soak the black-eyed peas for 6 hours or overnight.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Rinse and drain the black-eyed peas several times. Set them aside.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 In a large Dutch oven or stockpot over medium-high heat, sear the pork pieces in the vegetable oil until browned.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Add the bacon to the pot and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Add the onion and celery and continue cooking, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes, or until the bacon is cooked and the onion is lightly browned.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Add 3 cups of the chicken broth and the garlic powder, black pepper, and cayenne. Bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes or until the pork pieces feel fork tender.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Add the drained black-eyed peas to the pot along with 1 to 1 1/2 cups of water to cover. Put the lid on the pot and simmer for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until the peas turn tender but retain their shape. Add more chicken broth as necessary to keep the peas covered while they cook.
a5ef2608-15de-4d5f-b263-c9a600a27248 Taste and add the Cajun or Creole seasoning and salt, as needed.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Gather the ingredients.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Scrub whole potatoes of the same size and cook in salted water until easily pierced with a fork. Let cool and peel while still warm.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Chop bacon or "Bauchspeck" into small pieces and cook in a large frying pan (11 or 12 inches) until limp.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Remove from the pan but keep the grease in the pan. Add the butter and melt, but don't brown.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Slice the cold potatoes into 1/4-inch slices (5 mm) and place a single layer in the hot fat. Place any extra potatoes on top of the first layer.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Sprinkle the potatoes with the onions and bacon and let them cook over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Flip them when they become golden brown on the underside, but don't stir them.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Sprinkle with marjoram, caraway, salt, and pepper and cook for 5 to 10 more minutes. Add more butter if necessary, to facilitate browning.
3979b3e8-b865-4c16-ad5b-7209e8406917 Serve and enjoy!
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Gather the ingredients.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Preheat the oven to 325 F.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Use a cookie scoop to form the sausage mixture into 1-inch balls. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and add the sausage balls to the sheet. Place them slightly apart so they are not touching.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. The internal temperature should read 165 F.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 As they are baking, prepare the dipping sauce.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Whisk all of the dipping sauce ingredients in a small bowl until thoroughly combined. You can make the sauce a few days ahead of time. The longer it sits, the more the flavor will develop.
534b8396-107b-4467-a417-de8717248bf4 Serve the sausage balls with some chopped chives and the dipping sauce. You can serve them hot or at room temperature.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Gather the ingredients.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Clean the tripe under cold running water. Set in a bowl of cold water mixed with the vinegar for 20 minutes, then rinse thoroughly.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Cut the tripe into pieces approximately 3-inches square. Set aside.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Coarsely chop 1 onion. Set aside.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Remove and peel each clove from the bulb of garlic. Set aside.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b In a large heavy-bottomed pot, place the tripe pieces and the split calf or pig foot.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Cover with water and bring to a boil. Allow to boil for 1 minute.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Drain into a colander and rinse the froth from the meat.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Return the tripe and foot to the cooking pot and add 4 to 6 cups of water, or enough to cover.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Put chopped onion and all but 3 peeled cloves of garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns in​ the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat. Simmer for 3 hours.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Finely chop the remaining onion and 3 cloves of garlic.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Cut the serrano ham into small squares. Slice the chorizo sausage into rounds.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b In a skillet, heat the olive oil and sauté the chopped onion, garlic, ham, and chorizo for 5 minutes, or until onions are translucent.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Remove from heat and stir in the paprika.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Add the mixture to the pot with the tripe.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b Cut the morcilla into rounds and place in the pot. If using the optional garbanzo beans, add them now and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
01361904-5c0e-469f-98f3-9a92e6c5232b The traditional way to serve callos is in earthenware bowls accompanied by rustic bread. Enjoy.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Gather the ingredients.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Preheat the oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas 6.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Heat the oil in a large frying pan, gently cook the chopped onion in the oil for 5 minutes, or until the onions are soft and translucent but not browned. Add the soy sauce, the lemon juice, garlic, and chili and cook for a further 2 minutes, again taking care not to burn.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Remove the pan from the heat, place the onion mixture on a plate and leave to cool, the mixture does not need to be cold.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Place the sausage meat in a large mixing bowl, add the cooled onion mixture and 2 of the eggs. Mix well until all the ingredients are thoroughly and evenly mixed.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf On a lightly floured surface, roll out half the pastry to a 20cm x 25cm (8" x 10") rectangle. Cut lengthwise into 2 strips. Repeat with the remaining pastry. Rest the pastry for at least 10 mins in the refrigerator.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Form the sausage meat mixture into 4 long sausages the length of the pastry strips. Place each sausage into the center of each pastry strip. Beat the 3rd egg in a basin and lightly brush the edges of the pastry with the beaten egg.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Fold the pastry over the meat filling to form 2 long rolls. Brush the top surface with beaten egg.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Cut the rolls into 4cm / 1 / 1/2" lengths. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet and cook in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
9365ee5f-6d40-495c-b048-66fbd768ecdf Cool, the sausage rolls on a cooling rack, they are delicious eaten hot or cold. If popping into a lunch box or a picnic basket, let the rolls cool completely.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Gather the ingredients.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Cut off the root end of the green onions and slice them thinly, keeping the white and light green parts separate from the dark green parts. Set aside.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the Instant Pot inner pot and select the sauté button. When the oil is hot and shimmering, add the sliced andouille sausage. Cook the sausage slices for about 3 minutes, or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. With a slotted spoon, remove the sausage to paper towels to drain and set aside.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the diced chicken to the pot along with the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of vegetable oil; cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. With a slotted spoon, remove the chicken to a plate and set aside.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the chopped yellow onion to the pot along with the bell pepper and celery. If necessary, add more vegetable oil. Cook for about 3 minutes, or until the onion is translucent, stirring frequently.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the minced garlic, Creole seasonings, and thyme to the vegetables and cook for 1 minute longer. Cancel the sauté function.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the bay leaf and chicken stock. Stir, scraping the bottom to ensure there are no browned bits stuck to the pan. Taste and add salt if needed.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the tomatoes (with their juices) along with the rice and the white and light green parts of the sliced green onions. Return the sausage and chicken to the pot. Stir to combine the ingredients.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Lock the lid in place and turn the steam release knob to the sealing position. Select the manual or pressure cook button (high pressure) and set the timer to 7 minutes. When the time is up, do a quick release following the manufacturer's instructions. When the float valve drops, remove the cover—the pot will automatically switch to the keep warm setting.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Add the shrimp to the pot and stir to combine the ingredients. Cover the pot and let it stand on the warm setting for 10 minutes. The shrimp should be cooked through.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Remove the cover and stir in about half of the reserved dark green parts of the sliced green onions.
49b0df3b-3c64-4375-b7dc-c6c8bc8d3b7f Garnish servings with the remaining dark green parts of the green onions and chopped parsley, if desired.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Gather the ingredients.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Boil squash whole until just tender; about 6 minutes.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Drain and carefully split the squash lengthwise.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Using a spoon, scoop out pulp, taking care not to break the outer shells.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Set pulp aside. Place squash shells in a baking dish.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 In a skillet over medium-high heat, cook sausage with onion. Add salt and pepper to taste; remove from heat.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Add squash pulp, breadcrumbs, and seasoned salt. Add a little water if the mixture is too dry.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Stuff squash shells with the sausage mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
c1d627a5-ea84-4ad9-97d0-10b00dda8019 Bake at 375 F for 15 to 20 minutes or until hot and browned.
d8d6bd94-81e0-46af-901c-b04e902fb9a9 Wash the beans and soak them overnight. Drain well.
d8d6bd94-81e0-46af-901c-b04e902fb9a9 In a large kettle, combine the soaked beans with onion, garlic, bay leaf, seasoned salt, Kosher salt, pepper, and ham hocks; cover with cold water. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer, for about 2 to 3 hours, or until done.
d8d6bd94-81e0-46af-901c-b04e902fb9a9 About 30 minutes before the dish is done, add sliced smoked sausage, if using. Continue cooking for about 30 minutes longer.
d8d6bd94-81e0-46af-901c-b04e902fb9a9 Serve the beans with hot cooked rice.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 Gather the ingredients.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 Preheat your air fryer to 375 F. Add the hot dogs to the basked of your air fryer in one even layer.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 Place the insert in the air fryer and air fry for five minutes. You can shake the basket to turn the hot dogs half way through cooking.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 If you like your buns to be toasted, then add the hot dogs to the buns and add them back into the air fryer for another 2 minutes. This gives the buns a little crisp and won’t overcook the hot dogs.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 Top with your favorite toppings and enjoy immediately.
16bc7202-e2c0-4b4f-a621-22b8ef048da8 Preparing them from frozen.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 Gather the ingredients and preheat the oven to 375 F/190 C.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 Lightly grease a baking tray and cover with baking parchment. Set aside.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 On a chopping board, lay the slices of streaky bacon side by side. Using the back of a dinner knife, stretch the bacon as far as it will go without tearing it. Cut each slice into thirds.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 Take each cocktail sausage and wrap it tightly with the bacon.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 Lay the wrapped sausage on the prepared baking tray with the seam underneath. Continue until you have used up all the bacon and sausages.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 At this point, the tray can be covered and placed in the refrigerator to cook later.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 As soon as you need your pigs in a blanket, pop them into the oven and cook for about 20 minutes or until the bacon is crisp and golden and the sausage is cooked through.
6b672f1a-806e-4e4b-b187-31e2bbd4d5e0 Serve alongside your roast turkey or goose on the Christmas table or even cold the next day on your Boxing Day buffet.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Brown the breakfast sausage in a large pan. Be careful not to overcook as it will be cooked in the crock pot as well. Drain the excess oil and set aside.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Grease the crock pot with a non-stick spray. Place the frozen hash browns in the bottom of the crock pot.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Sprinkle the onions and green pepper over the top of the potatoes.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Beat the eggs together with the cheese, hot sauce, pepper, and season salt. Pour the eggs over the onions and potatoes. Then top with the cooked breakfast sausage.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Cook on low, overnight. The low setting cooks for eight hours; be careful not to let it cook much longer than eight hours.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Open the crock pot and stir the ingredients together so that they are completely combined.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 Warm the tortillas, place the sliced avocado, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa into bowls. Allow guests to assemble their burritos on their own.
c4f06cfd-bbfc-451e-bd9d-e361283dd710 If you are making them to freeze, place a 1/2 cup of filling into the center of each tortilla and top with any combination of toppings that you wish. (Note: Avocado does not freeze as well, so be mindful of that.) Roll and fold the burrito, wrap with plastic wrap, and then wrap with aluminum foil. Place in the freezer. When ready to reheat, remove the foil and microwave for 2 to 3 minutes. The burritos will keep frozen for 6 to 8 months.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 One hour ahead of time, prepare the rice and lotus leaves. Soak the lotus leaves in hot water for 1 hour. Pat dry. Cover the rice with water and let soak for 1 hour. Drain.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Next, steam the rice. Line a bamboo steamer with parchment paper or cabbage leaf. Fill a wok approximately to the halfway point with water so that the steamer will be sitting above the water without touching. Bring the water to a boil cover the rice and steam for about 20 minutes. Remove the rice, cover and keep warm while preparing the remainder of the ingredients.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Soften the dried mushrooms by soaking in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Squeeze out any excess water, remove the stems and finely chop.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Cut the chicken into small cubes about the size of a postage stamp. Add the salt, 1 tablespoon rice wine and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. Marinate the chicken for 20 minutes.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Finely chop the sausages. Peel and chop the garlic. In a small bowl, combine the rice wine, light soy, and dark soy sauce. In a separate small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and whisk into the sauce.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Heat a wok and add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and stir-fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds). Add the chicken cubes. Stir-fry until they turn white and are 80 percent cooked through.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Add the sausages and the mushrooms. Stir-fry for a minute. Give the sauce mixture a quick re-stir then add in the middle, stirring quickly to thicken. Season with pepper to taste. Cook for 1 to 2 more minutes to mix everything together and heat through. Remove from the heat and stir in the sesame oil. Cool.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 To make the wraps, separate the rice and the filling into 8 equal sections, 1 section for each wrap. Lay a lotus leaf in front of you. Place a portion of the rice mixture into the center of a lotus leaf. Add the meat and vegetable mixture over top, shaping the rice with your hands so that it forms a ring around the filling. Add more rice to cover.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Form a square parcel with the lotus leaf and tie it up with twine. Repeat with the remaining lotus leaves.
a2756714-d187-4754-b337-e345def25b99 Steam the lotus leaf parcels, covered, on a heatproof plate in a bamboo steamer for 15 minutes, or until they are done.
4785c2e9-f13e-4afd-bec7-a34da9109254 Butter a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Heat the oven to 325 F (165 C/Gas 3).
4785c2e9-f13e-4afd-bec7-a34da9109254 Cube bread and place evenly in the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with sausage and cheese.
4785c2e9-f13e-4afd-bec7-a34da9109254 In a bowl, whisk the eggs with the milk, salt, and pepper. Pour over the layers in the pan.
4785c2e9-f13e-4afd-bec7-a34da9109254 Bake 45 minutes or until set. Cut into squares to serve.
4785c2e9-f13e-4afd-bec7-a34da9109254 This casserole may also be prepared the night before. Just cover and refrigerate the unbaked casserole. Take it out of the refrigerator about 15 minutes before baking time; bake as directed.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Gather the ingredients.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Preheat oven for 350 F/175 C.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Roll out one of the dough balls to form a 14-inch pizza round.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Transfer to pizza stone and place it into the oven. Bake for 5 to 6 minutes until the dough has firmed up a bit.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Meanwhile, roll out the second dough ball.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Remove the first crust from oven.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Warm pulled pork (do not make it hot) combine with 1/2 cup barbecue sauce (you can add another 1/4 cup if the meat is too dry).
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Place onto semi-cooked pizza dough making sure to spread evenly.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Add uncooked rolled dough on top. It will be bigger since the partially cooked dough will shrink a bit in the oven. Gently tuck excess dough underneath, pressing to seal edges.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Place into the oven for 5 to 6 minutes.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Remove from oven and coat top with 1 cup of barbecue sauce. Add chopped brisket, chopped sausage, sliced onion, and cheese. Brush olive oil on edges of the crust.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Place pizza back into the oven for 20 minutes.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Once cooked through and crust takes on a golden brown color, remove from oven and let sit for a few minutes.
4c3cc14a-f39a-4c64-b33b-30223632c1df Slice pizza, and serve. Enjoy!
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e Soak the garbanzo beans in a large pot of cold water for 12 hours. (Garbanzo beans are much harder than other types of beans, such as pintos.) Be sure that the water covers the garbanzo beans entirely so that they soften.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e In a large pot with 13 cups of water, put the beef, ham bone, pig's foot, bacon, and ham. Bring water to a boil and skim any fat, etc. off the top. Add the half chicken, garbanzo beans, carrot, turnip, and onion. Simmer for 2 1/2 hours.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e Peel and wash the potatoes. Cut in half and add to the pot after two hours. Add salt to taste. Check pot often and add additional water if too much evaporates.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e Chop the cabbage into eighths. Remove 2 cups of broth from the stew and put into a large stockpot. Place the cabbage in the pot with 2 cups broth and 2 cups water and boil with the sausages until cabbage is soft.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e Take as much stock from the pot of meat as you need and mix it with an equal amount of stock from the cabbage. Bring to a boil. Break angel hair pasta pieces in quarters. Add pasta to pot and cook until al dente.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e This delicious cocoa madrilene is served from two dishes. Serve up the pasta with broth in soup bowls as a first course.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e In a deep open serving dish, arrange garbanzo beans (well-drained) on one side, then on the other side place beef, cabbage and sausages cut in half.
d59a770a-e593-4307-9810-848bc937d84e Let everyone mix the ingredients and enjoy!
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Place the sauerkraut, wine, butter, thyme, and bay leaf in a saucepan and bring to the boil.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Turn the heat down and leave to simmer for 15 minutes, stirring every now and then.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Season to taste with salt & pepper and allow to cool.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Remove the bay leaf.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Mix the mayonnaise, mustard, chives, and parsley together in a small bowl. Set aside until later.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Heat the rookworsten (see Tips).
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Cut the sausages on a deep diagonal into thin, broad slices. Split the bread rolls and spread generously with the mustard-mayonnaise.
317676f6-2602-43ea-8ff3-d70f70480fcf Top with sauerkraut and the slices of rookworst. Serve immediately.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Gather the ingredients.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Remove the core from the cabbage. Chop the leaves crosswise into even pieces about 1 1/2 inches wide. Thinly slice the sausage on the diagonal. Chop the green onion into 1-inch pieces.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd In a small bowl, combine the chicken broth, hot bean sauce, and sugar. In a separate small bowl, stir together the cornstarch and water.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Preheat a wok over medium-high heat and add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and salt. Stir for 10 - 15 seconds.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Add the lower white parts of the green onion, and the sausage. Stir-fry the sausage for 2 minutes.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Push the sausage to the sides of the pan. Add the chopped cabbage. Sprinkle the rice wine or sherry over. Stir-fry for about 1 1/2 minutes, until the green leaves darken slightly.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Restir the sauce and pour it over the cabbage. Reduce heat and let simmer for 1 1/2 minutes. Add the green onions. Check the seasoning, adding soy sauce, salt or pepper if desired.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Give the cornstarch and water mixture a quick re-stir. Turn the heat back up and add the mixture in the middle of the wok, stirring quickly to thicken. Stir to mix everything together and serve hot.
4af814cc-0ca3-4053-9064-12501e07e7cd Enjoy!
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Gather the ingredients.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Heat the oven to 350 F. Lightly grease a 9" x 5" x 3" loaf pan or spray it with nonstick cooking spray.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Combine the chopped onion, celery, and garlic.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e In a small bowl, lightly beat the egg.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Combine the beef, sausage, and crumbs; mix until well blended.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Add the chopped vegetable mixture, egg, milk, ketchup or chili sauce, salt, and pepper. Using your hands, mix the ingredients until blended.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Pack the beef mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 1 hour.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Carefully pour off the excess fat.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Then, pour the tomato sauce over the top of the loaf.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Return the loaf to the oven and bake for 20 minutes longer.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Let the meatloaf rest for 10 minutes.
f974795d-8317-4095-86f4-a1594c60ea9e Then slice or remove to a platter, as desired.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Gather the ingredients.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Lightly butter each slice of bread and then cut the slices in half. Arrange the bread slices in a 9 x13 x 2-inch baking pan.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 In a large skillet or saute pan, brown the sausage. Use a spatula or spoon to break it up. Drain and pat with paper towels. Sprinkle the sausage over the bread. Top the sausage with the shredded cheese.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, dry mustard, and the half and half or milk until well blended. Pour egg mixture over bread, sausage, and cheese.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Cover the pan with foil and refrigerate overnight.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Remove the casserole from the refrigerator and let it stand at room temperature for about 20 minutes.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Remove the foil from pan and bake the casserole for 45 minutes, or until it is bubbly around the edges and lightly browned on top. It might take a bit longer if it's still quite cold. A butter knife inserted into the center of the should come out clean when it's done.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Remove the breakfast casserole to a rack and let it stand for 15 to 20 minutes before serving.
3927f402-0eee-49dd-b0da-daf7196f2764 Serve and enjoy!
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Cut the fresh pork into cubes, approximately 3/4 inch. Cut the morcilla sausage into thick slices.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Cut tomatoes into slices, approximately 1/3 inch thick. Peel potatoes and cut into slices approximately 1/4 inch thick.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Pour a few tablespoons of olive oil into the casserole dish and heat. When it is hot enough, fry the pork, sausage slices and whole head of garlic. Add slices of one tomato into the pan and stir.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Add the rice into the pan and stir the contents of the frying pan. Add olive oil if necessary.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Pour the broth and sprinkle the chickpeas around the dish. Simmer for 10 minutes while you fry the potatoes. Add more broth if necessary.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Heat oven to 375 F.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c In a small frying pan, heat approximately half an inch of olive oil. When hot enough, add the potato slices. Lightly fry them and remove the potatoes.
d944af90-ef99-4227-94ad-a2c5f0cb396c Add the rest of the tomato in the dish, laying slices on top. Place potato slices on top of the rice. Cover and bake the meal in the oven until golden brown.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Gather the ingredients.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the ground beef and pork sausage with the onion, celery, and bell pepper until the ground meats are no longer pink.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Add ketchup, barbecue sauce, water, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and seasonings to the browned meat.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Bring to a simmer and turn to low.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Spoon the meat mixture over the split toasted buns or slider buns.
087a666d-4faa-4931-be33-fc5a4bae8013 Serve and enjoy!
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except sausage casings (if using) in a large bowl.
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 Knead the mixture well to evenly distribute the spices, herbs, and harissa.
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 Shape as desired.
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 Alternatively, you can pass the ingredients through a meat grinder and feed the merguez mixture into sausage casings.
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 For the best flavor, allow the merguez to sit for 30 minutes or longer in the refrigerator before cooking.
aaf75550-be6b-4210-9abd-4b89b167cee5 Place on grill or under broiler until cooked through and meat registers temperature of 155 F with meat thermometer.
2981428b-75ed-43e9-bf74-cf22f72b29e9 Toss the sliced potatoes, sausage, and onions together in a 5-quart to 7-quart slow cooker.
2981428b-75ed-43e9-bf74-cf22f72b29e9 In a large bowl, combine the two cans of soup, milk, pepper, and cheese.
2981428b-75ed-43e9-bf74-cf22f72b29e9 Gently stir the soup mixture into the potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika.
2981428b-75ed-43e9-bf74-cf22f72b29e9 Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours, or until the potatoes are tender, stirring once about halfway through the cooking time.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Preheat oven to 400 F.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Grease a glass 13x9x2" baking dish with unsalted butter, or spray with nonstick baking spray, and set aside.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb In a large skillet, cook the sausage, bell pepper, onion, and garlic over medium heat, stirring frequently, until sausage is no longer pink; drain well.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Stir together the sausage mixture, potatoes and 1 1/2 cups of the cheese in the prepared baking dish.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb In a medium bowl, combine the baking mix, milk, half and half, pepper, eggs, and thyme and whisk until blended.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Pour into the baking dish over sausages and potatoes.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Bake the casserole, uncovered, for 40 to 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese, and bake 1 to 2 minutes longer until cheese is melted.
ae0dc5ec-76ef-466a-92b2-89cd9d58effb Cool for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Peel the onion and chop it coarsely.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Peel and dice the carrots.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Slice the bell pepper in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and ribs.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Cut into 1/4-inch dice.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Heat the olive oil in a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Add the onion and saute for about 3 minutes.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Add the carrots, bell pepper, celery, minced garlic, and sausage and cook for 2 more minutes.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab If the sausage is fatty, drain off excess fat.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Add the lima beans, salt, pepper, basil, and chicken stock.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Add drained and rinsed beans.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes longer.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Stir in the chopped parsley.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Spoon the soup into serving dishes.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab If desired, top each serving with seasoned croutons.
d137cf53-0dd3-40bf-af2a-357ad66bc6ab Serve with cornbread, crusty French bread, or rolls.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 Gather the ingredients.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 Combine chicken, sausage, chopped bell pepper and chopped onion in the crockery insert of the slow cooker. Add the tomatoes, chicken broth, wine, oregano, parsley, Cajun seasoning, and pepper; stir gently.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours, or on high for 3 to 4 hours.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 About 20 to 30 minutes before the dish is ready, add the cooked shrimp and hot cooked rice; heat thoroughly.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 Serve the dish with crusty French bread or cornbread.
27b521ab-b0af-406c-9f99-2a92687f9e35 Enjoy!
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb Gather the ingredients.
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb Preheat oven to 325 F.
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb Combine the brown sugar, garlic, salt, nutmeg, allspice, and pepper in a small bowl.
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb In a large oven-safe Dutch oven or large casserole, layer half of the cabbage, half of the onion, half of the apple, and half of the sausage slices. Sprinkle with half of the brown sugar and spice mixture. Repeat the layers with the remaining cabbage, onion, apple, sausage, and brown sugar mixture. Pour the apple juice and vinegar over the casserole.
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb Cover tightly and bake for 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Add more juice if needed.
f5d8d016-3620-49ca-b70e-28d85a429cbb Serve and enjoy!
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Gather the ingredients.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 In a large skillet, cook sausage and onion, breaking up sausage with a spatula. When sausage is cooked through, drain off excess fat.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 In the prepared baking dish, layer the hash brown potatoes, half of the shredded cheese, browned sausage and onion mixture, then the remaining shredded cheese.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and pepper; pour the egg mixture over cheese.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 45 to 55 minutes, or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Transfer the casserole to a wire rack and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Cut into squares. Serve with salsa, if desired.
cc7627af-97e4-49c9-b007-aa2e5e0e3a98 Enjoy!
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 Heat the oven to 350 F.
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 Line the pie shell with a sheet of foil and fill at least 3/4 full with pie weights or dry beans. Bake the pie shell in the preheated oven for 7 minutes. Remove it to a rack and cool.
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 In a skillet over medium heat, brown the sausage, breaking up and turning until the meat is no longer pink. Drain well.
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 Arrange the sliced hard-cooked eggs in the bottom of the cooled crust; top with the drained browned sausage and shredded cheeses.
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 In a bowl, whisk together the 3 eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. Pour egg mixture over sausage and cheese mixture.
57ec30eb-73e5-43e0-8dac-0eca0d0e9cf6 Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Remove to a rack and let stand for 8 to 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Put the beans in a large bowl and cover with water to a depth of about 2 to 3 inches above the beans. The beans will absorb some water as they soak. Cover the bowl and let stand at room temperature overnight (or at least 4 to 6 hours).
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Drain the beans thoroughly and transfer them to a stockpot or Dutch oven.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Add fresh water to cover—about 6 cups—along with the sausage and ham, onion, garlic, thyme, pepper, sage, and cayenne. Bring the beans to boil over medium-high heat.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Reduce heat to low and cover the pan. Simmer the beans until they are tender, adding more water if necessary to keep them from drying out. This will take 2 to 3 hours.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Add salt to taste. Discard the ham bones.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Remove about 1/4 cup of beans from the mixture and mash them. Return the mashed beans to the Dutch oven and stir to blend.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Simmer the beans for 15 minutes longer.
4cdc378e-5593-451e-b4fb-5cfae373a59c Serve the red beans over hot boiled rice along with cornbread and a salad, if desired.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Gather the ingredients.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Place the eggs in a pan of boiling water and cook for exactly 7 minutes. Remove from the pan and plunge into iced water to stop them cooking. Once cool, peel the eggs and put to one side.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Heat the oven to 190 C / 375 F
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Dust the hard-boiled eggs by rolling them in the seasoned flour.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Place the sausage meat in a large bowl, add the Worcestershire sauce, spring onions, fresh herbs, and mace, if using, and season with salt and pepper. Mix thoroughly.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Divide the sausage meat into 4 equal portions.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Form each portion into a flat cake large enough to fit around the egg. Work the sausage meat around the egg as evenly as possible whilst working hard to keep the egg shape and making sure there are no cracks. Place the meat coated eggs in the fridge for 15 minutes.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Roll the boiled eggs in the seasoned flour followed by the beaten egg, then into the crumbs and press lightly to ensure a good 'fix'.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Heat 4 cm / 1 1/2" of oil in a deep frying pan. Heat the oil to 180 C / 350 F (or until a cube of bread turns golden brown) in less than a minute. Place the coated eggs in the oil, raise the heat slightly and cook the eggs, turning frequently for 3 minutes. Remove the eggs and then place on a tray and pop into the preheated oven for 6 minutes or until golden brown all over.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Drain on kitchen paper and serve warm or cool if for a picnic or lunch box.
0ac92f2b-f59f-4d4a-8038-35cbac1aec1d Scotch eggs can be made the day before and kept in the fridge.
44e2a80f-dfc5-4990-9ca6-f3f2abf8abb5 Brown sausage well then drain off grease. Add bread cubes, apples, celery, raisins, onion, 1/4 cup of the melted butter, 2 tablespoons of the chicken broth, sage, poultry seasoning, and salt; mix well.
44e2a80f-dfc5-4990-9ca6-f3f2abf8abb5 In a separate or cup, combine remaining 1/2 cup melted butter and 3 tablespoons chicken broth. Set aside to use for basting.
44e2a80f-dfc5-4990-9ca6-f3f2abf8abb5 Lightly stuff Cornish hens with dressing mixture; close the openings with skewers. Place hens in a large roasting pan; bake at 400 F for 1 hour, or until the Cornish hens are tender. Baste Cornish hens occasionally with combined remaining margarine and chicken broth.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Gather the ingredients.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Heat the oven to 450 F.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Remove stems from mushrooms; chop stems and set aside.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Put the sausage in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the sausage, stirring and breaking up until it is fully cooked. Remove the sausage to a bowl, leaving 1 or 2 tablespoons of drippings in the skillet.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Cook the mushroom stems in the drippings for 5 to 10 minutes, until tender and browned. Remove the pan from the heat.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Stir the cooked mushroom pieces into the bowl with the sausage.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Add the bread crumbs and cheese; blend thoroughly.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Fill mushroom caps with the sausage mixture.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 If desired, top the stuffed mushrooms with more mozzarella cheese and return to the oven just until the cheese has melted.
f4eff480-ba3c-4e83-ac16-839bb0e80444 Serve and enjoy!
29fb8d0c-e6b4-440d-9e75-ddc83b089371 In large pot, cook the pork sausage with onion and garlic until browned.
29fb8d0c-e6b4-440d-9e75-ddc83b089371 Stir in green bell pepper and celery; cook and stir for 3 minutes longer.
29fb8d0c-e6b4-440d-9e75-ddc83b089371 Add all remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.
29fb8d0c-e6b4-440d-9e75-ddc83b089371 Cover, reduce heat to low, then cook, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender, about 40 to 50 minutes.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Gather the ingredients.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 In a heavy skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage, breaking up and stirring until no longer pink. Remove the sausage to a bowl with a slotted spoon and set aside.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Leave 3 tablespoons of drippings in the skillet. If there aren't 3 tablespoons left, add some butter, shortening, or bacon drippings to make 3 tablespoons.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Place the skillet back over medium heat and sprinkle the flour over the drippings. Cook, stirring constantly until the roux is lightly browned.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Gradually add 1 cup of the milk. Stir to loosen any bits of cooked sausage from the bottom of the pan.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Taste and season with salt and pepper; keep stirring until the gravy has thickened. Add more milk or cream as needed to reach the desired consistency.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Add the sausage to the gravy, if desired.
427f8b33-d38a-4793-9436-bc0fa36625a6 Serve and enjoy on top of biscuits.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Gather the ingredients.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or kettle over medium heat.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Add onion, carrots, celery, and sliced sausage to the pan. Sauté for 3 to 4 minutes, or until onion is wilted.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 more minute.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Add the cabbage, apple juice, broth, vinegar, brown sugar, and pepper. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Cover and simmer for 45 minutes.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Add the beans, parsley, and tomatoes. Taste for salt.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Cover and simmer for 15 more minutes.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Ladle in individual bowls and garnish with parsley.
98ac8e55-c177-4e87-a4b9-bebb66dbca9e Enjoy hot with freshly baked bread or biscuits.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Gather the ingredients.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Fire up the grill.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 In a medium bowl, mix the softened cream cheese and shredded colby jack together. Transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a round tip. If you don't have a pastry bag, use a zip-lock freezer bag, then use scissors to cut away one of the corners.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Cut off the stem end of the jalapenos. Use a small, thin knife - such as a grapefruit or steak knife - to remove the seeds and soft white membranes inside the peppers, leaving a hollow cone, open at one end. Take care not to split the peppers.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Pipe the cheese mixture into the peppers.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Divide the sausage into 12 4-ounce portions. Flatten each of the portions into a thin oval, then wrap the sausage around the stuffed peppers, encasing them completely. If your jalapenos vary in size and shape you may have to make some adjustments in order to fully wrap them.
1146e373-863a-4925-9117-5a41a4654054 Sear the armadillo eggs on the grill with direct heat for about 2 minutes on each side, then reduce the heat and move them to a spot with indirect heat, if possible, and close the grill. Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the cheese begins to escape, bubbling through its sausage enclosure. Remove from the grill and serve immediately.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Brine the pork tenderloin: combine the Kosher salt, brown sugar, oregano sprigs and water in a large pot over low heat, stirring to dissolve the salt and sugar. Take the pot off the heat and let the brine cool completely (you can add several ice cubes to assist in the cooling down).
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 When the brine is cooled, lay the pork tenderloins in a glass baking dish (or alternatively, in food-storage plastic bags), and cover with the brine (including oregano sprigs). Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Prepare the stuffing: heat the olive oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the minced onion, garlic and minced oregano leaves, and saute 2 to 3 minutes until softened. Allow to cool completely, then mix together with the pork sausage, 1/2 teaspoon Kosher salt and several good grinds of fresh pepper in a bowl.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Remove the tenderloins from brine, and discard the brine. Pat the tenderloins dry with paper towels. Cut each tenderloin down the center length-wise, without cutting all the way through, leaving 1/2-inch thickness.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Lay each tenderloin between 2 pieces of plastic wrap, and gently pound to 1/4-inch thickness into a rectangle. Discard the plastic wrap.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Spread the sausage mixture evenly over each tenderloin, leaving a 1-inch border all around. Cover the sausage layer with the sliced provolone.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 With the long side facing you, tightly roll up the tenderloin away from you, tucking in the ends. Secure the tenderloins with kitchen string at 2-inch intervals. Lightly brush the tenderloins with vegetable oil and season with Kosher salt and pepper.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Heat the grill to high with the cover closed. Keep the far right burner on, but turn off the other burners. Oil the grill grate, then lay the tenderloins on the unlit side. Cover the grill and cook 20 to 25 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 138°F to 140°F on an instant-read thermometer.
f3b56e3a-0408-4864-8cbc-b884d2d97e68 Transfer the tenderloins to a cutting board and loosely cover with foil for 20 minutes. Cut off the kitchen string, slice the tenderloins into 1/2-inch slices, and serve.
508bdeb1-2d1d-4cd9-a9b2-210ac92901ec Rub the chicken pieces with the paprika.
508bdeb1-2d1d-4cd9-a9b2-210ac92901ec Heat olive oil in a large skillet; add chicken and brown on all sides. Remove chicken from skillet.
508bdeb1-2d1d-4cd9-a9b2-210ac92901ec Add onion, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Sauté over low heat until onion is tender, about 10 minutes.
508bdeb1-2d1d-4cd9-a9b2-210ac92901ec Stir in sausage, tomatoes, chicken broth, rice, thyme, salt, pepper, and hot sauce. Add chicken and turn to coat with sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender.
508bdeb1-2d1d-4cd9-a9b2-210ac92901ec Stir in shrimp and cook about 3 to 5 minutes longer or just until shrimp turns pink.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Gather the ingredients.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Pour beans into a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the beef and pork sausage, breaking up with a spatula, until no longer pink.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Drain well and stir into beans.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c In the same skillet in a small amount of olive oil as needed, sauté the onion over medium heat until lightly browned.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Add red bell pepper and garlic; saute, stirring, for 1 minute longer.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Stir the vegetables into the beans.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Add chile pepper, jalapenos, salt, seasoning, and barbecue sauce. Stir to blend.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Cover and cook on high for 3 to 4 hours or low for 6 to 8 hours.
032ca42c-d231-4c0a-95e4-a9d55079ec7c Serve and enjoy!
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Gather the ingredients.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 When the sausage meat is at room temperature, place it in a large mixing bowl with the chestnuts and mix gently.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Add the breadcrumbs, apricots, truffles, and foie gras (if using). Season with a large pinch of salt and pepper.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Place the goose breast-side down and remove any excess fat and sinews. Place a roll of the stuffing down the center of the goose between the breast fillets.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Tuck in the legs and wings, then fold in the skin at the sides and edges over the stuffing. Roll tightly and tie with string.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Lay the goose on a sheet of foil and pull the edges together and twist at the ends to form a large sausage.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Place the goose into a large pan. Cover with water, then add the onion, carrots, and celery. Bring to the boil, simmer gently for 1 hour, turning occasionally.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Remove the packet from the stock, strain the vegetables. Reserve the vegetables and the stock on one side.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Preheat the oven to 375 F/190 C/Gas 5. Place the packet in a roasting tin and roast in a moderate oven for 1 hour 30 mins.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Remove the foil from the goose, return it to the roasting tin, place the giblets, vegetable mixture, garlic, and herbs around the goose and cook for a further 30 minutes. Remove from the oven.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Wrap the cooked goose tightly in a fresh piece of foil and leave on one side to rest.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Pour away any fat in the roasting tin. Place the tin on a high heat on the stove, add the stock from the vegetables, and stir thoroughly, scraping up all the bits on the bottom of the dish.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Simmer on a low heat for 20 mins then strain through a fine sieve. Adjust the seasoning and reduce further to create a slightly thick stock. Just before serving, whisk in a few small pieces of very cold butter.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Before serving, unwrap the goose, slice into thick slices, being careful not to break the stuffing in the center.
e80ebbe9-7bbb-4ea6-bd3e-7b27fb5a52c9 Serve and enjoy with the gravy.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Gather the ingredients.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Beat the eggs in a large bowl until combined and then add to the skillet.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Cook the eggs, scraping the bottom of the skillet with a spatula and turning the eggs over occasionally until they are scrambled and set.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Add the cooked sausage and salsa to the scrambled egg mixture and mix gently.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Warm the tortillas as directed on the product package.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Place about 1/2 cup of the egg and sausage mixture onto each tortilla and sprinkle with some of the cheese.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Roll up each tortilla to make burritos, folding in the ends. Don't overfill the tortillas or they will burst during reheating.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 Place the burritos on parchment paper-lined cookie sheets and freeze them until they are completely frozen and firm. Then wrap each burrito individually in freezer wrap and package in zip-close freezer bags.
1b5255f4-bc2a-4b43-b229-a7991a740427 When you're ready to eat, unwrap the burritos, wrap them loosely in microwave-safe paper towel and heat in the microwave on high power for 1 to 3 minutes until the filling is hot and the cheese is melted.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil or parchment paper.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b In a mixing bowl, combine the raw ground sausage and shredded cheese with the baking mix; blend with your hands until well mixed. If desired, add the grated onion and poultry seasoning. Alternatively, use a stand mixer with the paddle attachment.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Shape the mixture into 1 inch balls and arrange them on the prepared baking sheet.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Bake in the preheated oven for about 12 to 15 minutes, or until golden brown.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b The sausage will be fully cooked, but if you are doubtful, you can check a few with an instant-read thermometer. They should register at least 160 F, the minimum safe temperature for ground pork.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Remove the sausage balls to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Serve with toothpicks and a mustard mayonnaise dip, aioli, or ranch-style dressing.
a43ceaeb-183c-4859-8b04-1fc07ca9050b Enjoy!
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 400 F.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Cut the bacon slices in half, crosswise, to make short strips.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Fry the bacon in a large pan over medium heat until some of the fat is rendered but the bacon is still pliable. Do not let the bacon get crispy or you won't be able to wrap it around the sausages.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Place the bacon on paper towels and cool it down for five minutes.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Wrap each sausage with a piece of the precooked bacon and secure with a toothpick.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Place the sugar in a bowl and roll each little sausage and bacon bundle in it. Place the sausages on a wire rack.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Place the rack in a 13" x 9" baking pan lined with foil or parchment paper.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Drizzle the maple syrup over the sausages and sprinkle with the pepper.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Bake the bacon-wrapped sausages for 25 to 35 minutes, or until the sausages are hot and the bacon is crispy.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Remove the rack from the baking pan and cool the wrapped sausage bundles for 4 to 5 minutes before serving. Always use the wire rack. The drippings that come from the bacon and sugar burn easily; keeping the sausages away from the drippings avoids them burning, too.
9ad15d87-d263-482e-bd5c-57f8f544f2f5 Serve with sauces of your liking and enjoy!
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 Heat the oven to 325 F (165 C/Gas 3). Butter an 8-inch square baking dish.
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 In a heavy skillet, brown sausage, breaking up with a spatula. Drain off excess fat; set aside. If using bacon, fry until crispy, drain, and crumble.
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 In a saucepan, bring salted water to a boil and stir in grits. Cover, reduce heat to low and continue cooking for 5 minutes longer, stirring occasionally.​
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 In a medium saucepan or saucier, melt butter; stir in flour and pepper. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Add cheese, stirring until blended.
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 Add the drained sausage or bacon and half of the cheese sauce to the cooked grits.
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish. With the back of a large serving spoon, make four indentations in the grits. Break an egg into each indentation. Sprinkle lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
07d3d661-fb9a-4baf-93d6-b8ca07022d35 Bake for about 18 to 22 minutes, or until eggs are done as desired. Reheat remaining cheese sauce and drizzle over the eggs or serve on the side.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Heat the oven to 350 F.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d In a heavy skillet or saute pan over medium heat, cook the sausage, stirring, until browned. Remove the sausage to drain, leaving about 3 tablespoons of fat in the pan.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Cook the celery, green pepper, and onion in the remaining sausage fat until onion is translucent. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Spoon the browned sausage, vegetables, and almonds into a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Add rice and the chicken broth; mix well.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Cover and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until liquid is completely absorbed and the rice is tender.
f134e97c-60ae-4631-b9f6-0f68dfcd751d Serve and enjoy!
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Gather the ingredients.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Place the beans in a large saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring the beans to a gentle simmer over medium heat. Cover and cook them until they begin to turn tender, about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Add 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper to the beans and cook until the liquid has absorbed, about 25 additional minutes.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Remove the beans from the heat, drain and discard any other liquid, and set the beans aside.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the lardons for 5 minutes, until they turn brown. Transfer them to a plate.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Add the onions to the pan and sauté them for 10 minutes, until they turn light golden brown. Transfer them to the plate with the lardons.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Brown the sausage and transfer it to a bowl.
