d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Drain all but 4 tablespoons of the fat from the skillet. Add the chicken breast pieces to the fat and brown them over medium-high heat. Transfer the chicken to the bowl with the sausage.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Brown the chicken legs in the skillet. Then transfer them to the bowl.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Combine the lardons, onions, sausage, chicken pieces and legs, tomatoes, wine, chicken stock, bouquet garni, garlic, tomato paste, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper in a large casserole dish.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Cover with a lid or foil and bake the casserole for 25 minutes.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Add the carrots to the pan, cover, and bake for an additional 20 minutes.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Add the reserved white beans to the hot casserole and gently stir the mixture.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 In a small bowl, toss the bread crumbs, parsley, and thyme with the melted butter. Sprinkle the seasoned bread crumbs over the casserole.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Bake it, uncovered, for 1 hour.
d534cf16-074b-45fc-8f95-c99d61b64985 Discard the bouquet garni and serve the cassoulet hot.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Gather the ingredients.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Clean lentils well by soaking them briefly and changing the water at least once.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Put soaked lentils in a 2½-quart saucepan, add cold water to cover, and bring to a boil.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Once boiling, lower heat to simmer and cook until not quite done, about 45 minutes.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Meanwhile, pierce sausages in several places with knife or fork, and then put them in a small saucepan.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Add enough chicken broth to cover sausages, and place over medium heat.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Bring chicken broth to a gentle boil, and then simmer for about 40 minutes. From time to time, skim off and discard foam and fat that rise to the top.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 When sausages are done, remove the pot from the heat and let them sit in the broth while you finish the lentils.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Then, warm the oil in a medium skillet, and sauté the onion, celery, carrot, garlic, and sage in the olive oil over medium heat until the onion is translucent and the vegetables are done.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Then, drain the sausages, saving their liquid. To the lentil pot, add the vegetables, season with salt and pepper, and add tomato paste. Mix gently using a wooden spoon.
e602ddfa-e8c4-4f93-a54a-e7ee8e50de07 Add ¾ cup of the broth in which you cooked the sausages. Taste and adjust the seasoning, if needed.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Gather the ingredients.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Heat the oven to 350 F. Lightly butter a shallow 2-quart baking dish or spray it with cooking oil spray.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Cook the noodles in a saucepan of boiling salted water following the package directions.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Drain in a colander and set aside.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Crumble the sausage into a large skillet and add the chopped onion and green bell pepper.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Place the skillet over medium heat and cook, stirring, until the sausage has browned and vegetables are tender. Drain off excess drippings.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d In a large bowl, combine the sausage mixture with the cream of chicken soup, water, and cooked noodles. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with crumbled French fried onions.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
42456070-1ad7-4227-bd62-45bfc77d496d Serve and enjoy!
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 Cut a thin slice off the top off each roll and set aside. Hollow out each roll, leaving a shell about 1/4" thick. (You can save the crumbs to make bread crumbs; freeze them for another use.)
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 In a large skillet, cook the sausage with the onion and garlic, stirring to break up the meat, until the sausage is browned and cooked. Drain well.
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 Add the pasta sauce and Italian seasoning to the meat in the skillet; simmer for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 In a medium bowl, beat together the ricotta cheese, cream cheese, and egg until blended. Stir in the Havarti cheese and mozzarella cheese.
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 Divide the meat mixture among the hollowed-out rolls. Top each with the ricotta mixture and sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Place all of the filled rolls on a cookie sheet.
79436a50-af3f-452a-9223-e256959cd711 Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until the cheese on top starts to brown. Let the sandwiches cool for 10 minutes before serving.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f In a large bowl combine the ground beef, sausage, egg, ketchup, 2 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce, mustard, soy sauce, garlic, salt, and freshly ground black pepper. Mix gently until the mixture is well combined.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f Shape the meat mixture into small balls (about 1 inch in diameter). Use a small cookie scoop or weigh the meatballs as you shape if you want to make sure they are uniform in size.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f Arrange the meatballs on the prepared baking sheet.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f Bake the meatballs for 25 to 30 minutes or until browned and thoroughly cooked. The minimum safe temperature for ground beef and ground pork is 160 F (71 C). If you use ground poultry in the meatballs, cook to 165 F (74 C).
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f Transfer the meatballs to the slow cooker or a large, deep skillet or saute pan.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f In a bowl, combine the condensed soup, sour cream, 1 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, and milk. Blend well. Pour over the meatballs. Cover and cook on low for 1 to 2 hours, or until hot, or heat over low heat in a saute pan on the stovetop for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until hot (do not boil).
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f If serving as an appetizer, serve them hot from the slow cooker or chafing dish, with toothpicks, small plates, and napkins for guests.
65681d24-3c41-4244-b737-1cc597d6328f The meatballs also make a fabulous entree with rice or buttered noodles.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Gather the ingredients.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Lightly grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Cook the macaroni in boiling salted water following package directions; drain and set aside.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 In a skillet, saute the sausage, onion, and green bell pepper, stirring, until the sausage is no longer pink. Pour off excess fat.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Add the flour and salt to the sausage mixture, blending well. Gradually add milk. Continue to cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened. Stir in the cooked and drained macaroni and 1 cup of the shredded Cheddar cheese.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Transfer macaroni and sausage casserole mixture to the prepared casserole.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Sprinkle remaining cheese over sausage casserole and bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes.
dc184ae3-fdb8-4acc-a0b4-1c3bb0f2fbe2 Serve and enjoy!
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb Butter a shallow 2-quart baking dish.
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb Tear bread into small pieces and sprinkle in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Arrange sausage patties over the bread; sprinkle with green onion, tomato, then the cheese.
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, seasoned salt or Creole seasoning, black pepper, and paprika. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the cheese layer.
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb Refrigerate overnight or bake immediately.
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb If refrigerating overnight, take the casserole out of the refrigerator about 30 minutes before baking. Bake at in a preheated 350 F oven for 40 to 45 minutes, until set in the center.
a34d1d56-eb38-4852-9bec-c7fd0d7d94fb The minimum safe temperature for eggs is 160 F. If in doubt, check with an instant-read thermometer.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 Heat the oven to 375 F.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 In a large bowl combine the ground beef and sausage, egg, ketchup, 2 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce, mustard, soy sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend thoroughly and then shape the mixture into small meatballs. Place on a rimmed foil-lined baking sheet or jelly roll pan.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 45 minutes, or until browned and cooked through.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 In a medium bowl mix the sauce ingredients together. Place meatballs and sauce in a crockpot. Cook on HIGH for 30 to 45 minutes, or until the sauce is hot.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 The mixture may also be cooked on the stovetop. Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook for about 10 minutes. Do not boil.
7ce3a9ef-0246-4f2b-ab01-6e1163f3f683 Use as a main dish served over rice or noodles or as an appetizer served with toothpicks.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Fill a large stockpot with about 8 quarts of water. Add the crab boil seasoning and bring to a full boil. Continue boiling for 10 to 15 minutes.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Cut sausage into 2-inch lengths; add to water.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Scrub the potatoes and cut into 2-inch chunks. If small, leave whole. Add to the water. Boil for 10 minutes.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Cut sausage into 2-inch lengths; add to potatoes.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Boil for 10 minutes.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Break ears of corn in half; add to water and continue boiling for 2 minutes
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Add shrimp; boil 2 to 3 minutes longer.
38f7d2af-ab20-4eb6-bd92-44596ed74d9e Drain and serve immediately with cocktail sauce and melted butter.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Gather the ingredients.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Preheat oven to 400 F and lightly coat a baking sheet with non-stick spray or a homemade oil-based spray.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Arrange the mushroom caps, top down, on the baking sheet. Spray with a light layer of cooking spray, then bake in the oven until just slightly softened; about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven, and set the mushrooms aside.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saute vegetarian sausage until it is separated and resembles cooked loose sausage, about 4 minutes. Use a wooden spoon to break it up as needed. Transfer the cooked vegetarian sausage to a bowl, and set aside.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Heat the remaining oil in the skillet and saute the onion, peppers, and garlic until they are soft—about 6 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, then mix in the cooked sausage, bread crumbs, and parsley. Season the filling to taste with a bit of salt and pepper.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Form 1 tablespoon of the sausage and onion filling into a ball. Place it into a mushroom cap, pressing it firmly into the mushroom. (It should be generously mounded.) Repeat, filling all the mushrooms. Arrange the stuffed mushrooms on the baking sheet.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Bake the stuffed mushrooms until the filling is lightly browned on top, about 12 minutes. Just before serving, squeeze a bit of lemon juice on the mushrooms, if desired.
d4914698-ec0e-4ae8-9c5a-091dfad69d04 Enjoy!
57700afc-e341-4073-b5a6-fb6f8cd88e9b Cut pork tenderloin into 1 inch rounds. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat.
57700afc-e341-4073-b5a6-fb6f8cd88e9b Meanwhile, preheat oven to 375 F, and spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.​
57700afc-e341-4073-b5a6-fb6f8cd88e9b Sauté medallions one minute per side, then transfer to baking sheet.
57700afc-e341-4073-b5a6-fb6f8cd88e9b Whisk vinegar, honey, and mustard together in a small bowl. Generously brush medallions with glaze.
57700afc-e341-4073-b5a6-fb6f8cd88e9b Cook in the oven for 10 minutes.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 Trim the pork of excess fat and remove the silver skin. Cut into 3/4-inch slices and set aside.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add the shallot and mushrooms and cook, stirring, until mushrooms are tender. Remove the mushrooms to a plate and set aside. Add the remaining tablespoon of butter to the skillet along with the olive oil.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 Cook the pork medallions for about 10 minutes, turning to brown both sides, or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and remove to a warm plate; keep warm.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 Add wine or apple juice to the skillet. Stir in the cream and mustard; bring to a boil. Boil, stirring, for about 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms to the cream mixture and cook for 1 minute longer.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 Arrange pork medallions on a serving platter and spoon mushroom sauce over all. Sprinkle with rosemary leaves, if desired.
d9178238-8900-4427-8edc-e23e62418988 Serve with noodles, rice, or potatoes along with a tossed salad or steamed vegetables.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b Pierce the tenderloin all over with a fork and place in baking dish.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b Mix remaining ingredients and pour over pork.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours, turning pork once or twice. Or just let the pork marinate at room temperature for 15 minutes.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b When ready to cook, preheat oven to 350 F.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b Place the two tenderloins on a shallow baking pan, at least 2 inches apart.
421caf2f-bceb-4446-b3e5-3ec67a44cc1b Roast for 35 to 40 minutes until pork registers 145 F on a meat thermometer. Let stand 5 minutes, then slice to serve. Pork will be light pink in the center.
32265d8a-f645-4305-b55c-d3a7d2baf38c Heat the oven to 350 F.
32265d8a-f645-4305-b55c-d3a7d2baf38c Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Trim excess fat and silver skin from the pork. Season with the salt and pepper or grill seasoning. Sear on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes total. Transfer to a baking pan.
32265d8a-f645-4305-b55c-d3a7d2baf38c Combine the remaining ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and set aside.
32265d8a-f645-4305-b55c-d3a7d2baf38c Roast the pork tenderloin in the preheated oven for about 12 minutes. Brush generously with the glaze mixture and then continue roasting for 5 to 10 minutes longer, or until the pork registers at least 145 F on an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a tenderloin.
32265d8a-f645-4305-b55c-d3a7d2baf38c Reheat the remaining glaze and serve with the pork.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Gather the ingredients.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Preheat oven to 350 F.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Wash tenderloins and pat dry. Remove excess fat and silver skin.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Sprinkle the tenderloins all over with seasoning and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the tenderloins on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes total.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Transfer the tenderloins to the oven and roast for about 15 to 20 minutes (could be longer, depending on the thickness of tenderloins), or until an instant-read thermometer or meat thermometer registers 145 F to 150 F when inserted in the thickest part of tenderloin.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff While the pork tenderloins are roasting, prepare the cherry sauce. In a saucepan, combine the jam, vinegar, brown sugar, cinnamon, allspice, and a dash of salt. Bring to a simmer and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 6 to 8 minutes.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Remove pork tenderloins from the oven and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve with warm cherry sauce.
aa7922a9-18b8-4549-9c21-5a31f52bceff Enjoy!
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Gather the ingredients.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Cut each tenderloin lengthwise, but not all the way through. Flatten. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Heat 1/3 cup apple juice with butter and sage. Stir in chopped apple and onion and stuffing mix.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Spread stuffing mixture over one flattened pork tenderloin, then put the other flattened pork tenderloin on top. Skewer shut.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Place pork in a shallow baking pan. Pour the remaining 1 cup of apple juice over the meat then lay bacon across the top.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Roast uncovered at 350 F for 1 1/2 hours, or until cooked through.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Remove skewers.
a6be0cf7-14ea-4a9a-947c-eb6ad6b06720 Enjoy!
607080f4-ffa4-4ef2-8a94-cbe29077aecc Preheat oven to 400 F.
607080f4-ffa4-4ef2-8a94-cbe29077aecc Line a baking pan with foil, spray with cooking spray and place in oven.
607080f4-ffa4-4ef2-8a94-cbe29077aecc Trim fat from pork tenderloins and butterfly the meat, cutting them nearly in half lengthwise. Open the pork tenderloins and layout, pounding to flatten with the palm of the hand or the bottom of a heavy skillet.
607080f4-ffa4-4ef2-8a94-cbe29077aecc Chop rosemary if using fresh. Rub pork tenderloins all over with cut sides of garlic halves then olive oil, then sprinkle rosemary, salt, and pepper on both sides.
607080f4-ffa4-4ef2-8a94-cbe29077aecc Remove baking pan from the oven and place pork on the hot tray. Return to oven and roast for about 20 minutes (at least 145 F internal temperature). Remove and let stand 5 minutes, then slice.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 In a large ovenproof skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Trim excess fat from pork.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 In a bowl combine the 2 tablespoons of mustard with the salt and pepper. Rub the mixture over the pork tenderloins. Add the pork to the hot skillet and brown on all sides. This will take 4 to 6 minutes. Transfer to the oven and roast, uncovered, for about 30 minutes, or until the tenderloins reach or exceed the minimum safe temperature for pork, 145 F/63 C.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 Remove pork to a serving plate and tent loosely with a sheet of foil.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 Add the sauce ingredients to the skillet and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring and scraping up browned bits. Simmer for 1 minute.
1a4c4737-6f6f-4aa4-9a1c-e7548a82dc97 To serve, drizzle the sauce over the sliced pork tenderloins.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Gather the ingredients.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Combine yogurt with onion, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, salt, cumin, coriander, and black pepper in medium bowl.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Place pork pieces in a resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over pork. Make sure all pieces of pork are coated well.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Release air from the bag and seal well. Place pork in the refrigerator and let marinate for 4 to 12 hours.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Preheat grill to medium heat.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Thread marinated pork pieces onto skewers, about 4 to 5 pieces on each depending on the length of skewer. Do not overcrowd.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Grill over a medium fire for about 25 to 30 minutes, turning often, or until pork has cooked through (reaching an internal temperature of 140 F/60 C).
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Once cooked, remove from the heat and allow to rest for 10 minutes, covered, before serving.
b90ee702-2a2c-4a81-90e0-428e585bdcbe Serve and enjoy!
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Gather the ingredients.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Prepare the vegetables. Peel the onion and chop. Slice the bell pepper lengthwise; remove the seeds and ribs and chop. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into 1-inch pieces.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Lightly oil the slow cooker or spray it with nonstick cooking spray. Pat the pork roast dry with paper towels; trim and discard excess fat. Place the pork in the slow cooker. Arrange the sweet potatoes, bell pepper, and onions around the pork.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, brown sugar, cinnamon, and black pepper. Stir until well mixed.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Spoon the tomato mixture over the pork roast and vegetables. If the tomatoes aren't very juicy, add about 1/2 cup of chicken stock.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Cover the pot and set the slow cooker to 3 hours on high or 5 hours on low. If you want the pork to be falling apart, add an hour to the low setting or about 1/2 hour to 45 minutes to the high setting.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 When the dish is ready, arrange the pork and sweet potatoes on a platter and keep warm. Drizzle juices over the pork and vegetables just before serving.
a23fbd5e-48b2-4109-b2c4-5d849caa06c7 Enjoy your meal!
4983eb63-b86a-478a-a0ca-d94a7337117a Heat oven to 200 F.
4983eb63-b86a-478a-a0ca-d94a7337117a Season pork medallions generously with salt and pepper.
4983eb63-b86a-478a-a0ca-d94a7337117a Heat oil in a medium skillet (not non-stick) over medium heat. Add pork and cook on each side until browned, about three minutes per side. Place medallions on a plate in the oven.
4983eb63-b86a-478a-a0ca-d94a7337117a Melt butter in skillet. Add shallots, apples, sage, and rosemary and saute until browned. Add Calvados and chicken stock and deglaze the pan. Reduce liquid by 1/3.
4983eb63-b86a-478a-a0ca-d94a7337117a Add cream and reduce to desired consistency. Divide pork between plates and spoon apples and sauce over the top.
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Place flour in the cooking bag and shake to coat the interior. Cut the pork tenderloin lengthwise, stopping about 1/2-inch from cutting through. Open the split and flatten the meat out with the smooth side of a meat tenderizer.
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 In a skillet over medium-low heat, saute the onions, celery, carrot, garlic, and thyme in the butter until the vegetables are tender. Add 1 1/2 cups cooked wild rice; stir to combine. Taste and add kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, as needed.
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Spread the stuffing mixture over the split flattened pork tenderloin. Fold the meat back over itself and tie with kitchen string to secure. Add the tied tenderloin and chicken broth to the prepared cooking bag; close bag with the provided tie.
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Place the bag in a shallow baking dish or pan. Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the pork reaches the safe minimum temperature of 145 F (63 C).
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Pour the chicken broth into a saucepan and skim off excess fat. Combine cornstarch with a few teaspoons of water and stir to dissolve. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the broth and cook, stirring, until thickened. Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper, if necessary.
da2afcd4-7f02-4233-8210-e4cae5a6d1a4 Slice the pork and serve with the sauce.
5b74b38b-6f4f-482b-805e-c53716733715 Combine the thyme, marjoram, salt, pepper, minced garlic, maple syrup, chicken broth, lemon juice, and melted butter in a large ziplock plastic bag and mix gently.
5b74b38b-6f4f-482b-805e-c53716733715 Add the pork slices, close the bag, turn to coat the meat, and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
5b74b38b-6f4f-482b-805e-c53716733715 Remove the pork from the marinade; discard marinade.
5b74b38b-6f4f-482b-805e-c53716733715 Grill the pork slices on a dual contact two-sided grill for 3 to 5 minutes until cooked to 145°F, or cook for 6 to 9 minutes, turning once, on a single grill over medium coals. You can also grill this outside on gas or charcoal; cook for 6 to 9 minutes, making sure you check for doneness at the earliest time.
5b74b38b-6f4f-482b-805e-c53716733715 Brush the pork with more maple syrup, if desired, and let stand for 2 minutes, and serve.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Gather the ingredients.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Pat the pork loin with a paper towel to remove excess moisture. If desired, cut away any excess fat. You can also leave it on and then pour the liquids in a gravy separator to remove excess fat.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f In a small bowl combine the garlic powder, thyme, paprika, freshly ground black pepper, and kosher salt.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Rub the pork all over with the mixture.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Heat the olive oil in a large skillet and sear the pork on all sides.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Place the pork in a slow cooker.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f In a 2-cup measuring cup combine the chicken stock, lemon juice, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce; blend well.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Pour the liquids into the crock pot with the roast.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for about 3 hours. Check the roast at the lower time for doneness to avoid overcooking. An instant-read thermometer should register at least 145 F (63 C).
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Remove the roast to a platter, tent with foil, and keep warm.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Pour the liquids into a gravy separator, then into a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Taste and adjust the seasonings. If the liquids are very watery from the long cooking time, boil for a few minutes to reduce and concentrate the flavors.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Put the cornstarch in a small cup or bowl and whisk with the cold water. Whisk the cornstarch mixture into the simmering liquids and continue cooking, stirring, until the sauce is thickened.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Slice the pork and serve it with the hot thickened sauce.
fff7bfab-f4ba-4c69-8de8-376bacb8481f Enjoy!
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Gather the ingredients.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Preheat the oven to 325 F/165 C/Gas 3.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Rub pork loin with 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 1/2 teaspoons thyme, then sprinkle with salt and pepper; place pork loin in a shallow roasting pan.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Roast in the preheated oven for 50 to 55 minutes.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Meanwhile, peel and quarter potatoes.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Place potatoes in a large bowl; toss with olive oil, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, chives, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, and salt and pepper.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Place potatoes around pork loin; roast an additional 45 to 60 minutes, or until pork registers at least 145 F on a thermometer.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Cover roast pork loin with foil and let stand for about 15 minutes before slicing.
065a4647-1f3c-4e0c-8b85-4cf1c39ec802 Serve and enjoy!
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Gather the ingredients.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Heat oven to 400 F.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Butterfly the pork by cutting horizontally down the center, but not all the way through. Open the meat up and lay flat. Place a sheet of plastic wrap over the meat and pound to thin it to a uniform thickness.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Sprinkle the meat lightly with salt and pepper.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 In a bowl, combine the stuffing mix, chicken broth, butter, and cranberries. Mix well.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Spoon onto the pork and pat evenly over the surface. Roll the pork up and fasten with a few pieces of kitchen twine.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Place, seam side down, in the baking dish. Rub the rolled-up pork all over with the cut side of the garlic. Sprinkle lightly with seasoned salt or more salt and pepper.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Roast for 10 minutes; reduce heat to 350 F and continue roasting for 45 minutes longer, or until pork registers 155 F on an instant-read thermometer.
e23a7cef-ce0e-4fa9-9d1d-8165bdbe8898 Let the pork stand for 5 minutes before slicing into 1/2-inch slices.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Gather the ingredients.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Preheat the oven to 325 F. Line a roasting pan with foil and place a rack in the pan. Add the pork roast to the rack and roast for about 25 to 30 minutes per pound, or 2 hours to 2 1/2 hours for a 5-pound roast. The roast should register at least 145 F on a food thermometer, the minimum safe temperature for pork.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Meanwhile, make the barbecue sauce. Heat the butter or vegetable oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and translucent.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Add the water, ketchup, cider vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, paprika, salt, garlic powder, dry mustard, black pepper, and ground cloves and mix well.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Bring the sauce mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced and thickened somewhat and the flavors are concentrated.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Baste the pork roast with the barbecue sauce several times during the last 30 to 45 minutes of roasting time.
c1fb460d-df36-458a-bf19-6efb453ef0ce Let the roast rest for 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 Gather the ingredients.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 With a small, sharp knife, make 16 small cuts—about 1/4- to 1/2-inch deep—in the pork roast. Insert the garlic quarters.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 In a small bowl combine salt, herbs, and lemon peel. Rub seasoning mixture into the roast.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 Pour 1/2 cup water into slow cooker; add the roast. Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours. Pork roast should read at least 145 F on an instant-read thermometer.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 If desired, thicken juices. Remove roast from juices. Combine cornstarch with the 3 tablespoons water; stir until smooth then stir into the crockpot juices. Cook on HIGH until thickened. Serve with the pork roast.
3d0880ab-defe-4325-a26b-6f6281c546b1 Enjoy!
565c0736-1f14-4f59-86b3-9e0c00da1e97 In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar with the curry powder, cumin, salt, and pepper, and mix well. Rub the spice mixture thoroughly into the pork roast.
565c0736-1f14-4f59-86b3-9e0c00da1e97 Place the chopped onions and garlic in the bottom of a 4 to 5-quart crockpot. Place the roast on top of the onions. Pour the apple juice overall.
565c0736-1f14-4f59-86b3-9e0c00da1e97 Cover the crockpot and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or until a reliable meat thermometer reads 140 F.
565c0736-1f14-4f59-86b3-9e0c00da1e97 Remove the pork from the crockpot and cover it snugly with foil. Let the pork stand for 15 minutes before slicing.
565c0736-1f14-4f59-86b3-9e0c00da1e97 You can thicken the oniony juices with some cornstarch dissolved in water and serve alongside if you like. Pour the juices from the slow cooker into a saucepan. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of cornstarch mixed with more apple juice. Bring the mixture to a boil until it thickens to the consistency you want.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Gather the ingredients.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Preheat oven to 350 F.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Combine the steak seasoning and 1 tablespoon brown sugar; rub the mixture all over the roast.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Put the roast in a foil-lined baking dish. Arrange bacon over the pork, tucking the ends under the roast.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Roast to about 140 F on an instant-read thermometer, or about 55 minutes.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Combine glaze ingredients. Generously brush the glaze mixture over the roast and continue roasting for 15 minutes, or until the roast registers about 155 F on a meat thermometer or instant-read thermometer.
ec24fd3a-b6b3-45dd-a4db-790612fe5fd6 Serve and enjoy!
0025bb74-353d-45f1-b320-c2c9796fa7a8 Place potatoes and bell peppers in the bottom of 4 to 5-quart slow cooker.
0025bb74-353d-45f1-b320-c2c9796fa7a8 In a small bowl, mix mustard, thyme, salt, and pepper and spread evenly over pork.
0025bb74-353d-45f1-b320-c2c9796fa7a8 Place the pork on top of the vegetables in the slow cooker and pour beef broth over all.
0025bb74-353d-45f1-b320-c2c9796fa7a8 Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours. Slice pork and serve with vegetables and juices. If you have a new, hotter cooking crockpot, cook on low for 6 to 7 hours until pork registers 145 F.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Gather the ingredients.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Lightly grease a 5 to 6-quart slow cooker.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Put stuffing mix in a large bowl.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a In a skillet or sauté pan, cook the onion, celery, and carrots in the butter over medium-low heat until softened. Combine the onion mixture with the stuffing mix.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Add the parsley, chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and dried cranberries; mix well.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Spoon stuffing mixture into the slow cooker.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Combine the rub ingredients and rub over the pork roast. Place pork on the stuffing mixture.
bfb9e940-9b18-43e1-a524-22ce83bb3b1a Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours, or until pork is cooked through.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Heat oven to 400 F. Line a baking pan with heavy duty foil and place the roast on the foil.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Rub the pork loin all over with the Cajun seasoning blend.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Roast for 20 minutes.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Combine the apple juice, honey, and brown sugar; mix well.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Reduce the oven heat to 325 F.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Roast for about 1 hour to 1 1/2 hours longer, frequently basting with the honey mixture, or to about 145 F on a meat thermometer.
ca7abf12-ab0b-4cf0-b457-1365067c0bab Let the roast rest for 15 to 20 minutes before slicing.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Gather the ingredients.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Preheat the oven to 425 F. Place a rack in a shallow, foil-lined roasting pan or 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Place the pork loin roast on the rack and rub all sides of the pork with the cut sides of the pieces of garlic. Sprinkle all sides of roast evenly with the seasoned salt and freshly ground black pepper.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Roast the pork uncovered for about 20 to 25 minutes per pound, or until the internal temperature of the roast when using an instant-read thermometer is at least 145 F to 160 F.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Tent the roast loosely with foil and let it rest for 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
bf68b7c8-f9aa-4aa8-99fd-f4d422c353f7 Slice and serve with your choice of sides.
60c89158-afe1-4779-9077-39c78df68ef8 Heat oven to 325 F.
60c89158-afe1-4779-9077-39c78df68ef8 Rub the roast all over with the garlic halves; discard the garlic. Place the roast, fat side up, on a rack in a roasting pan; sprinkle with salt and pepper. If there is little fat on top of the roast, lay 2 slices of bacon across the top (optional).
60c89158-afe1-4779-9077-39c78df68ef8 Roast the pork, uncovered, for about 2 hours.
60c89158-afe1-4779-9077-39c78df68ef8 Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Brush the glaze over the roast and continue baking for 30 to 45 minutes, or until the roast registers about 155 F on a meat thermometer inserted into the center of the meatiest part of the roast (not touching bone or fat). Let the roast rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Whisk together apple cider, brown sugar, and salt. If you don't have a whisk, substitute with a fork.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Then, place pork loin roast and apple cider mixture in a heavy zip-top bag. Squeeze out the air from the bag and seal. Refrigerate for eight hours or overnight.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Drain pork loin roast, discarding the liquid. Rub all sides with Worcestershire sauce.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Next, whisk together brown sugar, kosher salt, paprika, onion powder, sage, and chipotle chile pepper. Coat the roast evenly with the spice mixture.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Preheat oven to 425 F. Line a 9-inch by 13-inch baking pan with foil and insert a roasting rack. Place the pork loin roast on the baking rack, fat side up.
762e82ce-3dcf-4840-a1c0-f6027797b20a Roast for 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 F, and roast an additional hour (165 F internal temperature recommended). Remove from oven, tent with foil and let rest for 15 minutes before slicing to serve. Garnish with apple slices, if desired.
8c73d08a-b128-4776-a6f7-e703673adfdf Place the pork loin roast in the slow cooker and coat all sides with the minced garlic.
8c73d08a-b128-4776-a6f7-e703673adfdf In a bowl, combine the cranberry sauce, brown sugar, apple juice, and chopped apples. Pour sauce over pork.
8c73d08a-b128-4776-a6f7-e703673adfdf Cover the crockpot and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours. Taste the sauce and add salt and pepper as needed.
8c73d08a-b128-4776-a6f7-e703673adfdf If you think the sauce needs thickening, you can add a cornstarch slurry. In a small bowl, stir the cornstarch with the cold water until smooth. Add the slurry to the liquids and stir to blend. Increase the setting to HIGH and continue cooking for 5 to 10 minutes, until thickened.
8c73d08a-b128-4776-a6f7-e703673adfdf Remove the pork from the crockpot onto a cutting board. Slice the pork and arrange on a platter. Spoon over sauce and serve.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Gather the ingredients.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 In a large Dutch oven or oven-safe roasting pan, coat the bottom with vegetable oil and bring the temperature up to high. Brown the pork loin roast in the hot oil on all sides. Remove the pork roast from the pan. Drain all but 3 tablespoons of fat from pan.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 In the pan, sauté onions and carrots in the pan drippings until softened. Stir in beer, salt, pepper, bay leaf, and whole cloves.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Return the pork to the pan or Dutch oven and cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 F for 2 hours or until the pork is tender. Check with a meat thermometer in the thickest part of the roast. It should be at least 145 F.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Place the pork loin on a serving platter and keep it warm.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Pour the cooking liquid from pan into a large bowl; skim off fat and remove the bay leaf.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Place the liquid with the vegetables into a blender; cover and process at low speed until smooth. Or press through sieve or process in a food processor in batches.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Pour the processed beer sauce into a saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring often.
48dc5a87-d983-48cd-9548-239f6884e891 Slice the pork roast. Spoon the sauce over the sliced pork to serve.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Gather the ingredients.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Brown pork roast on all sides in a large skillet.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Make cuts in roast with a small knife and insert garlic slices.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Place in slow cooker and season with salt, pepper, and sage and thyme or poultry seasoning.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Add broth and wine, if used.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Remove roast and skim excess fat from juices.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Combine flour with about three tablespoons cold water and whisk until smooth.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Turn the slow cooker to high and stir in the flour mixture.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Cook and stir until thickened (this can be done more quickly on the stovetop).
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Serve sauce over the pork with rice or potatoes.
89b3c4df-173e-46ce-b2b0-fdad807a9ed8 Enjoy!
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 Pour the water into a plastic container with a lid, large enough to fit the pork. Add the salt, maple syrup, garlic, black pepper, and rosemary. Whisk together until the salt is dissolved. Add the pork loin roast. The pork should be fully submerged, so place a small plate on top to weigh it down if necessary. Cover tightly and refrigerate for between 8 and 12 hours, or overnight.
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 Remove the pork from the brine, and pat dry with paper towels.
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 Rub with the oil, season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste, and place, fattier side up, in a small roasting pan. Roast in a preheated 325 F. oven for about 25 minutes per pound. For a 3-pound pork loin roast, the time will be about 1 hour 15 minutes.
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 While the pork loin roasts, mix the Dijon Mustard and the maple syrup together in a small bowl.
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 Approximately 30 minutes ahead of being done, remove the pork loin from the oven and spread the glaze over the top.
d2c32761-6bef-4c1a-9a2f-7eead51f1249 Remove when the loin's internal temp reaches 155-160 F. Let rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 Gather the ingredients.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 In a saucepan, combine broth, cornstarch, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 Reduce heat and continue to cook, stirring, until thickened.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 Arrange pork cubes on skewers, alternating with mushrooms, peppers, and onion wedges.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 Grill or broil for 20 to 30 minutes, or until done, turning and brushing with the sauce mixture frequently.
030bd6e3-e1fe-44d0-aba4-681dbcbbfc09 Serve with tomato wedges and hot cooked rice, if desired.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Pat the pork roast with paper towels to dry.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Combine the orange juice, minced garlic, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and honey or brown sugar in a large resealable food storage bag or container. Add the pork roast and seal. Marinate the pork for at least 2 hours or overnight, turning occasionally to keep the roast coated with marinade.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Heat the oven to 350 F.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Line a roasting pan with foil and place a rack in the pan.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Remove the roast from the marinade and place it on the rack in the prepared roasting pan. Wrap the tops of the bones with foil to keep them from becoming charred, if desired.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Roast the pork for about 20 minutes per pound. The minimum safe temperature for pork—according to the USDA—is 145 F. If unsure, check with an instant-read food thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the roast, not touching bone.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Bring the remaining marinade to a full boil. Combine the cornstarch and water and stir until smooth. Add the cornstarch mixture to the marinade and cook, stirring, until it is thickened.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 Tent the pork loosely with foil and let it rest for about 15 minutes.
55217737-1054-4152-9fa0-76034fb68613 To serve, slice the roast between the ribs and drizzle each slice with some of the sauce mixture.
f0a720c2-7bf0-4e8f-8497-e165b9e86ea6 Trim excess fat from the roast and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
f0a720c2-7bf0-4e8f-8497-e165b9e86ea6 Place the pork loin in the slow cooker or crock pot.
f0a720c2-7bf0-4e8f-8497-e165b9e86ea6 In a bowl combine cranberries, honey, orange zest, and spices and blend well. Spoon the cranberry mixture over roast.
f0a720c2-7bf0-4e8f-8497-e165b9e86ea6 Cover and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours or until the pork is cooked and tender.
f0a720c2-7bf0-4e8f-8497-e165b9e86ea6 Serve the roast with mashed or baked potatoes and steamed broccoli or green beans. Seasoned cornbread dressing or bread dressing would be an excellent side dish as well.
e9759cf9-7ade-41e1-8b12-bbc8a43d8e17 Place pork loin in a large glass baking dish. Combine marinade in and pour over meat. Make sure all sides are well coated with mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours.
e9759cf9-7ade-41e1-8b12-bbc8a43d8e17 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place onto grill and sear for 2 minutes on each side. Reduce heat to medium or medium-low and grill pork roast for 45 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 F, in thickest part of the meat. Once cooked through, remove heat and let meat rest before carving.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Rub the pork roast all over with the barbecue seasonings or seasoned salt.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Place the roast in the crock pot and then add the water or broth and onion.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 6 hours.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Drain off the excess liquids and add the canned beans, barbecue sauce, and pepper; cook for 2 to 3 hours longer.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Taste and add salt, as needed.
d50c76d1-1d67-4d63-808f-a7fbf06fdf48 Serve the pork on a platter with the beans, along with coleslaw, cornbread or muffins, and potato salad.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Pat the pork roast with paper towels to dry. Season all over with salt and pepper.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Peel the onion, cut it in half, and chop. Peel and mince the garlic.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large braising pan or Dutch oven over medium heat.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b When the butter is hot, add the onions; cook until translucent. Remove the onions to a plate and set aside.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Add the pork roast and brown on all sides. Add the minced garlic.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Remove outer leaves from the cabbage and then cut into 6 to 8 wedges or chop coarsely. Arrange the cabbage around the pork roast.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Heat oven to 325 F.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b In a cup, combine the apple juice, honey, and vinegar; stir in the dried leaf thyme. Pour over the pork and cabbage.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Cover the pan and transfer to the oven. Bake for 2 hours.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Scrub the fingerling potatoes and add them to the pork and cabbage. Cover and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour longer.
66726147-0d06-4871-9b49-7de088fc4e2b Pork should register at least 145 on an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the roast.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 Gather the ingredients.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 If the pork has an excessive layer of fat, trim it a bit. A little fat will help keep the roast juicy over the long period of cooking.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 Rub the roast all over with the garlic halves, then sprinkle with salt and pepper, then prick the roast all over with a fork or skewer.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 In a cup or bowl, combine 1 cup of the brown sugar, the mustard, and vinegar. Rub all over the roast.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours, or until tender but not falling apart. Pour off the excess juices.
11eeb89d-a570-4183-97f2-99872f43d3b2 Combine the remaining 1/3 cup brown sugar with cinnamon; Spread the mixture over the top of the roast. Cover and continue cooking on LOW for 1 hour longer.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Gather the ingredients.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e In a large oiled skillet or wok, sauté pork and potatoes for 2 to 3 minutes.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Add onion and zucchini and continue to sauté for 2 to 3 minutes.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Add bean paste, sesame oil, sugar, and garlic to the pan, stirring to combine. Sauté for 3 to 4 minutes.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Add 6 cups of water and the carrots and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Mix cornstarch with 1/2 cup cold water.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Pour into the sauce to thicken and cook for 15 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Prepare noodles according to package directions.
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Place a large helping of noodles in a big soup bowl. Ladle the jajang sauce over the noodles (myun).
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Serve with sliced raw onions and white vinegar on the side (to splash onto the noodles).
4efbb375-0683-4168-9bb5-03c819d44b6e Enjoy!
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Place the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high Brown the roast on all sides.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Transfer the roast into a large cooking pot and cover with the chicken stock (adding water if necessary to cover the meat completely).
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Cut the onion into quarters and add to the pot, along with the bay leaf.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Bring the liquid to a boil and simmer over low heat, covered, until the meat is cooked through and tender, about 1 1/2 hours depending on the size. When you cut into the meat, the juices should run clear.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Remove the meat from the pot and place it in a roasting pan. Reserve 2 cups of the cooking liquid. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Mix the aji panca paste, salt, vinegar, minced garlic, cumin, turmeric, and Sazón Goya together in a small bowl. (If you can't find jarred aji panca paste, you can also use dried aji panca peppers to make your own: soak the dried peppers briefly in very hot water, then process them in a blender or food processor with some vegetable oil to make a paste).
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Spread the aji pepper and garlic mixture onto the pork, turning it to cover all sides. Make several deep slits in the meat to help introduce the seasoning. Add the reserved cooking liquid to the roasting pan.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Roast the meat in the oven until heated through, turning the meat over once, for a total time of about 30-45 minutes.
4d59a239-61fd-40d2-a967-e6eff9fda582 Let cool, slice thinly, and serve with salsa criolla.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Add the fresh herbs, stems and all, into a 9 x 12 baking dish or pan, along with the olive oil.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Toss to coat, and lay the pork loin over the bed of herbs.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Season the pork loin generously with salt, fresh ground black pepper, and paprika. Scatter the garlic cloves around the meat.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Roast for 35 minutes, then remove and turn the pork loin over. Using a pair of tongs, cover the top of the pork with the wilted herbs.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Place back in the oven, and roast for 30 minutes more, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 155 F.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Allow to rest loosely covered with foil for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.
93b1560e-f1a5-4dbe-9380-e244d852e854 Garnish with the roasted garlic cloves and any of the natural meat juices from the pan.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d Pat the pork roast dry with paper towels. Trim and discard excess fat. Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper and place the roast in the crock pot.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d In a small bowl, combine the chicken stock, bouillon, green onions, red wine vinegar, and rosemary. Stir the mixture well and pour over the pork roast.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d Cover the crock pot and cook on low for about 4 to 6 hours. The roast can be cooked longer, but for neat slices, check for doneness after 4 hours.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d Remove roast to warm serving platter and keep warm.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d Strain the juices and skim off any excess fat. Pour 2/3 cup of the juices into a saucepan and add the cherry preserves. Add food coloring if desired. Bring to a boil and continue to cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until slightly reduced. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d Slice the pork roast and drizzle with some of the sauce. Serve the rest of the sauce at the table.
17918678-bc1b-4442-b3c2-7fda6132016d If desired, garnish servings with chopped chives or parsley.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Gather the ingredients.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Heat the oven to 325 F. Lightly oil a roasting pan.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a If the pork has been butterflied and tied, open it up and separate into halves.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a If it is all in one piece, slice the pork roast almost through; open and lay flat, cut side up. Again, cut almost through each side of the pork. Place a sheet of plastic wrap over the butterflied pork and pound to flatten.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a In a medium bowl, combine stuffing and melted butter.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Stir in remaining stuffing ingredients; mix well.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Spread stuffing on the pork and then roll or, if the pork is in two pieces, top it with the other half of the roast.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Secure roast halves well with skewers or toothpicks or tie it with kitchen twine and place in the prepared roasting pan; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Roast in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until a meat thermometer registers at least 160 F.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Let the roast stand for 10 minutes before slicing.
7656b12a-0dfb-4718-a0a1-0fc963d38f9a Enjoy!
008af69c-01d5-4a15-bd6f-b35adf9cf32a Place the pork loin in the slow cooker. Cut the smoked sausage into 2- to 3-inch pieces and add to the slow cooker, along with the knockwurst or bratwurst.
008af69c-01d5-4a15-bd6f-b35adf9cf32a In a bowl combine the rinsed sauerkraut, brown sugar, mustard, and seeds. Stir until well blended. Spoon over the pork and sausage and tuck a bay leaf into the mixture.
008af69c-01d5-4a15-bd6f-b35adf9cf32a Cover and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours or on high for about 4 hours.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Gather the ingredients.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Combine the paprika, coriander, cumin, cinnamon, ginger, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Heat oven to 425 F (220 C/Gas 7). Rinse the roast and remove any netting. Rub the roast all over with the spice mixture.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Place the pork roast on a rack in a baking dish or roasting pan and roast it in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Reduce heat to 350 F and continue roasting for about 1 to 1 1/4 hours, or until an instant-read thermometer or oven probe in the center of the thickest part of the roast reaches at least 145 F, the minimum safe temperature for pork, according to the USDA.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Remove the roast to a warm platter, tent with foil, and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
b5749b9c-1608-40cb-8766-fcdc302a1a2a Serve the roast with the sour cream gravy, below, along with mashed or baked potatoes and corn, steamed broccoli, or green beans. Seasoned bread or cornbread dressing also goes well with pork.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Gather the ingredients.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Preheat the oven to 350 F.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Trim excess fat from the pork roast. Sprinkle pork roast with salt and pepper or a seasoning blend, then rub on all sides with garlic.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Place the pork loin roast on a rack in a foil-lined roasting pan.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Roast the pork in the oven for 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes, or to about 135 F on a meat thermometer.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine remaining ingredients; boil for 15 to 20 minutes, until fruit is very tender. Process half of the glaze until smooth.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Spoon pureed mixture over the roast and roast for about 30 minutes longer.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Remove the roast from the oven and tent loosely with foil. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Place the roast on platter, slice, and spoon remaining cranberry-apple mixture around it.
e7e4790e-3d87-4831-8430-af01ff61959f Serve and enjoy!
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Place pork cubes in a shallow glass baking dish.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Combine other ingredients and mix well.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Pour over pork, cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Drain and reserve marinade. Arrange pork cubes onto skewers, leaving about 1/4 inch space in between each cube.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Brush marinade over meat and place on a hot grill.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Cook for about 5 minutes over a medium fire then turn.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Baste with more marinade and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Discard remaining marinade.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Continue cooking and turning until done, or once the meat reaches an internal temperature of 165 F.
6fbd4c72-3ecd-49ce-a999-e85a8fb9e1ec Once cooked, remove from heat and serve with side sauces of choice.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff Place the pork roast in a large zip-top plastic bag.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff Combine the remaining ingredients (beer, honey, Dijon mustard, chopped onion, olive oil, minced garlic, rosemary, salt, black pepper) and pour this marinade over the pork. Seal the bag and allow it to marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff Preheat grill to medium heat. Remove the pork roast from the bag and place it on a rotisserie over a drip pan. Reserve the marinade.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff In a saucepan, bring the marinade to a boil and then simmer 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the sauce from the heat. Baste the roast with the sauce every 20 minutes. The roast should cook for 1 1/2 hours or so and will reach an internal temperature of 160 F when it is cooked through.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff Once cooked, remove the roast from the heat and let sit for at least 5 minutes before carving.
117006c4-0f1e-47ef-8f28-924f701cc4ff Carve your pork roast crosswise into 1/2-inch slices to serve.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Gather the ingredients.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e If the roast is wrapped in netting, remove it. Sprinkle the roast all over with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Add to the onions and brown on all sides, about 8 to 10 minutes total.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Transfer the roast and onions to the slow cooker.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e In a bowl, combine the sauce ingredients.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Pour over the roast.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Cover and cook on LOW for 5 to 7 hours, or until the roast is tender and thoroughly cooked. The minimum safe temperature for pork (according to foodsafety.gov) is 145 F.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Carefully remove the pork loin roast to a pan or platter.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Skim excess fat from the sauce and pour into a saucepan. Bring to a boil on the stovetop and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is reduced and thickened, about 4 minutes.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Put the pork loin roast and sauce back in the slow cooker and keep warm until serving time.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Slice and serve the pork roast with potatoes and a side vegetable or serve in sandwiches with coleslaw.
965bd488-761e-4247-b249-cf982cb2610e Enjoy!
854eea45-57ab-47e9-a299-b1dc0386736a Preheat the oven to 450 F.
854eea45-57ab-47e9-a299-b1dc0386736a Place the roast in a shallow roasting pan. In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, thyme, marjoram, garlic, dry mustard, salt, and pepper, and mix to make a paste. Rub this mixture over the roast. Let the pork stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
854eea45-57ab-47e9-a299-b1dc0386736a Roast the pork for 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 300 F without opening the oven door.
854eea45-57ab-47e9-a299-b1dc0386736a Roast the pork until the internal temperature registers 145 F, about 18 to 23 minutes per pound. Let roast stand, covered, 5 to 10 minutes before carving.
854eea45-57ab-47e9-a299-b1dc0386736a You can also roast the pork at 350 F for 20 to 25 minutes per pound until the internal temperature registers 145 F. Cover the roast with aluminum foil and let stand for 10 minutes, then carve to serve.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Gather the ingredients.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Preheat the oven to 375 F.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, thyme, chicken broth, salt, and pepper. Roll pork in this mixture, then roll in both types of the Parmesan cheese to coat.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Place the pork on a roasting pan and sprinkle with any remaining cheese.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Roast, uncovered, for 40 to 50 minutes until an internal meat thermometer registers at least 145 F.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Remove pork from the pan, cover, and let stand 10 minutes before slicing to serve.
aaa8f3de-4f0f-40c2-bb2b-1de9e1fa907c Serve and enjoy!
2942ec8c-d148-440d-b700-d112642c8fb4 With sharp knife, make holes in pork roast and stuff holes with half of the garlic cloves. Sprinkle salt and pepper over roast.
2942ec8c-d148-440d-b700-d112642c8fb4 Brown in olive oil in heavy skillet over medium heat, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2942ec8c-d148-440d-b700-d112642c8fb4 Mix horseradish and mustard in small bowl and spread over roast.
2942ec8c-d148-440d-b700-d112642c8fb4 Place remaining garlic, baby carrots, onion, and potatoes in 4 to 5-quart crock pot. Arrange pork roast on top. Pour chicken broth over all. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours until pork roast is tender and thoroughly cooked.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 Gather the ingredients.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork and saute until no longer pink on the OUTSIDE. Alternatively, the pork and vegetables can be grilled.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 Add the onion, green peppers, tomatoes, and mushrooms in stages, sauteing a few minutes after each addition.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 When the onions are translucent and the tomatoes and mushrooms have exuded their juices, add the Vegeta and water, stirring well.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 Add the paprika and cook, stirring frequently, until the flavors have married, about 5 minutes, and the pork is tender and no longer pink on the INSIDE.
a03dabe0-7934-4329-9d70-5dd12ea1d583 Serve with mashed potatoes, pogacha bread and kajmak.
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 Heat oven to 325 F (165 C/Gas 3).
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 In a small bowl combine orange glaze ingredients. Blend well and refrigerate until needed.
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 In another small bowl combine the spice mixture ingredients and rub all over the pork.
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 Place the pork on a rack in a baking pan. Roast for about 20 to 25 minutes per pound.
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 About 15 minutes before the pork will be done, spoon the orange glaze mixture over the roast. Continue roasting to at least 145° F on a food thermometer.
995a31d2-3bae-49ae-85c4-bfdc1b244056 Tent the roast loosely with foil and let it rest for 10 minutes before carving.*
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Heat the oven to 325 F.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Place the pork loin roast in a roasting pan.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the sugar, paprika, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, Worcestershire sauce, pepper sauce, lemon juice, vinegar, and water.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Bring the mixture to a boil.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Spoon the sauce over the pork loin.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Roast the pork in the preheated oven for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours or to an internal temperature of at least 145 F on a meat thermometer.
ebc06010-c8d5-4821-ab91-a576c386581f Baste the roast pork frequently with the sauce throughout the cooking time.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de Place the potatoes and baby carrots around the bottom edge of a 4 to 6-quart crock pot.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de Place the onion and garlic in the bottom of the crockpot.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de In a small bowl, combine the mustard, tarragon, thyme, salt, and pepper, and spread over the pork roast.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de Place the roast in the crockpot on top of all of the vegetables and pour the beef broth over all.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de Cover the crockpot and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours or until the pork is 150 F on a meat thermometer and the vegetables are tender.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de Remove the pork and vegetables to a serving platter; cover tightly with foil to keep warm and let stand for 15 minutes.
2af9e01c-2401-4009-98dd-ecca852f33de During this time, thicken the juices in the slow cooker for a gravy by mixing the cornstarch with water using a wire whisk. Add this slurry to the juices in the crockpot and cook on high for 10 to 15 minutes until thickened. Serve the gravy with the meat and vegetables.
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc Gather the ingredients.
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc Heat the oven to 325 F (165 C/Gas 3).
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc Score the fat on the pork roast in a diamond design. Rub salt and pepper over surface of the meat. Place the roast, fat side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer into thickest part of the meat, making sure it does not touch fat or bone. Roast for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc In a saucepan combine the apricot nectar, brown sugar, cornstarch, mustard, and vinegar; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Reserve 1/2 cup apricot mixture for the sauce. Baste roast with the remaining apricot glaze mixture.
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc Roast the pork for an additional 30 minutes or until meat thermometer registers 160°. Remove the pork to a serving platter, reserving 3 tablespoons drippings. Keep the roast warm while you prepare the sauce.
ddd55407-aced-406a-9e14-d2c4f3336fdc Combine reserved apricot mixture and drippings in a medium saucepan; stir well. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until sauce comes to a full boil. Serve the roast with sauce.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Line a roasting pan (large enough to hold the roast) with foil.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d In a bowl blend the orange juice concentrate with the melted butter and steak sauce.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Sprinkle the pork roast lightly with salt and pepper and place it in the roasting pan.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Brush the orange mixture over the pork
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Roast for about 20 to 30 minutes per pound, or until the pork is fully cooked.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Baste the pork again with the orange juice mixture about 5 to 10 minutes before it's done.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Tent the roast loosely with foil and let it rest for 3 to 5 minutes before slicing.
9471f673-0c84-4176-844a-1c76ecd43a2d Check the pork with a food thermometer. It should register 145 F when inserted into the thickest part of the roast.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Gather the ingredients.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c In a medium saucepan, combine the peach preserves, honey, brown sugar, and lemon. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Set aside.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Heat oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4. Line a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking pan with foil.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Sprinkle the pork loin all over with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place the roast, in the prepared pan, fat side up. Roast for 1 hour.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Brush the roast all over with the peach glaze mixture. Continue roasting for about 30 to 40 minutes, brushing with glaze frequently.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Let the roast rest for 10 minutes, then slice and serve with the pan juices.
c30e6e34-fe9a-4701-b999-c62d51499d3c Check the temperature with an instant-read thermometer. It should read at least 145 F/62.8 C when inserted in the center of the roast.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Place pork roast in a resealable plastic bag.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Combine marinade ingredients and pour over meat. Make sure all is coated well.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Seal bag and place into the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Combine sauce ingredients in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Let the liquid come to a slight boil, reduce heat to low and let simmer for 12 to 15 minutes. The sauce should be thick enough to coat back of a spoon.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Remove half of the sauce for basting and leave the remaining to serve with pork.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Place into refrigerator until right before serving roast.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Remove roast from the mixture and save marinade in a small bowl for basting.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Follow grill instructions to place roasts securely on the spit.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Grill roast over indirect heat for 45 minutes to 1 1/4 hours, or until internal temperature reads around between 160 F/75 C.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Brush frequently with marinade during the first 30 to 45 minutes of cooking.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Once cooked, remove roast from heat and let rest for 10 minutes before carving.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Rewarm reserved sauce in microwave or saucepan.
50cfe43c-a4c7-4097-bf80-38c6fed0d724 Serve drizzle on top of meat or on the side.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 In a small bowl, combine the flour, 1 teaspoon salt, mustard, garlic powder, caraway seeds, sugar, pepper, and sage; rub over the pork loin roast.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 Cover and let stand for 30 minutes.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 Place on a greased baking rack, fat side up, in a roasting pan.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 Bake the pork roast, uncovered, at 325 F for 1 hour.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 In a bowl, combine the applesauce, brown sugar, nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon salt; mix well. Spread over roast.
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 Roast for about 1 hour longer or until internal temperature reaches at least 145 F, the minimum safe temperature for pork (USDA).
867b0fe1-d1ae-4d47-ac74-6d6ebd872903 Let the roast stand 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Drain juice from pineapple
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Pour juice in a Dutch oven.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Add vinegar, soy sauce, salt, ginger, and 1/2 cup water; stir until smooth.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Add pork and bring to a boil.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour, or until meat is tender.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Add onion, green pepper, red pepper, and pineapple chunks.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Simmer 10 minutes longer, or until onion and peppers are just tender.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Put cornstarch in a cup and stir in 3 tablespoons water.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Stir into pork and juices and heat to boiling
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Reduce heat, and simmer the sweet and sour pork for 1 minute.
1092cbd2-fca1-4f34-8a22-cb577e76f88a Serve sweet and sour pork with rice, if desired.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Gather the ingredients.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Preheat the oven to 375 F. Place a large ovenproof Dutch oven over medium-high heat and add the vegetable oil.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c When very hot, add the pork roast. Cook, turning the roast, until all sides are browned, about 6 minutes.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Remove from the heat.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c In a medium bowl, combine the honey, orange juice, apple juice concentrate, pepper, and brown sugar.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Spoon over the pork roast.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Place the sweet potatoes around the pork.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Cover and bake for 2 hours. Pork should register at least 145 F on an instant-read thermometer, the minimum safe temperature for pork.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Place the apple quarters around the pork.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Bake, uncovered, basting frequently, for 20 minutes, or until the apples are just tender.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Let the pork stand for 10 minutes.
bb9356ae-ff76-46d0-ba9b-255e9663ef6c Slice the pork roast and serve with the sweet potatoes and apples.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Gather the ingredients.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Peel the red onion and slice off the ends. Cut the onion in half lengthwise and slice each half thinly. In a small bowl or jar, combine the sliced onion with 1/3 cup of lime juice, 3/4 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. If desired, add 1 teaspoon of finely chopped cilantro. Set aside.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Pat the pork shoulder dry with paper towels, and cut it into large chunks.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Choose the high sauté setting on the Instant Pot and add 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Working in batches, brown the pork in the hot oil (about 8 minutes total).
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Cancel the sauté function, and put all the browned pork in the pot. Add the oregano, cumin, and 2 teaspoons of kosher salt. Toss with the pork, then add the jalapeño rings, quartered onion, and bay leaves. Cut the 2 oranges and 2 limes in half and juice them; add the juice to the pot along with the chicken stock.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Lock the lid in place, and make sure the steam release valve is in the sealing position. Select manual (or pressure cook button), high pressure, and set the time to 40 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally (this will take about 20 to 30 minutes).
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Line a large baking sheet with foil. Preheat the broiler.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Remove the pork pieces to a cutting board using a slotted spoon. Shred or chop the pork, and arrange the pieces in a single layer on the foil-lined baking sheet. Broil the pork for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the edges are crisp.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Arrange the pork in tortillas and garnish with the pickled onion, cilantro, salsa or diced tomato, and radishes, if desired.
6f8d2479-1557-4016-9fa8-39df7a32a7e1 Enjoy!
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Gather the ingredients.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Place one sliced onion at the bottom of the slow cooker.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Stud the pork roast with cloves (or put them in a small cheesecloth bag or tea strainer), if using. Season with salt and pepper.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Place the pork in the slow cooker on top of the sliced onion. Cover with the second sliced onion and add 2 cups of water.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Cover and cook on low 9 to 12 hours, or until the pork is very tender and falling apart.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Remove the pork roast from the pot. Remove and discard the cloves and excess fat and liquids along with bones if the roast was not boneless. You may also discard the sliced onions, if desired.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec When the pork roast is cool enough to handle, use a fork or your fingers to pull it apart until the entire roast is shredded. If you make pulled pork often, you might want to buy meat shredding claws.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Return the pulled pork to the slow cooker. Add the finely chopped onion, barbecue sauce, and optional red pepper flakes, and optional liquid smoke. Cover the pot and continue to cook on the high setting for 1 to 2 hours, or until the onions are tender.
7cb9e4a9-dbba-49e0-909b-7c5ff2f8a0ec Serve the pulled pork on large, crusty buns with your favorite barbecue sauce. Garnish with dill pickles, thinly sliced raw onion, and pickled banana peppers. Serve with crisp, homemade slaw, either piled on the pork sandwiches or on the side.
fc690293-8035-443f-aaa9-2d9ecc07250d Cut the pork into several large pieces and place the meat in the slow cooker with 1 cup salsa, the cumin, salt, and pepper to taste.
fc690293-8035-443f-aaa9-2d9ecc07250d Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours (or 4 hours on high) or until pork is fork tender.
fc690293-8035-443f-aaa9-2d9ecc07250d Remove pork from slow cooker, reserving liquid, and shred finely with a fork or using a food processor (fitted with the plastic blade).
