fc690293-8035-443f-aaa9-2d9ecc07250d Place shredded pork and reserved liquid in a large skillet and saute until liquid evaporates and pork starts to brown slightly. Stir in remaining salsa until desired consistency.
fc690293-8035-443f-aaa9-2d9ecc07250d For making pupusas, add pork and salsa back to a ​food processor, fitted with metal blade, and process with short pulses until finely ground.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Gather the ingredients.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Preheat oven to 250 F.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Using a small sharp, pointed knife, cut 10 to 12 deep slits/pockets into the top of the roast. The slits should be randomly spaced.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Stuff each slit with a sliver of garlic and a leaf or two of rosemary.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Season all sides generously with salt and pepper.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Once the oil is hot (you will see wisps of steam rising) add roast and brown well on all sides.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Transfer roast to a rack in a small roasting pan, place in the center of the oven and cook until the internal temperature is 145 F for 60 to 70 minutes.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Turn roast over at 30-minute mark.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Place roast on a cutting board, tent with foil, and allow to rest for 15 minutes.
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Slice and serve. (The meat should be a very pale pink color.)
c780f24f-4706-40ce-8203-f03a5fc0c7f5 Enjoy!
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Gather the ingredients.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Put the pork shoulder in the slow cooker, cutting the roast to fit if necessary.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Add the water or other liquid and sprinkle the pork lightly with kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, and cayenne pepper, if using.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Drain off the excess liquids, shred the meat with two forks, and discard any excess fat and bone.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Return the meat to the crockpot and pour about 1 cup of barbecue sauce over. Cover and cook another 1 to 2 hours.
868a5def-f162-47dc-9fff-4cc7e858e71e Serve the shredded barbecued pork with extra barbecue sauce on the side.
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Gather the ingredients.
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Preheat oven to 500 F. Mix all the spice rub ingredients together in a small bowl to form a paste.
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Smear it all over the roast. (You might have some left over, depending on the size of your roast.)
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Place the seasoned pork shoulder in a roasting pan with a rack and transfer it to the oven.
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Roast for 20 minutes, then lower the heat to 250 F and cook until your probe thermometer reads 140 F, which will take another 1 hour or so. The exterior of the roast will be a beautiful brown color.
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Remove the roast from the oven, cover it loosely with foil, and let it rest for 15 minutes (during which time the temperature will continue to rise until it reaches the target temperature of 145 F).
422e785f-273c-4c16-90e9-75d664336054 Slice, serve, and enjoy.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Gather the ingredients.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Place pork roast in the crockery insert of a slow cooker.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Add the sliced onion and Worcestershire sauce.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Cover the pork with water.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Cook on low all day (at least 12 hours).
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Remove roast, discarding cooking water. Save onions.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Fork-shred pork, discarding any fat and bones.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Return shredded meat and onions to the slow cooker.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Dump a bottle of your favorite barbecue sauce over it, and cook an hour or so on low until heated thoroughly.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Serve on heated buns.
83249504-5e7d-4919-937a-e6869c5ab623 Enjoy!
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Gather the ingredients.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 In a medium mixing bowl, combine rub ingredients into a paste. Coat pork shoulder with rub, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Preheat smoker and prepare for an 8-hour smoke. Make sure wood chips are soaked and drained before using them. Add charcoal and wood chips as necessary to keep the temperature low, or between 200 and 225 F/95 to 110 C. Smoke pork shoulder for about 8 hours or until internal temperatures reach 185 F/85 C.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Once the pork is cooked, remove from the smoker. Wrap tightly in foil and allow to sit for an hour. While pork is resting, prepare finishing sauce. Blend together everything except the ketchup.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Pour into a saucepan and add the ketchup. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Unwrap pork butt and shred. Combine pork with 1/3 of the table sauce. Keep warm and serve on white bread buns with remaining sauce on the side. Top with coleslaw.
acf74c98-64ec-4383-84f4-ac5efb19d7c9 Enjoy!
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Gather the ingredients.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Place the pork shoulder in the slow cooker. Add the water and sprinkle with salt and pepper. If desired, add chopped onions.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 hour. Turn to LOW and cook 7 to 9 hours longer, until very tender.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Remove roast and discard the fat and juices. Chop or shred the pork and then return the meat to the slow cooker.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Mix some barbecue sauce into the meat for flavor—about 1/2 to 1 cup of sauce. Cover and cook on LOW for about 30 minutes to 1 hour longer, until hot.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Serve as-is or on warm split sandwich buns with coleslaw and extra barbecue sauce on the side.
0fc94ed2-85d6-4485-bec8-b2da55482b4c Enjoy!
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Gather the ingredients.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 In a saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar, red pepper, 1 teaspoon of salt, and the 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Bring to a boil; remove from heat.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Save about 2 cups of the vinegar mixture for serving, and use the rest for basting.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Sprinkle the pork roast with salt and pepper; place on a foil-lined baking or roasting pan.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Roast, uncovered, at 275 F for about 7 hours, or until the roast reaches 200 F on a meat thermometer or oven probe inserted in the center of the thickest part of the roast.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Baste about every hour with the sauce saved for basting. The roast should be very tender.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Remove the roast and shred with 2 forks, discarding large pieces of fat.
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Warm the reserved sauce and pass at the table for people to spoon over their pork. (You can also serve barbecue sauce with this pork; it's delicious as a topping with coleslaw and pickle slices.)
56a1bf0d-f755-4a83-8f6f-102b75be3941 Serve with slaw, pickles, toasted buns, and baked beans or your favorite sides.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Lay a large sheet of heavy duty foil in a roasting pan (large enough to wrap the roast).
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Place pork roast on foil. Rub pork all over with garlic and seasonings. Arrange onion slices over top.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Wrap foil around the pork roast.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Bake at 350 F for about 4 to 5 hours, to about 185 F. The meat should be falling apart.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Let the roast cool a bit, then begin to shred with forks or chop, discarding as much of the excess fat as possible.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Sauté chopped onions in a little oil until tender.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Put shredded pork in a slow cooker or a large saucepan or Dutch oven.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Blend in vinegar and barbecue sauce, along with the cooked chopped onion.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Heat thoroughly on LOW setting or over low heat.
7686dc51-5518-4197-8a9e-22eb6962ed09 Serve hot on split toasted buns, coleslaw, and baked beans. Pulled pork is also excellent with potato salad or fries.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Arrange the sliced onions in the slow cooker. Top with the pork roast (netting removed), then sprinkle with salt, pepper and the chili powder.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Cover and cook for 8 to 10 hours, until tender enough to shred.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Meanwhile, in a saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the chopped onion and sauté it until the onion is translucent.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Add the garlic and sauté for 2 minutes longer.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Add the ketchup, lemon juice, brown sugar, molasses, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of crushed red pepper. To keep splatters to a minimum, cover with a splatter screen or cover loosely with a lid. Bring to a simmer and continue cooking for about 10 minutes.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Remove the cooked pork shoulder and place it on a cutting board or in a large bowl. Shred it and discard excess fats and liquids. Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker with some of the sauce from the saucepan. Cover and cook on the low setting for about 30 minutes to 1 hour longer.
fe564e3a-c4af-4db0-a3e2-d5093d30bf2e Serve the pork barbecue on split rolls with the remaining sauce on the side. Add coleslaw and dill pickle slices, along with your favorite sides.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Gather the ingredients.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af In a small pan, cook pork shoulder with just enough water to cover, for 15 to 20 minutes.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af When cool enough to handle, cut meat and fat into large pieces. Reserve the cooking water and let it cool.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Meanwhile, in a small skillet, sauté bacon until golden.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Add onions and sauté 5 minutes more, remove from heat and set aside.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Using a medium grinding blade, push the cooled pork pieces (fat and all) and potatoes down the chute of your grinder using a wooden pestle. Don't ever put your fingers in a grinder, running or not running!
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Add cooked bacon and onions, salt, pepper, marjoram, and peppermint leaves to the water the meat was cooked in and mix well.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Then combine with meat-potato mixture until just moistened.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Fry a small patty of meat and taste to make sure the seasonings are just right.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Using the procedure for stuffing Polish sausage, stuff the meat-potato mixture into the casings. Store refrigerated and covered up to two days until ready to cook.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Before cooking, prick sausage along the length of the link to allow air bubbles to escape. Otherwise, they will explode in the cooking water.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Place sausage in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 45 minutes.
cdd3af5f-0e8f-411c-bcc0-ee70496461af Enjoy!
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Remove the netting from the pork roast and cut in half. Sprinkle all over with salt and pepper.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Brown the pork on all sides in the oil; transfer the pork to the slow cooker, keeping the oil in the skillet.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Brown the onions in the same oil in the skillet, and then transfer to the slow cooker.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Combine the barbecue sauce, chipotle peppers with adobo, and Worcestershire sauce in a bowl or measuring cup; pour over the pork and onions.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Cover and cook on high for 4 1/2 to 6 hours, or until the pork is easily shredded with two forks.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Remove the pork to a large bowl. Using two forks, shred the pork.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed If the liquid in the crockpot is very thin, transfer it to a saucepan and boil for 5 to 7 minutes to reduce and thicken somewhat. Pour the liquid back into the slow cooker; add the shredded pork and continue cooking on low for about 20 to 30 minutes longer.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Serve the pulled pork on split toasted rolls with coleslaw and baked beans, along with macaroni and cheese, potato salad, or your favorite sides for barbecue.
d55a0f21-203e-4dde-9159-a2619a175aed Enjoy!
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Heat the oven to 350 F.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Lay a large sheet of heavy duty foil in a roasting pan. Place the pork roast on foil. Rub pork all over with garlic and seasonings. Arrange the medium onion slices over the top. Wrap the foil around the pork roast.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Bake the pork in the preheated oven for about 4 to 5 hours, or until the pork is very tender and falling apart. When the meat is cool enough to handle, remove the bones and begin to shred the meat with forks or chop, discarding as much of the excess fat as possible.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Sauté the chopped onions in oil until tender. Put the shredded pork in a slow cooker. Blend in the 1 cup barbecue sauce and vinegar, along with the sautéed onion. Heat the pork on LOW setting for about 2 hours, or until hot and flavorful. Or, simmer, covered, over low heat for about 30 minutes to 1 hour.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb While the pork is in the slow cooker, make the buns.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb In a bowl or large cup, whisk together the milk and yeast. Let the mixture stand at room temperature until the yeast has dissolved. Place the milk and yeast mixture, melted butter and beaten egg, flour, sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt in the bread machine in the order suggested by your bread machine manufacturer. Run on dough cycle. Remove finished dough to a lightly floured surface. Roll half of the dough to about 1/4-inch thickness or slightly more. Cut out with a 1 1/2-inch cutter. Or make your sandwiches slider-size using a 2-inch cutter.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Place the dough rounds on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Cover with a kitchen towel and let them rise for about 30 minutes.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Heat the oven to 350 F.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, or until browned. Brush tops with a little butter while they're hot. Let the buns cool completely on a rack.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Split the cooled buns.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Fill each small split bun with a little of the shredded pork, then add a small spoonful of slaw. Or serve slaw on the side with a small spoon. Replace the top of the bun and secure with a toothpick, if desired.
e633cc32-df9d-42de-a893-36bdc34b09cb Pass the mini pulled pork sandwiches on a tray with a small bowl of barbecue sauce and more slaw, if desired.
cf169333-15f9-41f9-8741-de5d574d41aa Place the pork shoulder roast in slow cooker; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
cf169333-15f9-41f9-8741-de5d574d41aa In a bowl, combine orange juice concentrate, brown sugar, nutmeg, and allspice; pour over the pork roast. Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 hour. Reduce heat to LOW and cook for 8 hours.
cf169333-15f9-41f9-8741-de5d574d41aa Before serving, skim fat from juices and pour the cooking juices into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring, until slightly reduced and the flavors are concentrated.
cf169333-15f9-41f9-8741-de5d574d41aa Whisk in the flour and water mixture and continue cooking until thickened. Serve the thickened juices with the pork roast.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Brown roast in a small amount of fat; place in a large roasting or baking pan.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Mix the next 9 ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over roast and cover with foil.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Bake the roast in a preheated 325 F oven, about 40 minutes per pound, or until done and very tender, basting occasionally with drippings.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Transfer pork roast to a cutting board.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Remove meat from the bone and chop or shred the pork into small pieces.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Season pork to taste with additional vinegar and hot sauce.
16060ee2-6bb0-4a43-ba81-28d8cf30ed1a Serve the pulled pork hot with sandwich buns, coleslaw, potato salad, and baked beans.
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Pre-heat oven to 300 F/150 C.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 In a heavy, cast-iron dutch oven or brazier, heat the oil over high heat, then add the pork and sear it thoroughly, using a pair of tongs to turn it. When a nice brown crust has developed on all sides of the meat, remove it from the pan and set it aside. To enhance the browning of the meat, pat off excess moisture with clean paper towels before searing it.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Add the carrots, celery, leeks, sliced fennel and garlic to the pot and sauté for 5 minutes or so, or until the leeks and fennel are slightly soft.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Now return the meat to the pot and add the tomatoes, juice, stock, bay leaves and peppercorns. Heat on the stovetop until the liquid comes to a boil, then cover with a tight-fitting lid and transfer the whole thing to the oven.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Cook 3 to 4 hours or until the pork is tender.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Remove pot from the oven and leave the meat in the braising liquid while you do the next step to make a simple pork jus.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Ladle out around two cups of the braising liquid and pour it through a mesh strainer. Skim off any fat from the top and bring the remaining liquid to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce for about five minutes, and season to taste with Kosher salt and freshly ground white pepper.​
27f0aaad-5ef6-4d60-9186-c74e7228aec7 Remove the pork from the liquid, slice across the grain, arrange slices on warm plates with plenty of pork jus and serve right away.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Gather the ingredients.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d In a small mixing bowl, combine all rub ingredients.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Coat pork shoulder with seasonings and cover with plastic wrap.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Refrigerate one to three hours.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Preheat smoker and prepare for an eight-hour smoke.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Make sure wood chips are soaked and drained before using them.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Add charcoal and wood chips as necessary to keep the temperature low, around 225 F/110 C.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Smoke pork shoulder for about eight hours or until internal temperatures reach 185 F/85 C.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Once the pork is cooked, remove it from the smoker.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Wrap tightly in foil and allow to sit for an hour.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Afterward, unwrap the pork butt and shred.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Combine pork with 1/3 of your favorite table sauce.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Keep warm and serve on white bread buns with remaining sauce on the side.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Top with coleslaw.
866d6dee-8768-40ed-810b-450ca1542d9d Enjoy!
8f1f9d25-61d7-4322-8c84-a05657eca34a Wash the beef, pork and pork fat. Drain and place in a large pot. Add bay leaf, allspice, black pepper grains and pour in sufficient cold water to cover the meat.
8f1f9d25-61d7-4322-8c84-a05657eca34a Simmer until the meat is tender. Remove the pan from the heat. Place the rolls on the stock to soak. Fry the peeled and thinly sliced onions in a little oil in a frying pan until tender.
8f1f9d25-61d7-4322-8c84-a05657eca34a Once the meat has cooled, remove it from the stock and then, together with the roll and fried onions, grind this mixture twice in a meat grinder. Season to taste with salt, pepper, nutmeg, and crushed garlic. Mix these ingredients thoroughly. The pâté mixture must be moist. If it is too dry, add some of the stock from the meat cooking.
8f1f9d25-61d7-4322-8c84-a05657eca34a Grease a small mold or baking pan with oil and sprinkle with bread crumbs. Transfer the pâté mixture to the pan, filling it to 3/4 of its height. Bake for approximately 40 minutes in an oven heated to 350 F/180 C. Allow the baked pâté to cool before unmolding or slicing and serving. If you like, serve this with Polish cranberry-currant sauce.
163cd151-fb2b-4d8b-865b-0e517046386f Arrange onion slices in the bottom of a large slow cooker.
163cd151-fb2b-4d8b-865b-0e517046386f Rinse the roast and pat dry; leave it in its net; place on the onions.
163cd151-fb2b-4d8b-865b-0e517046386f Combine remaining ingredients in a cup; pour over the roast.
163cd151-fb2b-4d8b-865b-0e517046386f Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
163cd151-fb2b-4d8b-865b-0e517046386f Turn to low and cook for 6 to 8 hours longer.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Gather the ingredients.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Pat the meat dry with paper towels. Trim off any large pieces of excess fat.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Mix the rub ingredients together, and thoroughly coat all sides of the pork, and into any folds in the meat
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Preheat oven to 215 F.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Place the pork, fattier side up, in a large Dutch oven.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Pour 1/3 cup water into a small, ovenproof ramekin, and add the liquid smoke.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Place this ramekin in the Dutch oven next to the meat. As the pork roasts, this will introduce moisture to the cooking environment, as well as add a subtle smokiness to the meat.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Cover tightly with the lid, and place in the center of the preheated oven.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Roast pork for 12 hours, or until fork tender. If you're using a thermometer, the internal temperature will be around 200 degrees F. Turn off the oven and allow the pork to rest for 1 hour before removing.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Place the pork on a cutting board and use forks to pull it apart into small pieces.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Taste for salt and spice level, and adjust the seasoning.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Serve warm or room temperature on soft rolls splashed with some of your favorite barbecue sauce.
3352cd64-5f93-491f-ad5e-7bc4baa1bcc7 Enjoy!
93ab1ef6-cc44-4610-831d-0f3e315b74fe With a sharp knife, make several shallow long cuts along the roast. Rub with salt and liquid smoke. Wrap with banana leaves until completely covered. Tie securely with twine. Cover with aluminum foil and place it in the refrigerator overnight.
93ab1ef6-cc44-4610-831d-0f3e315b74fe The next day, remove foil and place it in a shallow pan with water. Place in smoker at about 220 F for 6 to 8 hours.
93ab1ef6-cc44-4610-831d-0f3e315b74fe When done, remove leaves and shred pork. Traditionally this is served with poi and sweet potatoes, but it's great on a sandwich too.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Trim any visible fat from the meat and pat it dry with paper towels. Don't rinse the meat; that step is not necessary and can spread bacteria around your kitchen. Set the meat aside.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa In a small mixing bowl combine the caraway seed, salt, and pepper; rub this mixture over roast.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa In a 4- or 6-quart pressure cooker, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat or use the brown function.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Cook the meat until brown on all sides, adding more oil, if necessary. Remove the meat from the pressure cooker and set aside. Drain off the fat.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Place the trivet or an oven-proof rack in the pressure cooker. Return the meat to the pressure cooker and add the onion, water or broth, and the apple cider.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Lock the lid in place and bring the cooker up to high pressure; cook for 45 minutes.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Allow the pressure to come down naturally, then carefully remove the lid. Transfer the meat and onion to a serving platter; keep warm by covering with foil.
21589664-fb06-4d96-8e97-b810ee9618aa Add the apples to the pressure cooker and bring to boiling. Cover loosely (do not lock lid) and cook over medium heat about 5 minutes or until apples are crisp-tender. With a slotted spoon, remove the apples to the serving platter with the pork roast and onions. Serve immediately.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 In a large, heavy pot, heat two tablespoons of the lard or oil. Brown the meat, turning to brown on all sides.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 Take the pot off the heat and add the orange juice. Pour in enough broth to cover the meat. Add the garlic, the bay leaf, and the chunks of onion. Place the pan back on the stove and bring the liquid to a boil.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 Turn the heat down and let the meat simmer, covered, for about 2 and 1/2 hours. At the end of the cooking time, take off the lid and turn up the heat to help evaporate the excess liquid.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 When the liquid is gone and just the meat and fat are left, remove the bay leaf and any remaining pieces of garlic or onion. Use tongs to break up the meat into smaller chunks (golf ball-sized or smaller) and allow them to fry, adding a little more lard or oil when necessary. Sprinkle salt on the meat as you fry it to season your carnitas and help keep spattering fat to a minimum.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 Your delicious little meats are ready when the edges of the chunks of meat become browned and crispy. You can serve them as-is (in larger chunks), or you can remove the pieces from the pot and chop them up into smaller morsels—or even shred them—to use as a filling for tacos or burritos.
41ce7475-b3e1-4d61-9767-f206b211a763 Store any leftovers well covered in the refrigerator; reheat slowly in a pan on the stove (they will probably not need any more oil added) or in a microwave oven.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Trim pork roast of excess fat.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Heat oil in large pot or skillet.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Season pork with salt and pepper.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 When the pan is nice and hot, place pork into skillet and sear all sides. This will take about 5 to 6 minutes.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Set slow cooker for high heat.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Remove pork from skillet and place into slow cooker.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Pour vinegar and water (or broth) over roast and turn to make sure the vinegar reaches all sides.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Cook on high for 1 hour, reduce temperature and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours, or until roast is tender enough to pull apart with your fingers.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Once cooked, remove roast and discard liquid.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Leave slow cooker on.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Pour in barbecue sauce.
59071d7c-25f3-4db2-82e9-8fe1fd784b92 Shred pork roast into small pieces and return it to the slow cooker. There should be enough barbecue sauce to coat the meat but not so much as to make it runny.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 450 F.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Remove the netting from the pork and trim off some of the fat if needed from the pork.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Combine the salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, and dried thyme and mix well. Rub all over the pork.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Heat a heavy skillet over high heat and sear the roast for a few minutes. Repeat, searing the pork butt on all sides. If using a cast iron or heavy oven-safe skillet, leave the pork in the skillet. Otherwise, transfer the pork to a roasting or baking pan.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Cover with foil. Put the roast in the oven, reduce the temperature to 325 F, and roast for 3 hours.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Remove the foil and continue roasting for another hour, or until the roast is pull-apart tender.
3c2b05e6-3895-48f0-8023-c5a648dabbd0 Let cool for a few minutes before shredding using two forks. Toss with barbecue sauce or serve as-is. Enjoy!
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Remove excess fat from the pork. No need to remove all of the fat — just the really big pieces. Cut the pork into 3 or 4 pieces and sprinkle all over with salt and pepper.
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Place all the ingredients in the crock pot and cook on low for about 7 to 8 hours, or until pork is very tender and can be pulled apart easily with a fork. Alternatively, you can cook on high for 4 to 5 hours.
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Preheat the broiler.
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Shred the pork, and place in on the baking sheet. Pour the sauce from the crock pot over the pork and mix gently.
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Broil meat, turning once, until brown and caramelized around the edges, or desired amount (about 5 minutes). Be sure to watch the oven and pull the tray out quickly after caramelizing to prevent it from drying out.
8ff0919f-86e3-4094-a321-2e9dd84c6dd8 Serve immediately with warm with rice, beans, and tortillas. Garnish plate with a squeeze of lime and chopped cilantro if you have on hand.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Gather the ingredients.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 In a medium mixing bowl, mix rub ingredients into a paste. Coat pork shoulder with rub, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hours. Preheat smoker and prepare for an 8 hour smoke.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Make sure wood chips are soaked and drained before using. Add charcoal and wood chips as necessary to keep the temperature low, around 225 F/110 C. Smoke pork shoulder for about 8 hours or until internal temperatures reach 185 F/85 C.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Once the pork is cooked remove from the smoker. Wrap tightly in foil and allow to sit for an hour.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Afterward, unwrap pork butt and shred.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Combine pork with 1/3 of your favorite table sauce. Keep warm and serve on white bread buns with remaining sauce on the side.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Top with cole slaw and favorite finishing sauce.
4abae015-3f89-4654-8c93-59877259e799 Serve and enjoy!
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Gather the ingredients.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d In a large pot brown pork roast in 2 tablespoon oil.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Once browned, add garlic and onions. Cook for 10 minutes on med-low heat until green onions are limp.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, tomato juice, Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper. Simmer without the lid for at least 6 hours stirring occasionally to prevent scorching.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d After 6 hours, remove pork roast and let cool.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d While the pork roast is cooling combine the ground sausage, beef, minced celery, and bread crumbs. Shape the mixture into meatballs.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Drop them into the sauce. Simmer for one hour.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Tear or shred the pork roast, discarding excess fat. Add the meat to the sauce.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Cook 1 medium package of spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and rinse.
1ff0cdf1-7981-4752-9730-7ab04527c30d Serve sauce over spaghetti.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Place the chopped onion in a large crock pot. Season the pork roast with salt and pepper on all sides, and place it on top of the onions.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Press the garlic slices into the pork roast in various places, making slits with a knife if necessary.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Stir the cumin, oregano, green chilies, ham base, and aji panca (if using) into the water, and pour over the roast.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Layer the lime and orange slices over the roast. Cover and turn crock pot to high.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Cook for 2 hours on high then reduce temperature to low and cook for 6 more hours.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Remove meat and reserve. Strain liquid through a colander into a saucepan. Discard contents of the colander.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Simmer cooking liquid on the stove until it's reduced to about 1 cup.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Preheat oven to 400 F. Shred meat, removing excess fat. Stir reduced sauce into meat.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Spread meat onto a baking sheet, and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, until slightly browned and heated through.
4e2ef3e3-0947-4992-a71e-e719c4fb9805 Serve with lime wedges, and garnish with cilantro, if desired.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Gather the ingredients.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Cut trimmed roast in half, if necessary, and place in the crock pot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Combine all ingredients except flour and water; pour over roast.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Remove roast from the liquids.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Place a sieve over a large measuring cup and pour the liquids through it.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Return the pineapple solids to the slow cooker along with the pork.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Add water to liquids in the measuring cup to make 1 3/4 cups. Pour into saucepan.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Blend flour and cold water together to form a smooth paste. Stir into hot reserved liquid. Cook and stir until thickened. Pour over roast; serve with rice, if desired.
a4d70e5c-6337-4aa3-b8b0-84a620f16749 Serve and enjoy!
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Gather the ingredients.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Fold a piece of unbleached muslin, about 12 inches long by 8 inches wide, lengthwise and tightly stitch a seam across one of the short ends and continue along the open side. Keep the stitching about a 1/8-inch from the edge of the material. The short side of the seam can be curved in a semicircle to give the finished product a rounded end.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Turn the casing inside out so that the stitching is on the inside. Set it aside until you are ready to stuff it. As an alternative, you can use large collagen casings.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Put the cubes of liver, pork, and fat through the fine blade of a grinder separately.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Then mix and grind together.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Sprinkle the onion, powdered milk, pepper, salt, paprika, sugar, marjoram, coriander, mace, allspice, and cardamom over the ground meat and mix thoroughly with your hands.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Put the mixture through the fine blade of the grinder twice more. Chill the mixture for 30 minutes between grindings.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Pack the mixture into the muslin casing. It helps to fold the open end down over itself to get things started. This makes it easier to reach the bottom. Pack the meat as firmly as possible.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Stitch the open end closed or firmly secure it with a wire twist tie.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd In a large kettle, bring enough water to a boil to cover the liverwurst by 2 or 3 inches. Put the sausage in the boiling water and place a weight on it to keep it submerged. Two or three large dinner plates work just fine.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd When the water returns to a boil, reduce the heat so that the water barely simmers. Cook for 3 hours.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Drain the hot water and replace it with an equal quantity of ice water.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd When the liverwurst has cooled, refrigerate it overnight.
a38a4c22-48ba-47f5-af54-f3c4201fbffd Remove the muslin casing and enjoy!
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Gather the ingredients.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Cut the pork into chunks. Fairly big pieces are traditional, but if you prefer, cut the pork into bite-sized pieces.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Put the pork in a large pot and add enough cool water to cover it by about 2 inches (approximately 5 to 6 cups). Bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that forms in the pot.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Remove the stem and seeds from the chiles, and peel the garlic. Add the chiles, garlic, and salt to the pork.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Reduce the heat to maintain a steady simmer, cover, and cook until the pork is fork tender, about 90 minutes. Alternatively, put the covered, ovenproof pot in a 350 F oven for the same amount of time.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 After the pork has cooked, add the hominy and the Mexican oregano. Continue cooking at a simmer until the flavors blend and the pork is very tender, for another hour. Add additional water, if necessary, to keep the moisture at a good level, return the mixture to a boil and reduce back down to a simmer when needed. Add salt to taste.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Serve the pozole in deep bowls.
d1ebe4f4-e189-4701-aedd-43a6601e0772 Garnish with chopped cilantro, scallion, radish, and green cabbage. If you like, squeeze fresh lime juice on top. Enjoy.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Gather the ingredients.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Trim visible fat from pork.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Toss the pork cubes with flour to coat well.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Combine salt, thyme, crushed coriander seed, and pepper; reserve.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Drain liquid from beans into a 2-cup measuring cup; add boiling water to make 1 1/2 cups. If you'd like, you can use chicken broth instead of water.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Layer vegetables and pork pieces in the slow cooker in the following order, sprinkling each layer with the seasoning mixture: half of each of the potatoes, onions, pork, beans, and carrots.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Repeat with remaining vegetables, pork and seasoning mixture for a second layer.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Pour liquid over; dot with butter.
136ab8cf-d4f1-469d-bc61-4b59e239f778 Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours or until meat and vegetables are tender.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Gather the ingredients.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Combine the cabbage, onion, garlic, brown sugar, vinegar, and thyme in 4 to 5-quart slow cooker.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Sprinkle the pork roast with salt and pepper and brown in olive oil in a heavy skillet, about 5 to 6 minutes total, turning until browned on all sides. (You don't have to brown the pork if you don't want to; in that case, just sprinkle it with the salt and pepper and put it in the crock pot on top of the vegetables.) If you do brown the pork, add about 1/4 cup water to the skillet to remove the drippings, scraping the bottom of the skillet. Add this liquid to the crock pot.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Place the pork in the slow cooker on top of the vegetables; cover, and cook on Low for 7 to 8 hours or until the pork registers at least 145 F.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Remove the pork from the slow cooker; cover and let stand for 10 minutes before slicing to serve with the cabbage mixture.
2c7bf2e1-83e6-402a-8c21-7a06d0817f42 Enjoy!
d0e654fe-5034-4bb1-93eb-67f538a16001 Place the pork roast in a crockpot sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, then add minced garlic and water.
d0e654fe-5034-4bb1-93eb-67f538a16001 Cover and cook on LOW for 9 to 11 hours, or until pork roast is very tender. Lift pork out of the slow cooker with a slotted spoon.
d0e654fe-5034-4bb1-93eb-67f538a16001 Shred and serve with warmed flour tortillas, with dishes of shredded cheese and your choice of topping ingredients at the table.
c7ff57d6-f29b-4cfb-af7c-d40ec365bbb0 Place reserved smoked pork butt cooking liquid into a Dutch oven or large pot. Add all remaining ingredients except potatoes and meat. Add additional water or broth, if necessary, so ingredients are covered by 2 inches. Bring to a boil and simmer, 30 minutes, partially covered.
c7ff57d6-f29b-4cfb-af7c-d40ec365bbb0 Add potatoes and return to a boil. Cook, partially covered, until tender, 20 to 30 minutes. Add meat and heat through. If you have leftover cabbage and potatoes from the smoked pork butt dinner, you can add them to the soup along with the meat. Portion into warm bowls and serve with crusty bread.
6f540cb8-53e6-497e-8e51-c0bfd9657ae0 Place smoked pork butt in a Dutch oven or stockpot. Add water to cover and add brown sugar. Cover pot and bring to a boil.
6f540cb8-53e6-497e-8e51-c0bfd9657ae0 Reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, for 2 hours. (A pork butt requires about 40 minutes per pound.)
6f540cb8-53e6-497e-8e51-c0bfd9657ae0 Halfway through the cooking process (after 1 hour), add the cabbage and peppercorns. Bring back to the boil, reduce the heat, and continue to simmer.
6f540cb8-53e6-497e-8e51-c0bfd9657ae0 About 30 minutes before the cooking time is up, add the whole potatoes. Return to the boil, reduce the heat, and continue to simmer, partially covered, until the potatoes and meat are tender.
6f540cb8-53e6-497e-8e51-c0bfd9657ae0 Transfer the meat to a cutting board and slice. Arrange on a platter with cabbage wedges and whole potatoes.
False False
